â€œI donâ€™t know what you want me to do Sirius,â€ heâ€™d asked, feeling equal parts annoyed and apologetic.

Sirius had sighed, rubbing his eyes like talking with Regulus was exhausting. Maybe it was.

â€œI want you to fight back,â€ Sirius had said finally, the first words heâ€™d spoken to Regulus all day. â€œFight back.â€

Regulus answered before he could think better of it, before he could remember who he was speaking to;

â€œWhatâ€™s the point?â€

Sirius had looked at him then, looked at him like he had never seen him before. Like he had no idea who he was. And maybe he didnâ€™t.

Â 

â€œRegulus?â€

Heâ€™s on his feet instantly, arms stiff at his sides as his mother opens the door to his room. She is a slight woman, dark hair pulled back tightly, dark robes pooling at her feet when she stands. She has Siriusâ€™s eyes.

â€œMaman,â€ he says stiffly, unsure which of her faces intends to show itself today.

Her eyes run him over before stepping forward, taking his chin sharply between her index finger and thumb. â€œYou look thin.â€

He doesnâ€™t know what to say to that so he says nothing, remaining compliant and silent as she looks him over.

â€œAnd your hair too long.â€

He sometimes envies muggles, who have to put so much energy and intent behind all their actions, who have to walk everywhere, and pick everything up, and wait for things to finish. It all means so much less to wizards. Itâ€™s all too easy. Too quick. The words are barely out of his motherâ€™s mouth before he feels the icy fingers of her magic. Curls falling lifeless at his feet. He looks down for a moment, mournful.

â€œBetter,â€ his mother steps back, admiring her handiwork. â€œYour grades are good?â€ she asks sharply, the change in topic sudden but not surprising. Walburga is rarely wasteful with her words when it comes to her children.

â€œYes.â€

She nods. â€œCome down, supper is ready. Tomorrow your cousins will be here.â€

Regulus feels his stomach clench as she walks towards the door.

â€œWhen are they coming?â€ he hopes she doesnâ€™t hear the tension in his voice.

â€œNoon,â€ Walburga tosses over her shoulder, already in the hall.

Regulus lets out a shaky breath, then lifts his hand to his newly cut hair. Well, cut is a bit generous. The hair is short and prickly and close to the scalp. Not completely gone, but about as short as it is possible to go. It shouldnâ€™t ache. Heâ€™s not sure why it does.

He vanishes the hair on the floor on his way out the door.

Â 

He wants to fly but thereâ€™s no room. Not here in the city. Hidden behind layers and layers of secrecy charms. So he goes for a run instead.

The air is crisp, the pavement freshly cleared of snow. Regulus can see his breath freeze outside his lips as he forces it out of his lungs again and again. Heâ€™s not sure how long heâ€™s been gone for, a while, if the aching in his muscles is anything to go by. Still, itâ€™s not enough, still he canâ€™t get himself to still, to quiet down. So he keeps going. Block after block. The sun is now fully in the sky, a bright day for December, though it has no warmth.

He doesnâ€™t allow himself to think about anything except taking the next step, except fighting the weakness in his legs. He blocks out the world beyond London. Beyond Grimmauld. He doesnâ€™t think about Hogwarts. Or about anything that transpired within it. And whenever those thoughts or feelings try to drag themselves to the surface he gets a new box. He digs a new hole. He buries himself deeper and deeper.

He can barely stand when he gets home.

Â 

â€œMaster Regulus has missed his breakfast,â€ Kreacher says unhappily as Regulus drags himself into the kitchen, showered and clothed and light headed.

â€œSorry Kreacher,â€ he says as he sits down at the work table, watching the elf rush about, preparing for lunch.

â€œKreacher is told by Mistress that he cannot feed Regulus now, that he will have to wait for his cousins.â€

Regulus nods slowly, resting his chin on his folded arms, and taking in a deep breath. It smells of caramelized onions and roast beef. His stomach responds accordingly.

Kreacher shoots him a look over his shoulder, but Regulus doesnâ€™t move.

â€œIâ€™ll wait,â€ he says, reassuring the elf.

But Kreacher only shakes his head. â€œI cannot be feeding Master Regulus, you understand? I have been told so, so I will not,â€ Regulus is opening his mouth to once again affirm that he understands when a plate of bread and cheeses appears in front of him.

â€œHe would like to help Master Regulus very much but he simply cannot go against his Mistresses wishes.â€

Regulus blinks, lifting his head up off his arms, a small smile pulling at his mouth.

â€œThanks Kreacher,â€ he reaches for the food, that much hungrier now that it was in front of him.

â€œDo not be thanking me, I am doing nothing,â€ but he swears he sees the elf wink.

Regulus has always liked the kitchen the best, maybe because itâ€™s the the warmest place in the house, or because Kreacher always gives him some of what heâ€™s cooking. Probably, he imagines, itâ€™s because the rest of his family never really come in here. Not even Sirius, when he was still around. Itâ€™s a nice escape. A place where he can breathe a little easier.

Itâ€™s partially underground, the window above the sink level with the grass in the garden, the walls made of an untreated stone, the fireplace enormous and deepâ€”allowing for all manner of cooking and brewing. The floor and table are unvarnished woodâ€”everything in this space is soft and natural and lacking the artifice that is strewn throughout the rest of the house. There are no portraits, no gaudy embellishments, nothing is covered in gold or ivory. Regulus imagines that this is what a real home is meant to feel like.

He forces himself to relax as he eats, forces his shoulders down from his neck, forces his muscles to let go.

Inhale. Exhale.

Nothing matters.

Heâ€™s okay. This is okay. Heâ€™s done it a dozen times before, thereâ€™s no reason for it to be any different now.

The feeling, when it comes, is like falling into to a frozen lake but slowly. It starts at his head and trickles through his body, his hands freezing on their way to his mouth and then suddenly dropping back to the table.

Stand up.

And he does. Before he can think about the fact that the voice isnâ€™t his own or that an unnatural calm has suddenly settled around his bones.

Turn around.

â€œOh wittle Wegulus,â€she presses the tip of her wand to his forehead and he wants to move, he does, wants to knock it away, but he canâ€™t. He canâ€™t move. He can barely think.

â€œYou never learn do you?â€ She draws the wand down his nose, his lips, flicking it off the edge of his chin.

On your knees, says the voice in his head.

His body drops with a painful crack onto the hard stone floor. He can feel himself tremble, hear the laboured breath in his ears. Sheâ€™s in his head. In his skin.

â€œWhat trick should he do next?â€ she stalks around him, hand running over his shaved head. Rodolphus leans forward, elbows on his knees, face coming into view. Regulus canâ€™t turn his head, canâ€™t follow his cousinâ€™s path, canâ€™t look away from her husbandâ€™s empty eyes.

â€œBark,â€ he says, an ugly smile stretching his face.

Bellatrix laughs.

Bark, commands the voice.

Bark, bark, bark.

And he does. On his knees, he barks.

â€œEnough enough,â€ Bellatrix stops in front of him, still laughing.

Stop.

He goes quiet, throat raw, struggling to push back against her presence inside his head and failing. He fails every time.

Bellatrix sticks out her foot, sleek black leather pushing into the centre of his chest. He barely notices. His ribs already feel too tight. His lungs barely able to breathe.

â€œKiss it,â€ she says, amusement clear in her voice, Rodolphus snorting in the background.

Kiss it.

He tries. Really. Tries to pull his will power out from behind the veil of the spell. But itâ€™s nothing but a distant yell. A muffled voice. So he does as heâ€™s told. Doesnâ€™t he always?

â€œOh here you are,â€ itâ€™s his mother, he canâ€™t see her because Bellatrix hasnâ€™t ordered him to look, hasnâ€™t allowed him to take his mouth off her shoe. But he doesnâ€™t need to. He would know her voice anywhere.

They did.

Over and over again.

By the end of the summer Regulus had felt raw with it, like his body had been turned inside out.

He hears the sounds of his motherâ€™s shoes as she walks away.

â€œPity,â€ Bellatrix throws him off her foot, â€œlooks like play timeâ€™s over.â€

He gasps as the spell lets go, as he comes crashing back down into his body, catching himself on his hands as they tremble along with the rest of him.

â€œCome now little cousin, we donâ€™t want to keep your maman waiting.â€

He canâ€™t lift his head, itâ€™s too heavy, the room spinning. He watches their feetâ€”Rodolphus getting out of his chair, the pair of them sauntering into the hallway.

Inhale. Exhale.

Inhale. Exhale.

He barely has time to turn his head before heâ€™s retching all over the kitchen floor. He doesnâ€™t know how their can be so much when heâ€™s barely eaten. Youâ€™d think after all this time heâ€™d be used to this feeling, but it never gets easier. Being invaded. It never gets easier and he never gets stronger.

Regulus collapses onto his back, chest heaving as he tries to focus on the soothing feeling of the cold floor on his skin. Itâ€™s only a few moments before Kreacherâ€™s worried face appears above him.

â€œMaster Regulus must be getting up now,â€ he says, placing a small hand on Regulusâ€™s back and helping him peel himself off the ground. With the snap of his fingers thereâ€™s a glass of water being pressed to Regulusâ€™s lips. He drinks, gratefully.

â€œThank you,â€ he croaks. â€œSorry about theâ€”â€œ he gestures to the puddle of sick beside them but Kreacher only shakes his head, snapping his fingers again, leaving behind a clean floor.

â€œWhat is mess to a house elf?â€

Regulus almost smiles.

â€œRegulus!â€ his motherâ€™s voice rings out. She doesnâ€™t scream, she commands. There is a difference.

Inhale. Exhale.

â€œMaster Regulus?â€

â€œKreacher will send in soupâ€”â€œ

But Regulus shakes his head. â€œNo, best not to change anything. You know how they are.â€

Kreacher only stares back at him helplessly.

Regulus keeps his hand pressed to the wall all the way down the hallway to steady himself, only taking it off the minute he comes into view.

â€œMerlin youâ€™re so big, I canâ€™t believe it most of the time.â€

There are appetizers on the table, but Regulus isnâ€™t sure he can trust himself not to throw them back up just yet so he chooses to focus on his plate. Eyes following the pattern, hands clenched in his lap.

Inhale. Exhale.

Nothing matters.

â€œYou were saying Rodolphus,â€ his mother gives him a detached once over before returning her attention to her niecesâ€™s husband.

â€œMinchum has agreed to put more Dementors around Azkaban, heâ€™ll announce it next week, new security measures. Put all the troublesome Death Eaters in their place.â€

Chapter End Notes

I love this chapter but I'm also nervous about it so hopefully it wasn't too much

I just can't imagine living in that house to be anything but traumatizing honestly, plus I feel like it makes Regulus make more sense as a character

ALSO: I hear you guys with the happy ending, I do, really, buuuuuut, I can't promise you that. This fic is gonna be pretty canon compliant. That being said, I can promise you that they definitely don't hate each other at the end of this and they like, know that, if that makes sense?

Always thank you for comments!

Chapter 11

James knows heâ€™s overprotective. Really, he does. Heâ€™s not sure why. Not sure where it comes from. Heâ€™s never lost anyone, never had anyone walk away from him, he hasnâ€™t lived through what Sirius has. What Remus has. Thereâ€™s no reason for him to have this deep need to protect when nothing has ever been taken from him. But he does. If you wanted to be cute, and sometimes his mother does, you could call it the Gryffindor in him. But itâ€™s more than that. It scares him sometimes, if heâ€™s honest. Itâ€™s tooâ€¦intense. He feels it about Sirius, about Remus, about Peter. This need to be at their sides. To make sure theyâ€™re okay. To destroy anything and anyone who tries to touch them. Because theyâ€™re his. His to protect. His to keep. His to love. Itâ€™s too much. He knows it is.

Itâ€™s worse with Regulus.

He doesnâ€™t like Snape. Whatever Lily says, he doesnâ€™t see much thatâ€™s redeemable about the kid. But heâ€™s glad that Filch showed up when he did, glad that he pulled them apart. â€œI donâ€™t know,â€ he sighs, running a hand through his hair.

â€œOh no, trouble in paradise?â€

James is not new to detention. In fact, heâ€™s rather old hat at it. Usually it involves cleaning, on occasion, when McGonagall is feeling particularly spiteful, it also includes essay writing. James is already in the Come and Go Room when Regulus gets there. He came right from detention. He sits at the end of the bed, elbows on his knees, hands clasped between them. He doesnâ€™t look up when Regulus comes in. Doesnâ€™t quite know how to handle himself.

â€œReg?â€ he gets to his feet but doesnâ€™t move, justâ€”just trying to get some sort of response. â€œIs any of this getting through to you?â€

â€œThe sentiment?â€ James repeats, uneasily.

Regulus has his eyes on the painting, it looks like heâ€™s concentrating, trying to puzzle something out. He was trapped in that house, trapped in Slytherin but he wasnâ€™tâ€”he wasnâ€™t one of them. Not really. Not his Reg. And right now James just needs him to prove it. Needs it desperately. â€œI never really thought of it like that,â€ Regulus says finally, slowly, â€œitâ€™s just always seemed magical to me,â€ he shakes his head, eyes dropping back down. â€œThat sounds stupid Iâ€™m sure.â€

â€œReg, I get it, I do, but you need toâ€”you canâ€™tâ€”you canâ€™t go using that word, okay? â€œPromise?â€

â€œI promise James,â€ grey eyes unwavering. And James trusts him.

â€œOkay,â€ James murmurs, resting his chin on Regulusâ€™s head. â€œOkay.â€

The boy is warm and soft in his arms and it makes Jamesâ€™s bones ache. It frightens him, how much he feels about Regulus. And he finds himself wondering, for the first time, if maybe itâ€™s wrong.

Chapter End Notes

Two things:

1) Okay, I don't want anyone selling organs - or babies - so I have come up with an epilogue that I actually really like and will end this story on a relatively nice-ish sweet-ish but still canon compliant-ish note. How, you may ask? I guess you'll have to find out.

2) I also want to make clear that like when I say "canon compliant" I don't mean that I'm all the sudden gonna turn this into a Jily fic, like Jily is going to happen, but the focus is always going to be on James and Regulus

I don't know if this chapter actually feels slow or if that's just me, but I promise that it was necessary set up and the next two chapters there's a lot more action/drama

It's really super fun and nice that you guys are so invested in these characters and what happens to them and I love reading your opinions so forever thank you!

Chapter 12

Chapter Notes

French translations will be in the end notes!

TW Referenced mass acts of violence (I'm so sorry idk how to tw this)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Dear James,

I will try to refrain from nagging you too much about your horrendously sparse letters lately, but let me just remind you that I literally birthed you from my body, so you could perhaps put in a bit more effort darling.

I enclosed the jumper you asked for (it was curled in a heap under your bed of course), tell me, does Remus let you boys get away with such poor cleanliness in his room? Should I write him for tips?

In any case, your father and I were both thrilled to hear about your win against Hufflepuff, heâ€™s thinking about coming down for your next match so youâ€™ll have to let me know if thatâ€™s an idea youâ€™d like me to get out of his head. I know how very uncool having your parents doting on you can be (I should let you know, he has gotten his old school scarf and Gryffindor jumperâ€”yes, the one with the roaring lion on the frontâ€”ready to go just for the occasion). Heâ€™s working quite a lot these days, I think he just wants something to look forward to. Not that Iâ€™m trying to guilt you into letting us come or anything (I too may have pulled my Gryffindor apparel from the basement, but that is purely a coincidence).

Your cousin Daphne is having a baby, I can tell youâ€™re already pretending you donâ€™t know who she is but I promise you youâ€™ve been introduced to her on several occasions. Iâ€™ll be heading to Diagon Alley to pick out a present and I was thinking Iâ€™d get some new trainers for you and Sirius, you two were both looking ratty over Christmas. So you can be expecting those in the near future.

You see James Potter, this is a letter, look at all those words. Donâ€™t you feel so much better informed now? I can feel our mother-son relationship strengthening with each sentence (be warned, if you reply to me with four sentences or less your father and I will be showing up to your quidditch game in matching lion jumpers whether you want us to or not).

Give my love to Sirius and the boys!

Sincerely,
your gracious, youthful, incredible mother

Â 

Mum,

Please. Iâ€™m begging you. Anything but the lion jumper. ANYTHING. You can come, sure, but be a little more chill about it okay? Like maybe wear a trench coat, some hats, sunglassesâ€”Iâ€™m just throwing out ideas here!

A month after they get back from Christmas holidays the image of a skull eating a snake is projected into the sky over downtown London. Clearly magical. Chapter End Notes

1) "I'm afraid of hurting you. Because I love you. I think I always will."

2) "I don't deserve it."

3) "I don't deserve you."

Hello beautiful people!

Does this chapter work? I sure hope so, but it's becoming one of those things where I feel like I've been looking at it for so long that I don't even know what it is anymore.

Your comments are cupcakes and sunshine! Thank you!

Chapter 13

Chapter Summary

Chapter Notes

TW violence (it isn't graphic or anything but I feel like there's just more than usual in this chapter)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

â€œMoony, I swear to Godâ€”get back in bed,â€ Sirius stands at the door, arms crossed over his chest as he stares down a haggard looking Remus.

â€œWeâ€™ll get you breakfast you loon. You look like shite, get back in bed.â€

â€œMoons, heâ€™s got a point,â€ James finishes tying his trainers and stands up. â€œThereâ€™s no class, no assignments due, give yourself a break for once, yeah?â€

He says it with such conviction that James canâ€™t help laughing. â€œJesus, youâ€™re really out for blood today, huh?â€

Remus only grumbles, turning his glare back on Sirius.

Regulusâ€™s hand stills. â€œDid he hurt you?â€

Yes, James almost says, because it feels true. But thereâ€™s an edge in Regulusâ€™s voice that gives him pause. He opens his eyes to look at the boy across from him.

â€œWould it matter?â€

â€œYes,â€ he says without hesitating. â€œIâ€™d kill him.â€

â€œDonâ€™t think thatâ€™d help, but I appreciate the offer.â€

Regulusâ€™s eyes narrow. â€œJamesâ€”â€œ

â€œNo,â€ James says quickly. â€œNo. Not me. But someoneâ€¦important.â€ He sees Remusâ€™s face, standing in their darkened room, the pain in his eyes. He hears him begging Snape to leave. He hears him screaming.

â€œFuck,â€ James hisses, rolling onto his back and bringing his hands up to his face. â€œI donâ€™t know what to do. Heâ€”it was bad Reg. It was so fucking bad.â€

â€œDo know why he did it?â€ Regulus asks eventually.

James lets out a humourless laugh. â€œMerlin, I donâ€™t know. He was upset butâ€”all heâ€™s said to me is that he wasnâ€™t thinking.â€ Even saying that out loud makes the anger boil his blood again.

â€œHe wasnâ€™t thinking,â€ Regulus repeats slowly. And then, all of the sudden, heâ€™s sitting up.

â€œReg?â€ James asks, a little startled, propping himself on his elbows.

Regulusâ€™s legs are crossed, his expression distant.

â€œHey,â€ James reaches out, tugging lightly on his shirt. â€œSorry, do you not want to talk aboutâ€”I realize heâ€™s your brother and things areâ€”â€œ

Regulus shakes his head. â€œNo, itâ€™s fine,â€ and then; â€œListen, I donâ€™t know what happened,â€ he runs a hand nervously through his short curls, â€œbut he might not mean what you think he does when he says he wasnâ€™t thinking.â€

Jamesâ€™s brows draw together. â€œIâ€™m going to need you to explain that.â€

He nods, clearly expecting it. â€œYou remember how I said that sometimes I have to lock parts of me up? That I canâ€™tâ€¦feel everything?â€ his eyes are focused on some distant point on the bed.

â€œYeah,â€ James says slowly, â€œI remember.â€

â€œSirius was the one who taught me that trick.â€

James feels his eyebrows raise. â€œTrick?â€

â€œWe wereâ€”I donâ€™t knowâ€”Seven and eight? Maybe he was nine, I canâ€™t remember. He pauses, James watching him pick at the blanket in front of him, trying not to think about Sirius in Dumbledoreâ€™s office today, trying to hold back his tears.

â€œSo he told me,â€ Regulus goes on eventually, â€œtold me that he just took all the things he didnâ€™t want to feel or think, that he didnâ€™t want our mother to seeâ€”â€œ

â€œTo see?â€ James interrupts.

â€œYeah,â€ his voice goes a little wonky. â€œWalburga is very good at Legilimency. Itâ€™s hard to hide things in that house.â€

James can feel the horror on his face. â€œJesus Christ.â€

Regulus flashes him a grim smile before he goes back to staring at the bed. â€œYeah, anyway, you can kind ofâ€”hide things, inside yourselfâ€”we used to practice. We got good at it. And James has no idea what to do withâ€¦any of that. The idea of Sirius and Regulus hiding out in Grimmauld Place teaching themselves how not to feel is heartbreaking, and he wonders, not for the first time, how either of them survived it.

â€œIâ€™m not saying that to excuse whatever it is that he did,â€ Regulus goes on. â€œBut when he says he wasnâ€™t thinking, itâ€™s just, it means more coming from him, thatâ€™s all,â€ he smiles weakly. â€œHeâ€™s the best of us, really. James feels his eyes go wide. â€œAre youâ€”do you think Sirius is right? About your uncle? That they had him killed for reaching out to him?â€

Regulus shrugs. â€œI donâ€™t know, but, I wouldnâ€™t be surprised. You donâ€™t just get to walk away from the House of Black. Thatâ€™s not how it works.â€

Itâ€™s all too much. How do people handle these things? What are you supposed to do? Because James has no fucking idea. He pulls himself up to sit properly, bending his knees on the mattress and hanging his head for a minute.

He doesnâ€™t want to talk about Sirius anymore.

â€œDo you still have to do it?â€ he asks instead.

â€œDo what?â€

â€œHide things from yourself?â€

Regulus looks at him for a long time. â€œYeah,â€ he says eventually. â€œI had to hide you.â€

â€œMe?â€

Regulus nods and then looks away. James can see him chewing on the inside of his cheek. â€œItâ€™s part of the reason I was such a wreck when I came back. James watches him, eyes running over the ends of his hair, the tip of his nose, the way his lips quirk. He tries to breathe through everything going on inside him. Tries to hold it all.

He reaches out, makes sure Regulus can see, makes sure he goes slow enough that he could pull away.

â€œCâ€™mon here,â€ he says roughly, linking their fingers together and giving Regulus a light tug. He comes, the pair of them failing back onto the bed, Regulus in Jamesâ€™s arms, face burrowing in his neck.

â€œJe tâ€™aime,â€ Regulus whispers, kissing behind his ear, â€œje tâ€™aime, je tâ€™aime, je tâ€™aime.â€ Every word is punctuated with a kissâ€”quick and sweet. Under his jaw, along his neck, Regulusâ€™s breath warm against his skin. Jamesâ€™s eyes flutter closed.

â€œEnglish,â€ the word punches out of him. â€œJust once. Say it in English once.â€

Regulus stills but doesnâ€™t pull away, lips still brushing against James in an accidental way that sends shivers down his spine. â€œI love you,â€ Regulus says, stare determined even as his voice shakes. â€œIâ€™m sorry.â€

James doesnâ€™t understand that, doesnâ€™t know how to make sense of it over the blood rushing in his ears, the heart beating in his chest.

â€œDonâ€™t apologize,â€ he lifts himself up to Regulusâ€™s mouth. â€œDonâ€™t ever apologize for loving me.â€

Chapter End Notes

Hello lovelies!

Remus is heartbroken and James has basically divorced Sirius but Regulus said I love you so it all evens out in the end, right?

Honestly, I always find the fallout from The Prank so stressful. Because I, like Euphemia Potter, am a firm believer that James and Sirius belong together (platonically but also they are soulmates)

Thank you for your wonderful comments! Always appreciate it!

Chapter 15

When Remus Lupin was five years old a monster broke into his bedroom and bit him. It sounds ridiculous doesnâ€™t it? Some story made up to scare little kids. Remus isnâ€™t sure he would believe it himself if it hadnâ€™t happened to him. But itâ€™s there on his side, between his ribs and his hips, the unmistakable imprint of teeth. The skin white and puckered, the ugliest, he thinks, of all of his scars.

I donâ€™t think theyâ€™re ugly, Sirius had said to him once, third year. I think theyâ€™re beautiful.

The infuriating thing about Sirius Blackâ€”well, one of manyâ€”is that he can just say things like that. Without thinking. Without caring. Everything about Sirius is carelessâ€”his hair, his flying, his words. Sirius acts like nothing matters. It should be annoyingâ€”obnoxiousâ€”but really, itâ€™s addictive. He worries that it isnâ€™t hormones.

That itâ€™s the wolf.

That one day heâ€™ll lose control and eat Sirius whole.

When Remus Lupin was five years old a monster broke into his bedroom and bit him. It was his fatherâ€™s fault. His father who hates werewolves. Who wants them dead. Ended up with one for a son. Talk about family dysfunction.

Sometimes Remus wishes it had happened laterâ€”that he could have had more time with his parents before all they saw when they looked at him was tragedy. He expects it would be easier to be angry with them. But he isnâ€™t. Mostly he just hurts for them. Theyâ€™re good people, they probably would have been good parents. If things had been different.

He knows that they tried for a while, to have another kid. He supposes thatâ€™s another thing he should be angry about. But he just thinks itâ€™s too bad that it didnâ€™t work out. They deserved a do-over.

When Remus Lupin was five years old a monster broke into his bedroom and bit him. It was the worst pain he had ever felt in his lifeâ€”that is, until he transformed for the first time. Locked in the cellar. No windows. No light. Stone floors and stone walls. His father had revarnished the door with wolfsbane. Every time Remus touches it his skin burns, even when he isnâ€™t a wolf. Itâ€™s a trick his father has used a few more timesâ€”on his office, the bedroom. Precautions. Incase Remus gets out on some full moon. Incase he comes for them in the night.

Most children ask their parents to check for monsters under their beds. Or in their closets. But thanks to Fenrir Greyback, Lyall and Hope Lupin never had to check. The monster had come and gone and Remus never thought it likely any others would visit. Because he wasnâ€™t a little boy anymore. Not really. Not after that. He was a wolf. â€œOkay,â€ Lily says as she drops abruptly into the seat across from him, making Remus jump. The books that had been in her hands fan out in front of her. â€œWhat is going on?â€

â€œRemus.â€

â€œLily.â€

â€œWe are not,â€ Remus says, feeling particularly defensive about that last point. Because, the truth is, he has been avoiding James and Peter, but he hates that heâ€™s doing it, and hates it even more that people have noticed. Especially Lily.

â€œYou are. I tried to ignore it but I canâ€™t bear it anymore. What happened?â€

â€œOi!â€ he tries to snatch it back but heâ€™s too slow.

â€œI have not been sulking,â€ he crosses his arms over his chest and then, realizing how little that helps, quickly uncrosses them.

Lily arches a disbelieving eyebrow. â€œYou have. You all have.â€

â€œCome on,â€ Lily says suddenly, scooping up their books in her arms and getting to her feet.

Remus is still feeling rather stunned by the whole thing. â€œYou ever shown James that trick?â€ he asks eventually, the smoke is dry and scratchy in his lungs. Remus nods. â€œProbably a good idea to keep it that way, I think heâ€™d combust.â€

â€œMy dad used to smoke,â€ Lily says eventually. â€œThe smell, I donâ€™t know, makes me feel betterâ€”calm. Thought it might help.â€

Remusâ€™s watches her for a minute, the evening growing dimmer. â€œIâ€™m sorry,â€ he says eventually.

â€œNot sure itâ€™s quite the same as your dad dying,â€ he offers her a weak smile but she doesnâ€™t return it.

Remus grimaces, looking down at the cigarette in his hand and flicking the ash off just for something to do. â€œI donâ€™t know. Not sure I know how.â€ He inhales too quickly, suddenly spluttering and coughing, leaning forward as his eyes water.

â€œWoah, breathe cowboy,â€ Lily pats him on the back, laughing.

â€œWhat?â€ he asks, momentarily confused as he wipes the last of the tears from his eyes. â€œWhy?â€

â€œJames trusts too easily,â€ Remus isnâ€™t interested in pleasantries, though he does make sure to lower his voice. He watches Regulusâ€™s eyes widen and feels his stomach drop. He really had been hoping he was wrong about this. â€œHe sees the good in everyone, even when there isnâ€™t any.â€

â€œKnow that from personal experience Lupin?â€ the younger boy snaps back, quickly recovering from his shock.

â€œNot a threat,â€ Remus says with confidence. â€œItâ€™s a promise. â€œI donâ€™t want to hurt him.â€

â€œGo on then,â€ Remus says eventually, waiting another beat before he heads for the Great Hall. â€œIdiots,â€ he mutters under his breath, â€œthe both of us.â€

Chapter End Notes

Hello beautiful people!

Oh hey, it's wolfstar ft. Lily Evans.

I just really needed some more Sirius/Remus interaction, so hopefully you guys felt the same!

Your comments are pancakes and hot chocolate with really big marshmallows (fun fact: I have never once spelt marshmallows right on the first try) !

Chapter End Notes

Hello beautiful people!

Finally, we get some Jegulus in this Jegulus fic!

Also, so many scenes in this chapter were just completely rewritten, like originally that bit in the supply room involved a lot more kissing and the chapter ended with James drunk and Remus comforting him, it was truly a wild ride.

I am so glad that people care about this fic because I care about this fic so thanks as always for your comments, love to know what you think!

Chapter 17

Chapter Summary

Summer '76 babyyyyy

â€œI thought about writing one for every day,â€ he laughed, rubbing the back of his neck. â€œBut it seemed excessive.â€

â€œWell I knowâ€”I know I canâ€™t send you post, over the summer, so, I thought Iâ€™d give them to you now.â€

â€œWell,â€ his mum says, once they all find themselves back in the living room. She stands by the front door, Sirius across the room, leaning against the entrance to the kitchen, â€œthis is lovely. Chapter End Notes

Hello lovelies!

Oh my God this chapter is the bane of my existence, like, just, cannot get it right. But here we are! Mostly because I'm impatient and want to work on the next one.

THANK YOU for being so nice all the time it is truly so lovely to read your comments! Hope you're all having a good day!

Chapter 18

Chapter Summary

It's Lily-he-has-her-eyes-Evans

Chapter Notes

TW: very very vague reference to suicide or suicidal thoughts

TW: discussion about homophobia

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Lily lies on her bedroom floor, record player on in the background, music drifting over her. Itâ€™s brutally hot, too hot to move, or think. Her fingers drag lazily through the beige carpet that covers every room in the house except the bathroom and kitchen. Her father always used to talk about tearing it out, but he never got around to it. Sheâ€™s glad that he didnâ€™t. It feels like home nowâ€”after spending all year surrounded by stone, she comes back to soft floors and warm colours.

â€œLily!â€ a shrill voice cuts through the music.

She doesnâ€™t move. Doesnâ€™t open her eyes. Maybe if she lies very, very still they wonâ€™t be able to find her.

Barely two minutes later the door to her room is being thrown open. â€œJesus Lily, couldnâ€™t you hear me?â€

She sighs, cracking one eye open to peer up at the towering figure of her sister, dark hair still in curlers, the mint green nightgown sheâ€™s had since she was thirteen brushing against her knees.

â€œNo, sorry,â€ Lily says mildly, not bothering to move. This, predictably, infuriates Petunia.

â€œYou said you would help,â€ everything with her sister is a lightly veiled guilt-trip.

You said you would help.

You owe me.

For the magic.

You said you would help.

Petuniaâ€™s hen do is about as awful as one would expect. â€œ-selfish. Spends all her time at that posh boarding school, barely ever comes home. Petunia has to manage everything.â€

Lily takes a step back, feeling as though sheâ€™s just been hit, her face burning. The two women are still talking but she canâ€™t hear anything, the buzzing in her ears growing too loud. Without thinking she pushes her way through the house, sliding out the back door and into the garden. The fresh air feels good on her hot skin, pulse going a mile a minute as she presses her back against the house and inhales, eyes falling closed.

Sheâ€™d only been twelve when her father died. She would have come home, she would have been here, if she could have been. But it had happened so suddenly. A car accident. No warning. No preparation. There are no telephones at Hogwarts, if her mother was a witch she could have used the floo, but, of course, she isnt. Lily hadnâ€™t had an owl then, because her mother didnâ€™t know where they would keep it during the summer (and honestly, they couldnâ€™t afford it). Which meant that the only way to contact her, was through the Muggle post.

Letters addressed to Hogwarts do make it there, but it takes time. More time than an owl. So by the time Lily found out about her fatherâ€™s death, by the time all the arrangements were made for her to be able to floo her mum, to speak with her, a week had passed. Her father was buried. The funeral over.

Even now Lily feels the ache of that pain cut through her. How fucking devastated she had been. How lonely. Sometimes being Muggle born feels like floatingâ€”with no anchor, no port. She belongs nowhere. In the magic world sheâ€™s a person without a historyâ€”magical families have legacies and friendships that stretch back millennia. They know who their great-great-great grandfatherâ€™s were (sometimes theyâ€™ve even spoken to them, if they have portraits). Lily has none of that, no link to the magical world, no familiar faces, sheâ€™s on her own. In the Muggle world she finds it hard to relate to people. Thereâ€™s a whole part of reality that they know nothing about, a whole part of her that they know nothing about, and sheâ€™s never sure how to bridge that gap.

She startles at the sound of the screen door opening, looking over to find her sister stepping out into the yard. â€œWhat are YOU doing out here?â€ Lily repeats petulantly. Even in the dark she can see her sister roll her eyes.

â€œIâ€™d be careful if I were you,â€ there is danger in her tone.

â€œHeâ€™s not a match for you,â€ Lily says anyway.

â€œDoes he just look right then? Is that it? Very domestic, very proper, straight-laced.â€

â€œSomething like that.â€

â€œDad would hate him,â€ which is the wrong thing to say on every level. But the wine is still thrumming through her and so is the pain from conversation she overheard in the kitchen.

â€œIâ€™ll talk about whatever I want.â€

â€œYou werenâ€™t hereâ€”â€œ

â€œThatâ€™s not my fault!â€ Lily steps forward now, off of the wall, into her sisterâ€™s space, trying to restrain her childish desire to kick and scream and throw a temper tantrum.

Not my fault.

â€œIt is your fault,â€ Petunia jabs her cigarette at her. â€œYou chose that school.â€

â€œYou could have stayed here, you could have stayed with us. But you chose to go off and leave us behind. So you werenâ€™t here. â€œYou had mum!â€ Lily interrupts, finding her voice. â€œI had no one, I was alone.â€

â€œHa!â€ Petunia laughs cruelly. â€œMum was bloody catatonic. I had to force her to get out of bed, to eat, to shower. Lily doesnâ€™t know what to do with any of this, her chest a storm of feelings she canâ€™t work through. â€œWhy didnâ€™t you tell me?â€ she whispers finally.

Petunia sends her a sharp look, eyes bright under the stars. â€œYou. Werenâ€™t. Here,â€ another pause, and then; â€œSo yes, Vernon is boring and predictable. They never talk about that apart.

The part where their father was twice over the legal limit.

The part where it was his fault.

â€œMaybe dad would have hated him,â€ Petunia goes on eventually, throwing her cigarette on the ground and turning back towards the house. â€œBut to be perfectly honest I couldnâ€™t care less about that manâ€™s opinion,â€ the pain in her voice makes the words difficult to believe. And with that she goes back inside.

Chapter End Notes

Chapter 19

Chapter Notes

You know it's a Regulus chapter when there are all these TWs honestly I'm sorry

TW: Referenced sexual assault
TW: Animal abuse (nothing is graphically described cause that would be TERRIBLE but you know it's happening)
TW: Child abuse (via magic)

** Also, I realize I operate under the assumption that everyone knows the story of Achilles and Patroclus, but incase you do not, real quick thing you might want to know for this chapter (Iliad spoilers???) : Achilles gets angry at Agamemnon (for being just generally garbage), and refuses to fight for him, the Greeks get crushed by the Trojans without him so Patroclus dresses up in Achilles's armour to scare the Trojans away and that's how he gets killed by Hector (if you do know the story and are like "girl this is a terrible summary" I know and I'm sorry)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Thereâ€™s no point in screaming.

It took Regulus a long time to learn that. He expects thatâ€™s Siriusâ€™s fault. As long as he was here, there was always the chance that someone might come.

No one comes anymore.

Regulus is on the ground, feeling as though heâ€™s had the skin flayed from his bones. He canâ€™t tell where the borders of his body end anymore. He is just pain. No longer stuck behind the lines of his fingers and toes. He has no shape. He is bleeding out

â€œUp.â€

â€œGet. Up.â€

Heâ€™s seen Voldemort before. Not up close. But he has seen him. It was at Grimmauld Place, his mother had offered it up for some meeting. Regulus had waited on the stairs, just to seeâ€”see who everyone kept whispering about. The man who had the wizarding world in such an uproar.

And then his gaze had found Regulus on the landing. Regulus had wondered, at the time, if it was a spell, silent, wandless, but a spell. Because the cold feeling that had rushed along his bones then had been so startling heâ€™d nearly fallen down the stairs.

He knew now, standing in front of Voldemort properly, that it hadnâ€™t been. They say that the eyes are the windows to the soul. Well, Regulus doesnâ€™t know what it is heâ€™s looking into, but it doesnâ€™t feel like a soul. Doesnâ€™t feel alive at all.

Theyâ€™re in the dining room, itâ€™s smaller than the one at Grimmauld Place, homier, making this all feel that much more absurd. That much harder to believe. Itâ€™s dark out, the floating candles above the table the only light in the room, illuminating the masked faces that line the walls. Lucius is here, so are Bella and Rodolphus, his mother and father. Voldemort stands at the head of the table, in dark robes, Regulus in front of him, several inches shorter and feeling like a child. The man smiles, itâ€™s not a pleasant expression.

â€œRegulus Arcturus Black,â€ his voice is higher than Regulus expected it to be, the sound causing the hair to stand up on the back of his neck. Voldemortâ€™s head twitches to the side. Like a snake, sizing up its prey. Regulus is used to it. Heâ€™s been looked at like that before.

â€œMy Lord,â€ the words feel like theyâ€™ve come from someone elseâ€™s mouth.

â€œYour family has been a great source of support for me during these long years. It is their wish for you to receive this honour, to join us here, and out of my gratitude to them I have agreed. â€œWe will become one, you and I, you will feel me when I need you, when I call, when I am strong, when I am weak. This is not empty symbolism. It connects us,â€ another smileâ€”this man is all teeth. Regulus takes it back, not like a snake. Like a wolf. â€œWe are a family.â€

â€œYou are young,â€ he lets his sleeve drop back down over his forearm, â€œso I will give you the mercy of reconsidering, if you do not feel you can give yourself to me as you must, as this demands. As your parents have.â€

His dark eyes take hold of Regulus and keep him still. Unable to move. To think. To see anything but him.

â€œYou have a choice,â€ like two empty pits in his face, dark and swelling, and pulling Regulus under. Drowning him. â€œWill you choose us?â€

Achilles should have put the armour on himself.

Youâ€™re Beautiful.

He should have accepted that some things canâ€™t be changed, some endings canâ€™t be rewritten.

Okay Reg. Yeah, Iâ€™m yours. Youâ€™re mine too.

He should have fallen on his sword before he let Patroclus go out there. Knowing how dangerous it was. Knowing what could happen.

I love you.

Say it again.

He told James, told him ages ago that he wasnâ€™t a very good person. Told him over and over again. That he wouldnâ€™t be able to do the right thing. To stop this. To end this. He still canâ€™t.

I love you Regulus.

He never should have been with James in the first place, and not even because of his family, because of the politics, but because of who Regulus is; mangled, and damaged, and compromised. Maybe if it had happened earlier, if he had known James beforeâ€”before he let his family twist him up.

I just want you to know that Iâ€™ll be there if you need me. Iâ€™ll always be there.

Regulus had let himself pretend that things could be different. But he won't do that anymore. This is who he is, this is who he was always going to be, and he wonâ€™t get James killed trying to fight fate. Heâ€™ll only lose. They always lose.

He swallows, eyes still holding Voldemortâ€™s stare, unwavering.

â€œI choose you.â€

â€œAnd then I was fourteen, it didnâ€™t make a difference. I barely even registered that anything was wrong. I let it happen, I always let it happen. â€œOkay, well heâ€™s also going to dieâ€”â€œ

â€œI deserved all of it,â€ heâ€™s crying now, voice cutting itself up on its way out of his mouth. â€œI deserved it. I deserved it. I deserved it.â€

â€œYou didnâ€™t Reg.â€

â€œI wish you didnâ€™t.â€

You could roll up your sleeve.

Regulusâ€™s hands are twisted-up in the back of Jamesâ€™s shirt and he pulls him closer even though thereâ€™s no space between them.

â€œThen Iâ€™ll protect you back.â€

Soon.

â€œHow what works?â€ Regulus sniffles, only pulling away from James enough to speak.

â€œBeing with someone.â€

â€œI hate you,â€ the words are out of his mouth before he can stop them.

James sighs, kissing the top of his head. â€œYeah, I know that too.â€

Chapter End Notes

Hello lovelies!

Listen, for a Regulus chapter that wasn't that bad.

I mean, that last scene still makes me cry every time I read it, but no one was actively trying to harm him so for Regulus that's really a win.

I hope you're all having a great day!

Chapter 21

Chapter Summary

Snuffles

Chapter Notes

tw: referenced/implied child abuse (specifically involving food at one point)

tw: internalized homophobia (but like, self-aware internalized homophobia?)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Thereâ€™s a sort of high that comes from not giving a shit. At least if you do it right. Itâ€™s almost like a switch in Siriusâ€™s brain that he can justâ€¦flick. And then itâ€™s as if nothing mattersâ€”what people think, what they want from him. Itâ€™s better than sex, honestly.

The come downâ€™s a bitch though.

He used to think he could control itâ€”the switch. It wasnâ€™t until last year, until he told Snape about Remus, until he watched the horror wash over Jamesâ€™s face, that he realized how stupid that was.

To this day he canâ€™t really remember that momentâ€”the moment he decided to blow-up his whole life. It certainly hadnâ€™t occurred to him that that was what he was doing. It had all just seemed so pointless for a momentâ€”the secrets, the fearâ€”and then it had seemed funny. The idea of Snape face to face with a werewolf.

Not a werewolf.

His brain corrects itself.

Moony.

Remus.

The boy with the beautiful eyes and the shaggy hair and the smile thatâ€™s afraid of itself.

That boy.

Mine. Mine. Mine. Mine.

He hadnâ€™t had any of those thoughts that night though. Hadnâ€™t felt any of that ache. Heâ€™d been alone for hours by that point, slowly growing more and more numb. Until he didnâ€™t mind so much that his uncle was dead. That it was probably his fault. It was so like his mother honestly, to kill someone just to get back at him. Just to punish him. Heâ€™d stayed alone until he could make himself not feel it anymore.

And then Snape had been there, making some crack about Remus being sick. About how frail he was. How pathetic. Sirius could remember laughing at that. Because it was funny, honestly, to have Severus Snape calling Remus Lupin weak. When at that very moment he was mere minutes away from turning into a full-fledged monster.

Not a monster.

Moony.

Remus.

Mine. Mine. Mine. Mine.

In that moment the only thing that had felt funnier than Snape not knowing what an ass he was making out of himself. Was him knowing exactly how much of an ass he was making out of himself. So heâ€™d told him where to go, if he wanted to know why Remus was always so sick. And as heâ€™d watched Snape walk away heâ€™d felt that familiar high. Of doing the thing he wasnâ€™t supposed to do. Of not giving a shit.

The comedown really is a bitch.

Â 

Itâ€™s early, too earlier, honestly. No one in their right mind would be up this early, but then, James has always been a little more nuts than people give him credit for. At least in Siriusâ€™s opinion.

Heâ€™s sitting in the stands, watching the Gryffindor team finish their first practice since tryouts. He watches them land, watches them huddle around James on the ground. Maryâ€™s the easiest to pick out even from this distanceâ€”dark hair braided down her back, hip cocked, arms crossed. He canâ€™t help but wonder how thatâ€™s going for Jamesâ€”getting her under control. Maryâ€™s a brilliant player, and honestly the funniest person Sirius knows, but sheâ€™ll cause problems just for the hell of it. And sheâ€™s certainly not afraid to push James around.

Sirius tears his eyes away from the ground, grabbing hold of his own broom and heading down to the pitch. Him and James areâ€¦honestly, he doesnâ€™t really know. Theyâ€™re friendly, he guesses. But even thinking the word makes him scrunch up his face like heâ€™s smelt something bad. Him and James have never been â€œfriendlyâ€ before. They were strangers and then friends and then brothers. There was no intermediate stage of awkward polite small talk.

Sirius hates it.

He gets down to the field just as the team starts breaking up and heading towards the locker rooms. He stays in the shadows of the stands, watching James talk to one of the newer players. Sirius canâ€™t hear what heâ€™s saying, but he imagines itâ€™s some sort of pep talk. James looks fully in his element.

This is a big deal, James being Captain. Itâ€™s one of those things heâ€™s always talked about, even back in first year. He had so many dreamsâ€”Sirius had never met anyone like that before. Someone who knew what they wanted and thought they could get it. He came from a family with very specific requirements. You had your life dictated to you and you coloured within those lines. The Black family didnâ€™t have dreams, they had expectations.

James claps the kid on the shoulder, and as the younger boy starts to pull away Sirius steps forward, trying to pretend he isnâ€™t nervous. Because he shouldnâ€™t be. Because he never used to be.

â€œOi! Wanker with the bad hair,â€ he calls out, causing James to swivel around, confusion soon replaced by a surprised grin.

â€œNah, it canâ€™t be, look at you! All up and dressed and itâ€™s not even eight a.m yet. Iâ€™ve never been so proud,â€ James wipes a nonexistent tear from the corner of his eye.

â€œYouâ€™re about as funny as the Bloody Baron you know that?â€

â€œI happen to think the Baron is plenty funny, thank you very much.â€

â€œI love it when you prove my point.â€

James snorts, shoving Siriusâ€™s shoulder playfully before his eyes fall on the broom in his hands. He looks back at Sirius, brow arched in question.

â€œI was wondering if you had any energy left for a quick fly?â€ his causal tone almost sounds convincing.

â€œTwatâ€

Chapter End Notes

I really was going to end this chapter with Remus forgiving Sirius 100% but apparently I just hate happiness. Still, we're getting there. The Prankâ„¢ is just so shitty.

James shakes his head but doesnâ€™t speak. Canâ€™t. Doesnâ€™t even know where to start. He expects Sirius to turn around and leave but he doesnâ€™t, and after a few more moments of silence he walks back down the stairs, stopping in front of James.

â€œI love him,â€ James says pathetically, because he has nothing else. Because itâ€™s the one thing that he knows without a doubt to be true. â€œItâ€™s soâ€”so strong and soâ€”so much. And Iâ€”I hope youâ€™re wrong, I need you to be wrong. Because I canâ€™tâ€”â€ his voice cracks, unwilling to finish that sentence.

Siriusâ€™s expression softens. â€œJesus James,â€ he pulls him into a hug and James goes willingly, sagging against his best friend. â€œYou really have terrible taste in men.â€

James laughs wetly. â€œI donâ€™t know, I did alright with you lot.â€

Sirius snorts, but when he speaks his voice is sad, and James doesnâ€™t know whose heart hurts moreâ€”his or Siriusâ€™s.

â€œYeah,â€ Sirius croaks, â€œyou did alright with us.â€

Chapter End Notes

Hey! Hi! Hello!

I feel like this chapter has the most teenager-y angst which was fun.

Also Remus Lupin is 100% that friend that throws your phone out the window when you start trying to drunk text your ex (this is a James Potter call out)

I hope you liked it, as always, super appreciate all the comments and love to know what you think!

Chapter 23

Chapter Summary

Chapter Notes

OKAY, listen, I may have taken some creative liberties in this chapter and given the Shrieking Shack a front door (partially because in my head the Shrieking Shack is a pre-existing abandoned house that Dumbledore uses for Remus not one he builds for him, because that makes more sense to me even though I know it's not canon - but I digress) hopefully that doesn't bother people too much!

also...

Please, please, please.
