Itâ€™s one of the things that Sirius likes best about him, one of the things that allowed him to relax around James. Knowing that he wasnâ€™t just going to walk away.

But right now itâ€™s fucking infuriating, because if it hadnâ€™t been clear already that the guy heâ€™s seeing is a complete douche-canoe, now heâ€™s out here making James miserable at Christmas.

Christmas for Christâ€™s sake!

James loves Christmas. James loves Christmas so much that heâ€™s managed to make Sirius love Christmas, which before having met James, Sirius would have thought was impossible. Everything was terrible at Grimmauld Place, including holidays.

â€œIâ€™m going to goâ€¦Iâ€™m gonna go find the girls,â€ Sirius says eventually, because heâ€™s pretty sure if he spends another second in this compartment heâ€™s going to blow-up at James. James who is currently nodding his head.

â€œAlright,â€ he says, not tearing his eyes away from the window.

It figures that James would have terrible taste in romantic partners. Things had been looking okay there for a while with Evans. Sirius skulks along the train, not really trying to find the girlâ€™s compartment, and maybe a little bit trying to run into Remus on his Prefect rounds. He enters an emptier train car, most of the compartment doors thrown open, revealing vacant chairs. Itâ€™s a stupid thought.

The sound of murmured voices pulls him up short. Obviously itâ€™s bad to eavesdrop blah blah blah, but then, if youâ€™re too stupid to cast a silencing charm or a muffliato whose fault is it really if youâ€™re overheard?

Sirius creeps slowly towards the voices, theyâ€™re too quiet for him to make out but it definitely sounds like a girl and a guy. He pauses just before the doorway of one of the only closed compartments, making sure to hang back enough that his silhouette wonâ€™t be seen through the glass.

â€œI want to keep in contact with you,â€ are the first words Sirius is able to pick out. His brain spinning for a moment when he realizes that itâ€™s Mary whoâ€™s speaking. â€œTwo weeks is a long time, I wouldnâ€™t want you to go forgetting about me.â€

Oh.

â€œI donâ€™t think forgetting you is likely.â€

Siriusâ€™s feet freeze. He knows that voice. Heâ€™d know it anywhere.

Itâ€™s Regulus.

â€œThis isnâ€™t a fucking joke Mary.â€

â€œHilarious? Did he tell you he has the fucking Mark? Regulus doesnâ€™t answer, of course he doesnâ€™t, silence has always been his shield. Anger Siriusâ€™s. The louder their mother got the quieter Regulus always became.

â€œGod I donâ€™t know, yes, a little. I donâ€™t know. Just go away.â€ His words are muffled by his hands. Sirius considers going to find James who is more likely to provide him with answers anyway, but for some reason his feet wonâ€™t move.

He looks so small,

He looks so lost.

â€œYou said you felt like you were drowning,â€ the words come out of him before heâ€™s even really decided to say them. Theyâ€™ve been on his mind since the Veritaserum. Heâ€™d been meaning to find Regulus, to ask him about them, but it just somehow never felt like the right time.

â€œNot nowâ€”weâ€™re not doing this now,â€ Regulus mutters. Heâ€™s still shaking from earlier and for a moment Sirius wonders if heâ€™s crying but when Regulus drops his hands his eyes are dry.

His brother is looking at him with his real face. Maybe that doesnâ€™t make any sense, but itâ€™s true. Heâ€™d always felt more like a parent than a brother to Regulus, maybe thatâ€™s why it hurt so much. That when things started to get bad, really bad, Regulus disappeared. Chapter 31

Chapter Summary

Mary: the meaning is not known for certain, but there are several theories including "sea of bitterness," "rebelliousness," and "wished for child."

Chapter Notes

Tw: Referenced sexual assault

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Mary isnâ€™t an idiot. She knows that she isnâ€™t alright. Between her inability to sleep for more than a few hours at a time and her new paranoia that sheâ€™s constantly being followed, sheâ€™s definitely spiralling in a downward direction. Still, sitting on the roof of her childhood home blowing smoke into the pink evening sky, sheâ€™s finding it hard to care. Well, actually, sheâ€™s been finding it a bit hard to care in general lately.

Itâ€™s too cold for this but she canâ€™t stand being inside anymore. She feels trapped. Trapped by the bedroom she grew up in, more full of the kid she used to be than the person she is now. She barely recognizes herself these days, barely remembers caring about the boys whose posters are hung-up on her walls, or the names of her stuffed animals or the girls who gave her the friendship bracelets still sitting on her dresserâ€”carelessly taken off one day and never put back on.

She breathes in deep, filing her lungs with all the smoke she can, letting it burn, holding it in until she starts to cough and choke. She sits up, throwing the nearly finished cigarette off the edge of the roof and letting the tears squeeze out of the corners of her eyes. She doesnâ€™t really cry, hasnâ€™t in a long time, this feels good though, even if it isnâ€™t the same.

She hears him coming before she hears the window sliding open.

â€œI thought dad fixed this?â€ Damian says, pulling himself through like he was invited.

â€œHe did,â€ Mary nods at the window screen sheâ€™d popped out and thrown further down the roof.

Damian lets out a low whistle as he settles next to her. â€œYouâ€™re gonna get hell for that.â€

Mary only shrugs, looking out at the quickly darkening sky. A particularly bitter gust of wind blows through them, sneaking right under her jumper and through her skin.

â€œFuck,â€ her brother hisses, crossing his arms over his chest. â€œBloody freezing out here.â€

â€œNo oneâ€™s stopping you from going back inside.â€

Her brother lets out a huff. Theyâ€™re close in age, only two years apartâ€”Damian being the older sibling. They used to be close in other ways too, used to be friends. Though every time she comes home it gets harder and harder to remember that. Damianâ€™s at Uni now. Mary can never remember which one. Canâ€™t imagine sheâ€™ll ever go to one herself.

â€œWho was he then?â€ Damian asks.

Mary reaches into her pocket and pulls out another cigarette. Excessive, but she knows he hates the smell and sheâ€™s hoping itâ€™ll make him go back inside. â€œWho was who?â€ she asks, lighting the thing the old-fashioned wayâ€”with matches she stole from the kitchen. Sheâ€™s gotten too used to doing this with magic.

â€œThe boy whoâ€™s got you out here being moody.â€

She inhales, the smoke scratching her raw throat. â€œThereâ€™s no boy,â€ she says on her exhale, itâ€™s insulting but not surprising that he thinks everything she feels is because of some boy. But then, she supposes thereâ€™s no way he could guess at what the actual problem is.

Itâ€™s incredibly easy to hide things from your parents as a Muggle-born. For all their talk of inclusivity Hogwarts has never been particularly committed to communicating with the Muggle families of their students. From what Mary can tell, all her parents were told about her attack was that she got injured and would recover quickly. When her parents asked her about it she told them it was a Quidditch injury, just the mention of the word â€˜Quidditchâ€™ made their eyes glaze over. There were no more questions after that.

â€œThen what is it?â€ Damian pushes, she can feel him looking at her without turning her head. He coughs as she lets go of another cloud of smoke. â€œWhatâ€™s going on with you?â€

Itâ€™s an interesting question; what is her problem exactly? Is it that a group of boys she goes to school with violated her in every possible way? Is it that thereâ€™s a war coming that she has no choice but to be a part of? Or, perhaps, is it that the one person she trusted with the truthâ€”with her feelings about all of thisâ€”is involved with one the bad guys? Because maybe James doesnâ€™t know about the Mark but he still knows who Regulus Black is. The kind of person he is. And what people like him do to people like Mary.

â€œOi! Earth to Mary?â€ Damian snaps his fingers in front of her face.

She looks over at him and then back at the now black sky, flicking the ash off the end of her cigarette. â€œNever mind, youâ€™re right, itâ€™s a boy.â€

Mary barely tries to sell it, but Damian doesnâ€™t appear to need much convincing. â€œYou need me to beat him up?â€ Sheâ€™s pretty sure heâ€™s only half joking.

â€œNo,â€ she says firmly, something cold coiling in her gut. â€œI have it covered.â€

Â 

â€œOut?â€ Lily repeats.

â€œErâ€”Iâ€”â€œ she shakes her head. â€œI was supposed to find you for the countdown,â€ she swallows waving at the air. â€œAnyway Iâ€”umâ€”Iâ€™m gonna go now, yeah?â€ She nods to herself. â€œYeah. Okay.â€ And with that she stumbles back inside, both James and Mary frozen in place.

â€œFuck,â€ James hisses under his breath, running a hand over his face.

â€œYeah,â€ Mary agrees, fairly certain that Lily wonâ€™t be forgiving her for this anytime soon. â€œIâ€”â€œ

â€œDonâ€™t,â€ James growls. â€œDonâ€™t talk to me right now. Justâ€¦donâ€™t.â€

He starts moving towards the door, leaving Mary feeling equal parts guilty and angry. She chooses to focus on the latter, easier that way.

â€œYou can be mad at me all you want,â€ she shouts after him. â€œIt doesnâ€™t change what I said. Doesnâ€™t change that itâ€™s true.â€

James doesnâ€™t stop. Doesnâ€™t look back, storming inside to do God knows what. Thereâ€™ll be no talking to Lily, not tonight. Maybe not ever. Mary stumbles backwards until she hits the wall behind her, sliding back down onto the ground.

She needs to get a gripâ€”her head is buzzing with hands and faces and laughs that cut like blades. She sees Mulciber. Sees Snape. Sees Regulus. She still canâ€™t find Bartyâ€™s faceâ€”like her brain wonâ€™t let her get that far, wonâ€™t let he remember that much. His touch. His weight. His smell. She remembers all of that. But she never sees his face. Probably thanks to Regulus fucking Black.

He went in her fucking head. He took the truth from herâ€”took moments of her life. And now her word means nothing. Her truth means nothing. Fuck him. Fuck him for thinking he had the goddamn right. For thinking one violation was worse than the other. Fuck her stupid head for not being strong enough to keep him out. To keep any of them out.

Her face is in her hands, nails digging into her skull, breaths coming in short little gasps. She should stop thinking about this. She knows that. But the world around her is all noiseâ€”all shadows and voices she doesnâ€™t recognize. Which is what it feels like in her head most of the time these days. She just keeps seeing them. Keeps feeling their hands. Hearing their laughs. They fucking enjoyed it. What they did to her. They fucking enjoyed every goddamn minute of it.

â€œMary?â€

Sheâ€™s barely able to hear her name over the rest of it.

â€œHeyâ€”hey, oh, hey, are you okay? Mary?â€

Someone is sitting next to her, someone has their arm around her shoulders pulling her into their chest. Someone who smells like rooftops and home cooked meals.

Damian.

She doesnâ€™t realize until his arms wrap around her that sheâ€™s cryingâ€”sobbing more accurately. She hasnâ€™t cried in ages. Didnâ€™t when she woke up in the infirmary with a splitting fucking headache and no idea where she was. Or when the nightmares started. Or when she pieced together what really happened to her. So she has absolutely no idea why sheâ€™s crying now. Why she canâ€™t stop.

â€œSh, sh,â€ Damian says, rubbing soothing circles into her back. â€œItâ€™s okay. Itâ€™s gonna be okay.â€

For some reason that just makes her cry harder.

Once sheâ€™s able to stop long enough to speak sheâ€™ll blame it on the alcohol. Damian will believe her. Or at least heâ€™ll pretend to, and soon enough sheâ€™ll be back at school and she wonâ€™t have to see the pity in his eyes every time he looks at her.

â€œWhat is it Mary? Whatâ€™s happened? I know this isnâ€™t about some boy, I donâ€™t even know why I said that, I was just trying to get you to talk to me. I just want you to talk to me. Let me help. Whatâ€™s wrong? Whatâ€™s happened?â€

And of course she canâ€™t tell him. She canâ€™t really tell anyone. The only person she did tell was James and it turns out heâ€™s in love with one of the people who put her here so that shows how bloody good her judgement is. Fuck James too. God, heâ€™s so good at acting like the nice guy but heâ€™s just like the rest of them. Another privileged goddamn Pureblood who has no idea what itâ€™s like. What this feels like.

â€œMary,â€ her brother says softly, and she knows she has to speak, even though it feels impossible in that moment. Knows she has to tell him something. Knows it has to be true.

â€œIâ€™m scared,â€ she manages to sob into his shirt. â€œFuck, Iâ€™m so goddamn scared. All the time. I donâ€™tâ€”I canâ€™tâ€”â€œ she sounds pathetic, she recognizes that. Definitely planning to blame it on the alcohol.

â€œScared of what?â€

How can she even begin to explain? How can she articulate all the things crowding her chest and crushing her lungs and keeping her up at night?

She shakes her head against his chest. â€œMagic,â€ for some reason thatâ€™s the word that crawls out of her mouth.

Itâ€™s the thing that's built this wall between her and her family. The thing that let a group of boys turn her body into something she canâ€™t trust. The thing thatâ€™s painted a target on her back. The thing that at eleven years old made her feel invincible.

â€œIâ€™m scared of magic.â€

Chapter End Notes

Hey! Hi! Hello!

Idk, was this too slow? Did you like it? I kinda think I really like it but I always go back and forth.

This chapter is fully inspired by my belief that New Years Eve is the messiest night of the year.

Thank you so much for all your lovely comments and kudos I appreciate them so muuuucchhhhh, they give me all the warm fuzzies!

PART I: REMUS

Itâ€™s always a bit awkward. Being a werewolf. Especially when youâ€™re a guest in someoneâ€™s home and also about to transform into a monster. Thereâ€™s no polite way for someone to ask if they can please lock you in their basement now. Though the Potterâ€™s certainly try their best.

â€œYou sure you donâ€™t want anything to eat?â€ Jamesâ€™s mum asks as she places a set of folded sheets on the bed theyâ€™ve brought down for him. All the other furniture has been removed, but despite that the Potterâ€™s still have the nicest basement Remus has ever seen. Warm butter coloured walls, hardwood floors, exposed brick, a fireplaceâ€”currently disconnected from the Floo network and unlitâ€”itâ€™s nothing like his basement back home. This room was made for games and movie nights and sleepovers. It makes Remus fidget. More acutely aware of how much of an imposition heâ€™s being. He should have gone home. Should have dealt with this himself.

â€œRemus?â€

He looks up, finding Euphemia still standing by the bed, concern clear in her eyes even when she smiles at him.

â€œYou okay kiddo?â€

He nods stiffly, not bothering to bring up the aching in his bones or his head or the nausea that hasnâ€™t subsided since this morning. She knows all that already. Besides, itâ€™s not really what sheâ€™s asking.

â€œIâ€™m worried about the walls,â€ Remus finally forces himself to say, hands shoved in the pouch at the front of his hoodie, eyes not meeting herâ€™s.

A wrinkle appears between her eyes. â€œThe walls?â€

â€œItâ€™llâ€”â€œ he coughs. â€œI mean Iâ€™ll,â€ lets not shy away from it now Remus. â€œIâ€™ll scratch them up.â€

She arches her brow, looking a bit bemused. â€œDonâ€™t worry, honestly, it doesnâ€™t matter.â€

Remus swallows, throat dry, eyes trailing around the room, spotting all the places that photos and paintings have been removed. Pictures of James practically plaster the walls in this house. Remus doesnâ€™t know if his parents ever took any family photos. If they did they certainly never hung them up.

â€œThere so nice though,â€ he says eventually. Pathetically.

Euphemia makes a pitying noise that has Remus flinching. â€œOh love,â€ sheâ€™s gentle when she wraps her arm around him, when she presses a kiss to the top of his head.

â€œNot as nice as you,â€ she says, letting him go after a moment. â€œBesides, a wave of my wand and itâ€™ll all be good as new anyway, one of the many perks of being a witch,â€ she gives him a wink.

Remus isnâ€™t sure if sheâ€™s waiting for a response but he canâ€™t quite manage one.

â€œYouâ€™re sure thereâ€™s nothing else you need?â€ she asks eventually, standing by the bottom of the stairs.

He shakes his head. â€œNo, thank you.â€

â€œWell alright then, weâ€™ll see you in the morning,â€ she smiles. â€œMimiâ€™s making pancakes.â€ Remus does his best to smile back, heâ€™s not sure how well he manages it.

After she leaves he spends a long time just staring at the bed on the other side of the room, trying to imagine what heâ€™d be doing tonight if he was normal. Heâ€™d probably be upstairs with James, Sirius and Peter, playing exploding snaps or chess. Afterward, theyâ€™d crawled back into bed, smelling like winter and laughter, and kissed until theyâ€™d fallen asleep.

He brings his hand to his chest like the ache there is a physical thing. After a few more seconds of sulking he sighs, walking over to the wall and sitting down on the ground, ignoring the bed. It reminds him too much of the shack. Maybe that should be comforting but it isnâ€™t. He folds his arms over his knees and rests his forehead on topâ€¦waiting.

That is, until he hears the door open. He doesnâ€™t lift his head right away, assuming itâ€™s Euphemia, that she must have forgotten something, or brought him some food even though he told her he wasnâ€™t hungryâ€”mums never listen when you say you arenâ€™t hungry. But then:

â€œHey Moons,â€ comes a soft voice.

Remus has to squeeze his eyes shut, taking in a deep breath before opening them again.

â€œWhat are you doing here?â€ he whispers, the horror plain in his voice.

Remusâ€™s mouth feels too dry. â€œItâ€™s not safe,â€ not that itâ€™s ever safe.

â€œIâ€™ll transform when you do,â€ Sirius shrugs, like its no big deal. Which doesnâ€™t sit well with Remus at all.

â€œOh I know.â€

And thereâ€™s more in those words than just a little witty banter.

Itâ€™s Remusâ€™s turn to shrug. â€œItâ€™s fine. Whatâ€™s up?â€ his eyes are still closed and he can hear the drowsiness in his own voice.

Well. Remus hadnâ€™t seen this coming.

â€œUmâ€¦why do you think thereâ€™s something going on?â€ he asks tentatively.

â€œYou should change,â€ he chokes, and thenâ€”Merlin, it never gets easier, youâ€™d think after all this time heâ€™d have some way to mange the pain butâ€”suddenly it feels like hooks have been stabbed through his torso and are being yanked in all different directions, pulling him apart. PART II: REGULUS

He goes back to school tomorrow. All and all itâ€™s been a rather uneventful visit. Everyone is busy. Except for Kreacher and his father, which, if Regulus is being honest, is exactly how he likes it. If it hadnâ€™t been for his run-in with Mary Macdonald he might even have enjoyed himself. As it is, heâ€™s been wracking his brain trying to figure out how to once again get out of doing the thing heâ€™s been telling himself he needs to do for months.

Is there something he can sayâ€”some way to phrase itâ€”that wonâ€™t send James running? That will make him understand.

Understand what?

Asks the cruel voice in his head.

That youâ€™re every bit the coward Sirius has always said you are? That you donâ€™t care much one way or the other, Death Eater or Mudblood, you just want to survive?

That you were trying to protect him. To keep him at arms length. But youâ€™ve changed your mind?

Regulus shakes his head, trying to push all those thoughts out. Theyâ€™re pointless and unhelpful. He knows what will happen once James knows, regardless of the words he chooses or excuses he makes. Heâ€™s always known.

â€œMon chou,â€ his fatherâ€™s voice pulls him out of his thoughts. Regulus looks up from the book in his lap to find his father watching him with concern in his eyes. â€œWhat has you looking so upset, huh?â€

Regulus can only hold his stare for so long before looking away. â€œIâ€™m not upset.â€ He grimaces at the high, tinny sound of his voice.

His father kisses his teeth, reaching over and lightly tapping under Regulusâ€™s chin, forcing him to look up. â€œCome now, no lying to your Papa.â€

Regulus rolls his eyes. â€œItâ€™s nothingâ€”itâ€™sâ€”justâ€”school andâ€”â€œ he waves his hand in the air unable to say the rest of it. Even in this house, the one place that the Mark on his arm is something to be proud of, they donâ€™t really talk about it. About the people who have been coming and going and the meetings Walburga has been having. Nobody has said anything to Regulusâ€”invited him to sit in or asked him how heâ€™s been forwarding their cause at Hogwarts. Heâ€™s not sure how much longer his invisibility will last but he is grateful for it.

â€œThereâ€™s something else,â€ his father pushes, voice soothing as always, like waves against the haul of a ship or a breeze through the trees. Grimmauld Place hasnâ€™t been good for himâ€”is it ever good for anyone?â€”heâ€™s paler and thinner than he was the last time Regulus saw him.

â€œYouâ€™re afraid,â€ itâ€™s not a question so Regulus doesnâ€™t answer. â€œAfraid of me mon cher? Afraid to tell me?â€

Regulus swallows with some difficulty, looking away again, out the window. Itâ€™s dark out, but then, itâ€™s dark inside tooâ€”the only real light coming from the fireplace. He can just make out the stars. Eyes automatically looking for Sirius.

There is a weight to his fatherâ€™s attention, he can feel it even if he canâ€™t see it. Itâ€™s something heâ€™s always craved, though at this moment he would very gladly give it up. His father is waiting for an answer and honestly, Regulus isnâ€™t sure why he isnâ€™t just giving him an excuse. He has them, a dozen, a hundredâ€”all saved up to pull out whenever anyone asks a question that cuts too close. His brain a catalogue of the different lies he needs to tell to get through the day.

â€œRegulus?â€

He loves his father. Probably more than anyone else in the world. He loves his father and his father is dying. Thatâ€™s his excuse, for the words he lets out of his mouth. His chest. The box buried deep inside him. He loves his father. And his father is dying. And he just wants to know, before he loses the chance. He just wants to know if his father loves him back.

â€œIâ€™m gay Papa.â€

He wonders if James would be proud of himâ€”for saying it. Admitting it. His single act of bravery.

Thereâ€™s silence. Regulus doesnâ€™t take his eyes off the window, forces himself to focus on the stars outside, trying to figure out which ones they are. Trying to find himself. Sirius. Orion. Trying not to think about the slowly growing ache in his chest or the vomit inching up the back of his throat.

Weâ€™ll always be together up there,

He tells himself, trying to calm his speeding pulse the same way he had when Sirius left.

Whatever else happens weâ€™ll always have that.

Eventually his father clears his throat and Regulus barely manages to suppress a wince.

â€œAnd that makes you upset?â€ Orion finally asks. Regulus has no idea what to do with that. He tries to dissect his fatherâ€™s tone but he canâ€™t tell if itâ€™s angry or bewildered or both.

He keeps his eyes on the window, afraid to find out for certain. â€œDoesnâ€™t it upset you?â€

More silence. It goes on too long. Regulus should leave. He should leave. He has no idea what to expect, his mother has always been the one to punish him, he isnâ€™t sure what his father will do. Tell herâ€”is the obvious answer. Just the thought makes him shiver. Fuck. This was a mistake. What did he think was going to happen?

â€œMon chouâ€”regarde-moi sâ€™il-te-plaÃ®t.â€

Regulusâ€™s hands are trembling as he shakes his head.

â€œNon, Regulus, enough. Look at me please?â€

Feeling like he might be sick he finally manages to turn his head. Instantly his father reaches out, taking his face in both hands.

â€œRegulus,â€ he says softly, and for some reason that makes Regulus want to cry. â€œYou are my son. You are the light of my life. The joy. I am stuck in this bed withering away but I die happy knowing that I gave the world you,â€ his fatherâ€™s hands are shaking. â€œYou are so beautiful my darling,â€ he wipes Regulusâ€™s tears away with his thumbs. â€œYou could never let me down.â€

All Regulus manages is a wobbly, â€œohâ€ before his father is pulling him closer, the book falling out of his lap as he steps towards the bed, allowing himself to be hugged.

â€œJe tâ€™aime Regulus, toujours, toujours, toujours,â€ he whispers in his ear.

Regulus tries to steady his breathing. Settle his nerves. â€œThank you,â€ he says, which makes his father laugh, pulling away just enough so he can hold his face again.

â€œIâ€™m your Papa,â€ he says. â€œItâ€™s my job.â€

Regulus is grateful. So grateful. But he canâ€™t help thinking of Sirius and wondering where this man was when Sirius needed him? As if hearing the thoughts in his head, his fatherâ€™s expression shifts, becoming more serious.

â€œBut Regulus, your mamanâ€”â€œ

Now itâ€™s Regulusâ€™s turn to laugh, though perhaps a bit more bitterly. â€œNo I wonâ€™tâ€”I wonâ€™t tell her.â€

His father nods, letting his hands fall away. And there it is, Regulus supposes, the answer to his question, the sin Sirius can never forgive. Because their father loves them. Just not enough to fight for them.

â€œTell me,â€ his father smiles now, a mischievous look in his eyes, â€œis there someone special?â€

Regulusâ€™s throat grows tight. He should change the subject. He should lie. â€œYes,â€ he says insteadâ€”daringlyâ€”toeing too close to the edge.

â€œAnd kind?â€

PART III: JAMES

** Mon chou = Sweetie / sweetheart

Mon cher = My dear

"Mon chouâ€”regarde-moi sâ€™il-te-plaÃ®t" = Sweetheart - please look at me

â€œJe tâ€™aimes Regulus, toujours, toujours, toujours,â€ = I love you Regulus, always, always, always

Hello beautiful people!

I really like this chapter, I don't know why, I just do. All three parts just got me feeling some type of way y'know?

Anyway, I hope you like it too!

Thank you always!!!!

Chapter 33

Chapter Summary

Extreme Where's Waldo

Chapter Notes

Listen, I think I probably mess around with HP magic lore in this chapter and also maybe how Quidditch works buuuut I like it sooooo I'm keeping it

PART I: LILY

Lily isnâ€™t sad. Really she isnâ€™t. Not about James Potter announcing to half of London that he doesnâ€™t want her anymore. Or about Mary going behind her back and talking to him in the first place. Those things are stupid and silly and they donâ€™t matter. So she isnâ€™t sad about them. Not even a little bit. Not even at all. In fact, sheâ€™s barely thought about either one of those people since New Years. So. There.

â€œHave you seen my Charms textbook?â€ Marlene asks when Lily emerges from the bathroom after taking a shower that was both too long and too hot. But not because sheâ€™s sad.

â€œUmâ€¦no?â€ she very pointedly does not make eye contact with Mary.

â€œGoddamnit,â€ Marlene is currently on her stomach, half under her bed, throwing random items into the middle of the floor in her frantic search.

â€œMar dear,â€ Mary says, sounding bored. Sheâ€™s perched in the window, inspecting her nails. â€œYou do know youâ€™re a witch right? Just Accio that sucker.â€

The frantic searching stops as Marlene crawls back out from under her bed, sitting back on her heels, blond hair a mess. â€œOh,â€ she says a little breathlessly. â€œYeah, right. Good call.â€

Lily finishes getting dressed as Marlene gropes around for her wand. â€œShouldnâ€™t you two be at practice?â€ she asks, forcing her voice to sound casual. Because she isnâ€™t sad. So how else would her voice sound?

â€œNo,â€ Mary says tightly.

â€œJames cancelled it.â€

Lily turns to face her roommates, directing her look of astonishment at Marlene specifically.

â€œI know,â€ Marlene says, shoving her newly found Charms textbook into her bag.

â€œIs he sick?â€ Lily asks, hating herself for caring.

â€œMerlin I donâ€™t know,â€ Marlene runs a hand through her hair. â€œRemus says he isnâ€™t butâ€”cancelling practice? After the break? With Mary only just able to play again?â€ she shakes her head. â€œSomething is definitely wrong. Has to be.â€

PART II JAMES

Chapter End Notes

I'M SORRY THIS IS SO LATE

I had a bunch of school / work stuff and it just took me way too long.

This is one of those chapters where I hope that the stuff I'm doing works even though maybe it's like a little more of an interpretation of HP than hardcore canon? IDK, IDK what the rules are.

Chapter 34

Chapter Summary

I feel personally victimized by this chapter (I KNOW I WROTE IT OKAY)

Chapter Notes

IMPORTANT: This chapter takes place at the same time as the last chapter (basically it's the last chapter from Sirius and Regulus's perspectives), if I was a better writer I wouldn't have to tell you that but unfortunately for all of us I am not

TW: Child abuse (thank you Walburga)

TW: Eating stuff (not related to body image more like stress management or even self harm I guess)

TW: Death / killing (no major characters were harmed in the making of this chapter)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I: REGULUS

AUGUST 1971

Sirius and Regulus sit crossed-legged on Siriusâ€™s bed, the duvet hovering above them like a makeshift tent. Their fatherâ€™s doing.

â€œAgain,â€ Regulus whispers, eyes wide as he stares at the new wand clutched in his older brotherâ€™s hand. He can see Siriusâ€™s grin even in the dark.

â€œLumos.â€ The tip begins to glow, lightening up the fort and causing Regulus to gasp just like he did the last four times.

â€œItâ€™s so beautiful,â€ Regulus says, before blushing. His mother doesnâ€™t like when he talks like thatâ€”beautiful, prettyâ€”she says it makes him sound soft.

But Sirius only smiles wider. â€œNeat huh?â€ he says, waving his wand around a little. â€œAll I had to do was read it in my textbook and I figured it out right away. This school things is gonna be so freaking easy.â€

Regulus nods enthusiastically, certain heâ€™s right, Sirius is the smartest person he knows. â€œWhy do you even need to go at all? Couldnâ€™t you just learn all your magic from books?â€ he hopes his voice doesnâ€™t sound as desperate as he feels.

Tomorrow Sirius is going to the train station, going to Hogwarts, going away from Regulus. Until Christmas. He feels his lower lip start to tremble and instantly stops thinking about it. Sirius doesnâ€™t mind when he calls things pretty, but he hates it when Regulus cries.

â€œI could probably teach myself yeah,â€ Sirius shrugs, with all the cocky assurance of an eleven year old. â€œBut then Iâ€™d have to stay here.â€ He wrinkles his nose, like the very thought leaves a bad taste in his mouth.

â€œBut youâ€™d be with me,â€ Regulus says meekly, causing his brotherâ€™s face to soften.

â€œAw Reg, you know I love you right?â€ he claps Regulus on the shoulder. â€œYouâ€™re my best friend. But I canâ€™t stand this house. Itâ€™s too stuffy. Itâ€™s too small.â€

Regulus doesnâ€™t really know what heâ€™s talking about, the house feels plenty big to him. Too big even. He hates being alone on the top floorâ€”hearing the floorboards creak or windows rattle and knowing that he has to run drown at least three flights of stairs before heâ€™ll find another person.

â€œBesides, youâ€™ll be joining me next year, so itâ€™s not even that long.â€

A year feels like an eternity to Regulus.

â€œYouâ€™ll write?â€ he asks nervously.

â€œOf course Iâ€™ll write!â€ Sirius says, like itâ€™s the most obvious thing in the world. â€œIâ€™ll write everyday.â€

Regulus feels his heart leap. â€œEveryday?â€

Sirius smiles again. â€œEveryday,â€ he knocks their foreheads together and Regulus laughs. A moment later Siriusâ€™s wand flickers and goes out.

JANUARY 1977

Sirius never did, of course.

Write everyday.

Or any day.

Regulus forgave him. He forgave him at the time and he forgives him now. Itâ€™s an awful lot to expect of an eleven year old, to keep his promises.

Regulus canâ€™t figure out if itâ€™s irony or some other form of poetic justice that years later James Potter would manage what Sirius hadnâ€™t. Writing him a letter for every week they were apart. Regulus thinks about it as he lies on his back in a cot in Azkaban, arm thrown behind his head as a makeshift pillow.

His feet hang off the end which is unfortunate because of the rats. They like toâ€¦snack. He tries to pull his legs in but his muscles cramp and his back hurts. He isnâ€™t used to being this tall. Or strong. Heâ€™s clunky and awkward when he moves, unable to accurately judge his size in relation to the things and spaces around him. He ran into a few low hanging doors when they were smuggling him in.

Despite the fact that theyâ€™re technically family, Regulus doesnâ€™t know the man whose identity he is currently impersonating. Rabastan Lestrange is Rodolphusâ€™s younger brother, though only by a year and a few months. Heâ€™s muscular, with dark hair and thick dark eyebrows that hang over the rest of his face. He also, apparently, has skills currently required by Lord Voldemort. And while the Dark Lord does control the guards of Azkabanâ€”as Evan is always so fond of reminding Regulusâ€”he does not control Minister Minchum, or Head Judge Crouch, who also happens to be Bartyâ€™s bloody dad. Both of them have taken to visiting the prison sporadically. So the Dark Lord needed a decoy.

Enter Regulus.

He had, of course, not been overly keen on the whole thing, especially when they informed him that he would not be able to keep his wand on him, on the off chance that Minchum or Crouch came into his cell to interrogate him and saw it. He had been reassured, however, that the Dementors would leave him alone. Which they have.

Mostly.

Every once and a while they linger at his door, eyeing him like a freshly cooked steak. Itâ€™s unsettling as all hell, but they never get any closer. You donâ€™t need to be touching them to feel them of course. The cold sadness that bleeds out of them creeps along the floor and sneaks inside your skin. Sometimes the feeling lingers for hours after theyâ€™ve left.

The cell itself isnâ€™t as scary as it is dull. There are no windows, or even really any furniture to speak of. So Regulus passes the time day dreaming. He tries to remember bits of Jamesâ€™s letters from memory, heâ€™s reread them enough after all. He closes his eyes and imagines James sitting beside his bed reciting them.

My mum makes these like crazy good burgers, James says today. Itâ€™s about the only thing she can actually make and doesnâ€™t need Mimiâ€™s help with. She does it without magic too. We have this weird Muggle thingâ€”you keep it outside and it has a grill and it cooks things? I donâ€™t know if that makes any sense to you but, anyway, mum says they donâ€™t taste right if you just magic them. I always help her make the patties. You take ground beef and spices and egg and roll them together into balls and then squish them. Iâ€™ll show you one day. Iâ€™ll cook you dinner. Itâ€™ll be all romantic and shit. I know youâ€™re rolling your eyes but youâ€™ll love it, I swear.

Regulus tries to imagine what James Potterâ€™s kitchen looks like. Tries to picture him and his mum standing side by side. Tries to imagine James Potter cooking him dinner. Like theyâ€™re a real couple. They arenâ€™t of course, but itâ€™s a nice fantasy.

Sometimes he imagines the two of them in their own kitchen. In their own houseâ€”no, flat, a flat somewhere in London. Somewhere close to the Quidditch stadium. Or at least the Apparition point to the stadium. Thereâ€™s one bedroom, it has big windows and a big bed with mountains of pillows. There are posters on the walls of their favourite Quidditch players. Of them. Because of course, theyâ€™re both playing on professional teams. Their brooms are hung up in the front hall. James always leaves his shoes in front of the door but Regulus doesnâ€™t complain, just rolls his eyes and kicks them out of the way. Regulus always plays his music too loud but James doesnâ€™t tell him to turn it down, just wanders around the flat afterwards pretending to be deaf and ignoring everything Regulus says until eventually he cracks and starts laughing.

Regulus has too much time here.

In Azkaban.

Itâ€™s dangerous.

Every day he builds more and more of this life he knows he canâ€™t have.

Everyday he lets the one he does slip a little further away.

PART II: SIRIUS

JUNE 1972

Kreacher is the one to pick him up from the station. Sirius should have seen that coming since he was also the one who picked him up at Christmas but some part of him still feelsâ€¦embarrassed. All the other kids have parents waiting for themâ€”parents who are desperate to see them. Jamesâ€™s mum practically crushes him she hugs him so hard, covering his face in about a dozen kisses. James thinks thatâ€™s embarrassing but it isnâ€™t. Not really. Mostly it just makes Siriusâ€™s chest itch.

â€œMadam is wanting Master Sirius in the dining room please,â€ Kreacher says as Sirius starts up the stairs towards his room, mouth already half open, ready to call out Regâ€™s name. His brother is the only reason Sirius is excited to be home. He has so much to tell him. Plus, he managed to get some of the older kids to bring him back stuff from Honeydukes and Zonkos that he knows Reg is gonna go absolutely mental for.

â€œCanâ€™t I just drop my bag off first?â€ Sirius whines.

In a crack Kreacher appears on the step above him, sliding the bag off his shoulder without even asking. â€œMadam said immediately after home getting, now go, go, go.â€

Sirius scowls, huffing dramatically as he walks back down the stairs. Sometimes he really hates that elf.

Itâ€™s been months since heâ€™s seen his mother. Oddly he wonders if he should thank her. The kids at Hogwarts all think Sirius is fearlessâ€”the way he talks back to teachers and breaks rules. But the truth is, after Grimmauld Place, itâ€™s hard to find the teachers at Hogwarts intimidating. Whatâ€™re they gonna do? Make him scrub the floors? Write lines? Do homework? None of that seems like punishment compared to what happens to him when he misbehaves at home. So in a way, his mother terrorizing him all of his life has managed to turn him into a bit of a legend. And Sirius likes being a legend. Likes being talked about and gasped at. Notoriety suits him.

He pauses at the doors to the dining room, taking a deep breath before knocking lightly on the glass. You always have to knock in this house, it doesnâ€™t matter what room it is. If the doors are closed you have to announce your presence.

â€œCome in.â€

Slowly Sirius opens the door. His mother is sitting at the head of the table, glasses on, several pieces of parchment spread out around her. His father isnâ€™t there which is never a good thing. He, at least, keeps her civil. Most of the time.

â€œMum,â€ Sirius says as he approaches her cautiously.

She looks up at him and then back down at her papers. So he waits. Back straight, hands clasped behind him. He doesnâ€™t even have to think about it, itâ€™s been beaten into him so many timesâ€”how to stand and sit and eat. James mocked him endlessly for his table manners for the first few weeks of school. Itâ€™d taken Sirius a while to unlearn what his mother had drilled into him. But back in this familiar space itâ€™s like his body canâ€™t help it.

She leaves him waiting for a long timeâ€”not speaking to him or acknowledging his presence. It isnâ€™t unusual. She does this a lot. Like everything else, itâ€™s a test. To see if he can stand still and wait. If he can behave.

Eventually she puts down her quill and sits back, eyeing him for a moment, sharp eyes burning holes in his skin. He does his best not to fidget. It will only make whatever is coming worse.

â€œYouâ€™ve disappointed me and your father greatly.â€

Of course I have, he doesnâ€™t say. There was a time when those words would have hurt, but heâ€™s heard them too often at this point. Heâ€™s numb to it.

â€œIâ€™m sorry,â€ he says, what else is there?

â€œNot only were you placed in Gryffindor,â€ that had been the topic of most of his Christmas holidays. He had received a howler at school as well. Another embarrassment, though not nearly as bad as when Albus freaking Dumbledore pulled him into his office to tell him that his mother had been writing, demanding her son be placed in Slytherin where he belonged.

So Dumbledore had asked him; what do you want?

And, well.

He was still in Gryffindor wasnâ€™t he?

â€œBut you have continued to disobey our explicit instructions to avoid unseemly associations.â€

â€œI havenâ€™tâ€”â€œ

â€œDonâ€™t lie to me,â€ she doesnâ€™t yell, but her words are sharp and cold. She holds her threats behind her teeth.

Sirius swallows. â€œJames Potter and Peter Pettigrew are both Purebloods,â€ he forces himself to say even though it makes him feel vaguely nauseous to talk about his friends this way.

â€œThe Pettigrews are a family of questionable lineage and the Potters are Blood traitors, neither worthy of the heir of the House of Black. But they are not who I was referring to.â€

Sirius stands still, staring off her right shoulder because looking her straight in the eye is the easiest way to get your mind cracked open and read like a storybook.

â€œRemus Lupin.â€

Sirius isnâ€™t able to stop his breath from catching, a reaction his mother will no doubt have noticed. Heâ€™d been so careful to keep Remus out of his mouth and out of his head when heâ€™d been home for Christmas. Keeping him safely locked away inside himself where no one in this house could touch him.

â€œWho?â€ he finally asks.

That was stupid.

She hits him across the face. Open palmed. A warning shot.

â€œIâ€™m not interested in playing games,â€ her voices is steady, like nothing happened. Sirius still has his hands clasped behind his back. He knows better than to bring them up, then to touch his face.

â€œWho told you about Remus?â€ he asks finally. Itâ€™s not the answer she wants. Too much defiance. But he wonâ€™t apologize for Remus. Not even to save himself.

Thereâ€™s a momentary pause before she pulls out her wand and Sirius braces himself for whatever punishment is coming next. The slap was childâ€™s play, Walburga is usually far more creative. But when she waves her wand he feels nothingâ€”no stinging or burning, no force pushing him back against the wall. After a few seconds thereâ€™s the sound of fluttering. Letters slip under the dining room doors and pile up on the table between them. There must be nearly a hundred.

He looks at them then back at his mother, waiting for an explanation, but she only stares blankly at him.

â€œErâ€”what are these?â€ he asks, after several awkward minutes.

Her face remains expressionless. â€œDonâ€™t you recognize them?â€

He squints at her like maybe that will make her words clearer and then turns the same gaze on the letters. He realizes that they do actually look familiar. Stepping closer he sees that each and every one of them is addressed to Regulus. Addressed by him.

His head snaps towards his mother, his shock and betrayal clearly plain on his face because Walburga looks pleased.

â€œDid heâ€”did he give you these?â€ Heâ€™d wondered why Regulus never responded, but heâ€™d assumed it probably had to do with their mother. Never, however, had he considered that Regulus had been selling him out. Handing over his letters, letting her pry into his life. It felt like a violation. Like the worst kind of betrayal.

â€œRegulus is a good boy,â€ his mother goes on. â€œDoes what heâ€™s told. You on the other handâ€¦â€ she gestures to the pile of letters. â€œRemus Lupin is a half-blood from a family full of half-bloods. And on top of that I am told that he is sickly.â€ She says that as though illness is a character flaw. Which, of course, to his mother it is. Strong blood breeds strong wizards, or so she says. Sirius is not sure there is any proof to back that belief up.

â€œYou will cease to associate with him, do you understand?â€ his mother continues, oblivious to Siriusâ€™s mounting rage. He put a lot in those letters. Figures the only thing his mother would care about would be the blood statuses of his best friends.

â€œSirius?â€ she snaps. â€œDo you understand me?â€

â€œHeâ€™s my friend,â€ he says through clenched teeth.

â€œNot anymore.â€

Itâ€™s hard to describe all the ways those words tangle him up. The panic they cause to wrap around his chest, squeezing his ribs. A primal fear.

Donâ€™t take him from me.

Please.

Please.

Sirius canâ€™t describe what it is about Remus Lupin exactly. He just knows that the fear his mother has planted beneath his skin, that scratches and bites and never sleeps, goes quiet whenever he looks at Remus. Whenever he sits next to him. Or hears him laugh. Remusâ€¦ settles Sirius. He doesnâ€™t know what that means. He doesnâ€™t really think about it much. But he craves it.

Donâ€™t take him from me.

Please.

Please.

â€œDo you understand me?â€ Walburga starts to tap her wand threateningly on the table and Siriusâ€™s eyes go right to it.

â€œYes,â€ he finally manages to say.

Because he does understand.

He has no intention of doing as she says.

But he understands.

She nods sharply. â€œGood. Wash and change before dinner,â€ her eyes give him another once over, â€œyou look ragged.â€ Which is her way of saying â€œcommon.â€

Sirius only barely refrains from rolling his eyes as he walks out of the dinning room, taking the stairs two at a time in his haste to get to the safety of his bedroom. Heâ€™s not at all sure what to do with the emotions swirling around inside himâ€”fear, relief, betrayal, anger. He doesnâ€™t have much time to sort it out either, heâ€™s only just made it to the second floor landing when he runs right into Reg.

â€œSirius!â€ his little brother somehow manages to turn their collision into a hug, sending them both careening into the wall. Itâ€™s instinct that has Sirius hugging him back even though he kind of hates him right now.

â€œKreacher told me you were back, Iâ€™ve been waiting out here for ages, what did mum want? What was the end of term like? Did Gryffindor win Quidditch? Did you get all the house points? Did you actually throw that cat in the lake like you said you wouldâ€”Mrs. Norberry or whateverâ€”â€œ

â€œNorris,â€ Sirius answers reflexively.

â€œOh yeah, Norris.â€

Reg finally lets go, stepping back and beaming up at Sirius. His curls are all over the place and heâ€™s missing a tooth. He looks like a little kid, even to Sirius who is, admittedly, also a little kid. And suddenly Sirius feels the anger drain out of him.

Regulus blinks, brow furrowing, seeming to catch onto Siriusâ€™s mood for the first time. â€œWhat is it? Whatâ€™s wrong?â€

Sirius shakes his head. â€œNothing. Iâ€™m just tired Reg. Iâ€™ll see you at dinner yeah?â€ he brushes past him, refusing to feel guilty about the dejected look on the younger boyâ€™s face. Heâ€™ll have to be more careful what he says around him, but maybe thatâ€™ll just be for the summer, maybe once Reg is at Hogwarts, away from this house, away from their parents, Sirius will be able to bring him around. Regâ€™ll be in Ravenclaw, Sirius is almost positive, heâ€™s never met a bigger nerd. Thatâ€™ll be good, he decides, even if he does think the Ravenclaws are a bit obnoxious, at least Regâ€™ll have the chance to meet people he isnâ€™t bloody related to.

Sirius makes it to his bedroom, closing the door behind him and collapsing down onto his bed. He exhales. Heâ€™ll write to James later, thatâ€™ll make him feel better. He just needs to survive the summerâ€”him and Reg both. Once they get to Hogwarts everything will be okay. He knows it will.

JANUARY 1977

Â 

He hears whispers. Heâ€™s still too asleep to really take that in. To understand whoâ€™s talking or what theyâ€™re saying. But he hears whispers. And then he hears the door close.

Itâ€™s not until Remus comes back to bed that Sirius realizes he left it in the first place. That the part of his body once covered by Remus is cold. Thereâ€™s a short pause before Remus kisses his temple and starts pulling away again.

â€œWhereâ€™re you going?â€ Sirius slurs. He manages to open his eyes but only barely. Itâ€™s dark, but not so dark that Sirius canâ€™t see that Remus has gotten fully dressed.

â€œJustâ€”erâ€”library.â€

Sirius blinks. Everything is swimming around in his head. He still isnâ€™t awake enough to tell if this conversation is even real or if itâ€™s a dream.

â€œLibrary?â€

â€œYeahâ€”James just needs some help with something.â€

None of this makes any sense. It must be a dream. Which is weird because Siriusâ€™s dreams are usually much more fun than this. He squints up at Remus again. Usually Remus is more naked in Siriusâ€™s dreams.

â€œQuidditch?â€ is all Sirius is able to get out, reaching blindly for Remus and managing to get his fingers caught in his shirt, tugging him fully onto the bed

â€œUrgh,â€ Remus practically falls on top of Sirius but Sirius doesnâ€™t mind. â€œHeâ€”Jesus Padfoot,â€ Remus mutters as he tries to unlatch Siriusâ€™s fingers from his shirt. â€œHe cancelled practice.â€

Siriusâ€™s eyes are suddenly wide open, and he lets go of Remus. â€œWhat?â€

Remus pulls back, straightening out his shirt and looking a little sheepish. â€œYeah. So. Iâ€™m gonna go help him. You go back to sleep.â€

â€œHelp him what? Is he okay?â€ Sirius struggles to get up but Remus stops him, gently, but firmly, pushing him back down onto the mattress.

â€œHeâ€™s fine, itâ€™s just school stuff, go back to sleep okay? Iâ€™ve got this,â€ he gives Sirius a small smile, hand slowly making its way up Siriusâ€™s neck to his head, fingers running slowly through his hair.

â€œCheating,â€ Sirius murmurs as his eyes grow heavy again. He loves this feelingâ€”loves it when Remus plays with his hairâ€”he wants to bottle this feeling and drink it like a fine wine.

â€œMhm,â€ Remus hums.

â€œYouâ€™ll tell me whatâ€™s happening right?â€ Sirius mumbles even as his eyes close.

Thereâ€™s a pause. A long one.

â€œOf course,â€ and then, â€œGo to sleep okay?â€

â€œI am asleep,â€ Sirius says nonsensically, earning him a soft laugh that makes his belly warm.

Remus leans down and kisses him again. â€œOf course you are.â€

Â 


By the time Sirius is properly awake Remus is gone and so is James. For a second Sirius just sits and stares at their beds and tries to figure out the feeling in his chest. Somehow heavy and empty all at the same time.

When did this happen?

he canâ€™t help but think.

When did I start getting left behind?

Itâ€™s a stupid question, because, of course, he knows the answer. Sighing he picks up his pillow and launches it at Peterâ€™s still sleeping form.

â€œTime to get up Wormtail,â€ he says, sliding out of bed and heading for the bathroom.

â€œYouâ€™re worse than my mum,â€ Peter mutters into his pillow as Sirius closes the door.

Despite his winging, Peter does get out of bed, taking the shower after Sirius with nothing but a grunt of acknowledgement. Of the four of them, Peter and Sirius are the least pleasant in the mornings. Both of them more or less zombies before they get some food. Which is probably why itâ€™s not until theyâ€™re dressed and ready to leave that Peter finally realizes James and Remus arenâ€™t there.

He looks around, bewildered for a moment before turning to Sirius. â€œWhat the hell?â€

Sirius shrugs. â€œI have no fucking clue. Something about the library?â€ he pauses, trying to drag up his vague memories of Remusâ€™s departure. â€œJames cancelled practice.â€

Peterâ€™s mouth actually falls open. â€œIs he dying?â€

â€œDunno,â€ Sirius says around the lump in his throat. Thereâ€™s so much he doesnâ€™t know about James at the moment. Itâ€™s a bit crushing if heâ€™s being honest. â€œCâ€™mon,â€ he says, walking towards the door. â€œLets get some food yeah?â€

Peters nods, following him down the stairs. â€œCancelled bloody Quidditch,â€ he mutters under his breath. â€œThatâ€™s gotta be one of the signs of the apocalypse doesnâ€™t it?â€

Sirius snorts. â€œSure seems like it.â€

Â 

Itâ€™s weird, sitting down to breakfast just the two of them. I mean, yes, of course, the four of them donâ€™t always eat together. But usually thatâ€™s because something is wrong. Someoneâ€™s sick or in trouble.

Something is wrong,

he canâ€™t help but think.

James just doesnâ€™t want to tell you what it is. James or Remus.

Sirius grimaces down at his eggs, suddenly feeling his hunger disappear. He pushes his plate aside, thankfully Peter is too engrossed in his own to notice. Almost out of habit Siriusâ€™s eyes end up trailing over the Slytherin table. He looks for the familiar head of black curls but doesnâ€™t find any. Itâ€™s a bit odd, Reg is such a dweeb that heâ€™s almost never late for meals, but then, Rosier and Crouch arenâ€™t there either so itâ€™s possible his idiot friends are holding him up.

â€œHey, sorry,â€ Remus huffs as he drops into the seat next to Sirius, startling him out of his thoughts. â€œThat took longer than I thought,â€ he shoots Sirius a quick smile before reaching for the food in the middle of the table and piling it on his plate.

Sirius blinks, looking around. â€œWhereâ€™s James?â€

Remusâ€™s mouth pulls a little tight. â€œUhâ€”heâ€”uhâ€”stayed behind.â€

Sirius stares at him. â€œStayed behind? In the library?â€

â€œYeah, I think,â€ Remus doesnâ€™t look up from his breakfast.

Sirius keeps staring at him. If Remus had looked up maybe he would have noticed the pleading in Siriusâ€™s eyes. The â€œnoâ€ and the â€œpleaseâ€ and the â€œnot you too.â€ Heâ€™s already been doing this with James for the past year. Vague answers, obvious lies, unexplained disappearances. Now heâ€™s getting it from Remus too. When did everyone in his life stop trusting him?

Can you blame them?

hisses the voice inside his head.

After what you did.

After Snape.

â€œWhat is he doing in the library?â€ Peter demands through a mouth full of food, interrupting Siriusâ€™s spiral.

â€œCourse work,â€ Remus says, still giving all his attention to cutting up his pancakes.

Peter raises his brow and looks to Sirius in a very â€œdoes that sound as ridiculous to you as it does to me?â€ kind of way, which, yes, it does. â€œCourse work? Term only just bloody started.â€

â€œItâ€™s stuff from last term,â€ Remus looks up briefly and then away again. â€œHe got an extension on it, wants to have it done before this term starts.â€

â€œJames needed an extension on work? Since when!â€

Sirius appreciates Peterâ€™s indignation.

Remus sighs. â€œSince now I guess. Can we talk about something else?â€

â€œI guess,â€ Peter sends Sirius another look before turning back to his own breakfast.

But they donâ€™t talk about anything else. Instead they just sit there in silence. At one point Sirius notices Lily walking out of the hall and has half a mind to follow her. Just to have some excuse to get away from this table. He hasnâ€™t spoken to her since New Years Eve but he knows something happened between her and James. Another thing heâ€™s not talking to Sirius about. Plus thereâ€™s still whateverâ€™s going on with Mary and Reg. Automatically his eyes go back to the Slytherin table. Rosier and Crouch are there now but no matter how many times he scans the rows of green and sliver Sirius canâ€™t find Regulus.

â€œHey,â€ Remus gently nudges him with his elbow, bringing his attention back to him. Heâ€™s finally looking at Sirius, eyes soft.

â€œHi,â€ Sirius says stupidly, because Remusâ€™s eyes always make him stupid.

Remusâ€™s lips quirk up just a little, before he nods at Siriusâ€™s still full plate. â€œArenâ€™t you gonna eat something?â€

Theyâ€™re holding eye contact longer than they probably should but Sirius canâ€™t muster any desire to look away.

Iâ€™m sorry, he almost says.

Sorry Iâ€™m such a disappointment.

Eventually he shrugs, â€œIâ€™m not hungry.â€

Â 

Itâ€™s been almost a week.

After that breakfast Sirius makes a conscious effort to look for Regulus in the Great Hall. But Regulus never shows. Not that day or the next day or any day after that. So Sirius decides to check the map, and according to the map, Regulus Black is not currently at Hogwarts. That fact makes something curdle in Siriusâ€™s stomach.

He thinks about telling Remus. About telling James. But James is out of it these daysâ€”pale and distant and barely listening to anything Sirius says. And Remusâ€¦well, itâ€™s not like Remus isnâ€™t keeping his own secrets.

Something else the map has told Sirius is that James and Remus really are going to the library. Which he supposes is some sort of relief. At least everything theyâ€™re telling him isnâ€™t a lie. Though theyâ€™re going there to meet up with Lily Evans and Sirius honestly has no clue what to do with that information. He thinks about asking but decides against it. If they donâ€™t want to tell him thatâ€™s fine. He isnâ€™t going to beg. At least not yet.

Today, however, he isnâ€™t using the map to spy on his best friend and hisâ€¦Remus. Today heâ€™s using it to track down his brotherâ€™s asshole friends. Evan Rosier walks by just as Sirius is tucking the map away in his waistband, pulling his jumper over top and jogging to catch up to him.

â€œRosier,â€ Sirius says as he falls into step with him.

If Evan is startled he doesnâ€™t show it, just looks over at Sirius and grins. â€œWell look at that, if it isnâ€™t Sirius Black talking to little old me.â€

â€œThought Iâ€™d slum it today.â€

Rosier throws his head back and laughs. â€œI bet you did.â€

Sirius stares back at him, brow arched.

â€œBlimey, you know, I never saw it before, when people said you two looked alike but that expression?â€ another grin. â€œThat expression I know well.â€

Sirius rolls his eyes. â€œWhere is he.â€

â€œAh, there it is.â€

Sirius waits for more, but, of course, there is none. They squeeze by a pack of Hufflepuffs before starting up the stairs.

â€œRosierâ€”â€œ

â€œOoh, Reg does that too, gets all growly and shit. Honestly, the pair of you, leave some angst for the rest of us yeah?â€

Sirius works to unclench his jaw. He knows that Rosier is trying to wind him up. Hell, heâ€™d probably be acting the exact same way if their positions were reversed.

â€œIs he not coming back?â€ the question is harder for Sirius to ask than he would have thought. Some part of him has always secretly felt that as long as Regulus was at Hogwarts there was hope. That eventually he would realize that the world was so much bigger than Grimmauld Place, than Walburga. That he didnâ€™t have to be afraid of her. After all, thatâ€™s what it did for Sirius.

That hope had dwindled, of course, over the years. But still, some part of him felt comforted that his little brother was here. Away from their mother. Away from whatever was happening in that house.

â€œFunny, youâ€™ve never seemed all that concerned with where he was before?â€ Rosier says as they continue the winding climb to the astronomy classroom.

â€œYeah well, new year new me,â€ Sirius says flatly, earning him another laugh from Rosier. Rosier somehow manages to fall between genuinely gleeful and malicious. It makes it hard for Sirius to get his bearing. He likes it better when theyâ€™re just cursing one another.

â€œYou sniffing around for old Dumbly huh? He send you to spy on us?â€ thereâ€™s an edge of sincerity in Rosierâ€™s mocking tone. â€œIf he did youâ€™re not doing a very good job. Not very sneaky.â€

Something about the suspicion sticks with Sirius. â€œYou think Dumbledore cares about Regulus?â€

Rosier doesnâ€™t react, doesnâ€™t even look over at him, which is its own tell, in a way. Siriusâ€™s stomach clenches.

â€œHeâ€™s off doing something for them isnâ€™t he?â€ Sirius asks, voice low. Again, no reaction. â€œWhere?â€

Rosier stops by the ladder up to the astronomy room, looking at Sirius for the first time. â€œDonâ€™t know,â€ he says casually, like theyâ€™re discussing vacation plans. â€œWouldnâ€™t tell you if I did, but I donâ€™t. I know heâ€™s not here. I know heâ€™s not at home. You do with that what you will,â€ he pauses, eyes running Sirius over, looking for something, though Sirius has no idea what.

â€œBut if you wanna know if heâ€™ll be backâ€¦â€ Rosier shrugs. â€œIf it were me? No way. But then, Reg has always loved this place more than he should.â€

Itâ€™s work for Sirius not to let his reaction to those words show on his face. He didnâ€™t know that, about Regulus.

â€œAlright well, fuck off would you? If you keep walking me to my classes the girls are gonna start getting jealous.â€

Â 

â€œProngs and Moony MIA again?â€ Peter asks as he gets out of the shower.

â€œSirius?â€ Peter asks tentatively, standing beside him as he slides his book bag over his shoulder. â€œYou alright?â€

Sirius almost laughs.

Almost.

â€œIâ€™m tired of this bullshit,â€ he says, hands clenched in his pockets.

No. Not really. Heâ€™s tried. He always gets stonewalled. Homework. Special projects. Trying to get ready for NEWTS. Sirius has stopped asking because he hates the way Remusâ€™s lies crawl under his skin.

â€œCâ€™mon,â€ he says sharply, heading for the door.

â€œBreakfast?â€ Peter asks.

â€œNo, not today,â€ he practically shoves a group of first years out of his way as he cuts across the common room. â€œToday weâ€™re going to the fucking library.â€

Â

â€œWhat the hell?â€ he hears himself shouting across the library before he can stop himself.

Itâ€™s all a bit of a blur after that.

â€œSirius! Oh come on, Sirius would you justâ€”can you just slow down for like a second? Jesus.â€

â€œSiriusâ€”â€œ

â€œPlease donâ€™t lie to me again because I swear Iâ€™ll lose it Moons. Iâ€™m not a fucking idiot.â€

â€œThen why do you keep treating me like one?â€ itâ€™s work for him to keep his voice down. Theyâ€™re standing in the middle of the corridor, out in public, anyone could come by. Everything about this is reckless.

â€œBrilliant.â€

â€œYeah,â€ Remus finally says. â€œYeah, he never turned up after Christmas.â€

â€œThe Slytherin James is seeing,â€ his voice shakes, he doesnâ€™t bother trying to control it. â€œThe Slytherin boy James is seeing didnâ€™t come back after Christmas.â€

â€œRegulus,â€ the name chokes him. â€œRegulus. Heâ€™s seeing Regulus?â€

He waits for Remus to contradict him. To tell him that heâ€™s crazy. That James would never. He would never. He would never do that to Sirius. He turns away from Remus, away from the school, and starts walking. He needs to be alone. He needs to get himself under control. â€œSirius,â€ Remusâ€™s voice sounds wrecked. â€œSiriusâ€”fuckâ€”please, please let me explain, let meâ€”â€œ Remus grabs hold of his arm and Sirius instantly whips around and shoves him back, sending Remus stumbling to the ground.

â€œYou knew!â€ his voice is jagged edges. His voice is empty stomachs, and locked doors, and his motherâ€™s handprint on his cheek. Itâ€™s funny maybe, seeing as thatâ€™s what Reg is always accusing him of. Running away. This time is different though. This time he has no one to run to.

PART III REGULUS

Â 

Polyjuice is how theyâ€™ve been able to keep up the facade. Flasks are smuggled in and out by the cleaning lady who comes once a day to empty the chamber pot in the corner of the room. Well, chamber pot is generous. Itâ€™s really a bucket.

Except today sheâ€™s empty handed.

â€œNothing?â€ Regulus asks, voice rough from lack of use.

She only shrugs. â€œThey did not give me anything, I cannot bring anything.â€

So now Regulus is pacing his tiny cell, heart beating about a mile a minute as he feels the potion wearing off. Wondering if heâ€™s just been sold out. If heâ€™ll be stuck in here forever. If the Dementors will still keep away once he has a different face. Not that they use their eyes really. They seem to justâ€¦feel you. Regulus shivers.

He wishes heâ€™d asked more questions. Not that you can really ask the Dark Lord questions. Or Walburga for that matter. Seeing the two of them together, side by side at the end of the long dining table, had really been something else. Like walking into a nightmare.

Distantly he hears someone scream. That happens from time to time. From what he can tell prisoners here are kept fairly far apart, or at least he canâ€™t hear anyone directly next to him. But the screams still find you, undaunted by distance or walls. Regulus doesnâ€™t think heâ€™ll ever forget them.

He takes in a deep breath, having a panic attack is going to solve exactly nothing. He closes his eyes, standing in the middle of his cell and breathes. Just like he does back at Grimmauld Place, when it gets to be too much.

Inhale.

Exhale.

Inhale.

Exhale.

He pictures his flat with James. Pictures them curled up on the couch, covered in blankets, Regulus reading while James tosses his Quaffle up and down. He thinks about the dirty dishes in the sink theyâ€™ll fight over later. Thinks about the record player that will make James pull Regulus dramatically to his feet, twirling him around their tiny living room. Regulus will pretend to hate it, heâ€™ll roll his eyes and huff, but eventually heâ€™ll hook his chin over Jamesâ€™s shoulder and give in. Let James pull him close.

I am an excellent dancer, the James in his head says.

â€œI had to take ballroom classes for most of my childhood so I wouldnâ€™t get too cocky.â€

James laughs. Oh my God! Did you really? I canâ€™t believe I didnâ€™t know this. Why havenâ€™t you been trying to woo me with your dance moves?

â€œI didnâ€™t realize ballroom dancing was such a turn on for you.â€

Everything you do is a turn on for me.

Regulus lets out a laugh that somehow turns into a sob. Caught in his throat. Itâ€™s hard but he swallows it down. Keeps his eyes closed and his cheeks dry. He can feel himself shrinking, feel his hair brush his ears and the back of his neck, feel his mouth and teeth become his own again.

Reg?

â€œI wish you were real,â€ he whispers into the dark. Now that heâ€™s back in his own body he suddenly feels painfully vulnerable.

But I am real.

Regulus goes to speak when the sound of screeching hinges causes his eyes to fly open, his feet stumbling backwards at the sight of three hooded figures standing at the open door of his cell. At first he thinks the Dementors have finally come for him but it only takes a second for him to realize that thatâ€™s not right.

One of the figures steps forward pulling back his hood and revealing a shock of ash blond hair. Lucius Malfoy gives Regulus a wolfish grin as the younger boy collapses against the back wall, sucking in the breath heâ€™d been holding.

â€œMiss me?â€

Regulus doesnâ€™t dignify that with an answer. â€œWhatâ€™re you doing?â€

The two people behind him step forward as well, pulling back their own hoods, but Regulus doesnâ€™t recognize them. Two men, theyâ€™re big, muscular, remind Regulus of bulldogs. He turns his attention back to Lucius.

â€œIsnâ€™t it obvious?â€ Lucius says with an infuriating amount of amusement. â€œIâ€™m here to rescue you.â€

Regulus blinks, his too big clothes slipping off his shoulder as he tries to get his bearings. â€œThe job is done?â€

Lucius nods. â€œThe job is done. You bought the Dark Lord the time he needed, he is very grateful, now, hop to.â€

â€œMy wand,â€ Regulus says as the three men turn towards the door.

Lucius looks back over his shoulder, giving Regulus another grin. â€œAh, yes, of course.â€ He tosses him his wand and Regulus fumbles before dropping it. Still awkward back in his own body, his depth perception off.

â€œCome along little prince, we mustnâ€™t dally,â€ Luciusâ€™s posh accent feels absurd in this place.

Regulus tries not to trip on his trailing pant legs as he half-jogs after the others. Last time they were able to Apparate outside the prison so Regulus assumes thatâ€™s where their headed until Lucius makes a sharp turn before the front doors.

Regulusâ€™s stomach lurches.

â€œLucius?â€

â€œCome along Regulus.â€

He pauses, eyeing the doors, desperate to walk towards them. Not that he could Apparate himself, but it would be a relief just to see the sky again. He doesnâ€™t even know what time of day it is.

â€œRegulus,â€ Lucius calls warningly from up ahead and one of the bulldogs gives him a hard shove in the back.

Gripping his wand tightly Regulus tears his eyes away from the doors and starts walking again.

â€œWhatâ€™re we doing?â€ he hisses once he catches up to Lucius.

â€œTsk, tsk, so demanding,â€ Lucius says flippantly, though his eyes arenâ€™t on Regulus but on the cells to the right of them.

Most of the cells they pass are empty but some arenâ€™t. Some have prisoners who look up at them with wide, terrified eyes. Which is not nearly as bad as the ones who look up without any light in their eyes at all. Eventually Regulus just looks at his feet, praying that whatever Lucius is up to itâ€™s over quickly.

â€œAh,â€ Lucius says happily as they come to stop in front of one cell in particular. â€œHere we are.â€

The man inside looks around Luciusâ€™s age, maybe a little younger, barely out of Hogwarts. He has floppy brown hair and big blue eyes. He quickly scrambles to his feet when he sees them, more alert than many of the other prisoners.

â€œHave you come to let me out? Did my parents finally get through to you? I didnâ€™t do it, I promise I didnâ€™t. I would never,â€ he steps towards the bars, babbling, clearly nervous. â€œIâ€™m a herbologist, thatâ€™s all, I tend to plants for my fatherâ€™s potions business. Iâ€™m not involved in any of this I swear.â€ Heâ€™s gripping the bars of his cell, practically trying to pull himself through.

â€œPlease,â€ he goes on desperately. â€œPlease, you have to believe me.â€

Lucius smiles. Itâ€™s an expression Regulus has seen many times before. It isnâ€™tâ€¦necessarilyâ€¦pleasant. â€œOh I do.â€

â€œYou do?â€

â€œYes,â€ Lucius says calmly.

The boyâ€™s whole body relaxes and he all but collapses into the bars. â€œOh thank Merlin. You donâ€™t understand how scared Iâ€™ve been. I told the Aurors, I told them I would neverâ€”â€œ

â€œRegulus,â€ Lucius cuts off the manâ€™s ramblings and Regulus instantly goes stiff at being addressed. â€œKill him.â€

Regulus turns to Lucius, his mouth open, while the boy in the cell stumbles back, away from the bars. â€œWhat? NO! Who are you? I thoughtâ€¦you said you believed me! Who are you?â€

But Lucius isnâ€™t paying him any mind. He has eyes only for Regulus who is still staring at him in horror.

â€œGo on,â€ he says, like heâ€™s asking him to set the dining room table.

â€œW-why?â€ Regulus finally manages to ask, the man in question is still babbling pleas for mercy in the background.

â€œIt doesnâ€™t matter,â€ Lucius sounds about as serious as Regulus has ever heard him. â€œThe Dark Lord has requested that you do it so you will do it.â€

â€œBut why?â€ Regulus repeats desperately. â€œWhatâ€™s he done? Whatâ€™s the purpose?â€

â€œI told you, it doesnâ€™t matter.â€

The screaming from early starts up again, the familiar cold that accompanies the presence of the Demnetors drifting over Regulus.

â€œLuciusâ€”â€œ

â€œKill him,â€ Lucius steps forward. â€œOr I will kill him and then I will stuff you in there and leave you at the mercy of the guards.â€

There is no trace of mockery, Lucius means every word, and Regulus doesnâ€™t doubt that he has the blessing of Walburga to carry it out. Sheâ€™ll not want Regulus back if he fails the Dark Lordâ€™s test.

He closes his eyes briefly, feeling the cold inching closer. He should have known this had been too easy.

Swallowing, he turns towards the cell, wand raised. The man inside, whoâ€™s already backed himself against the wall, slides to the ground.

â€œNo, please, please, please,â€ his voice is soft, desperate. â€œIâ€™m a good man. I swear. Iâ€™m going to get married, please.â€

Regulusâ€™s hand is shaking and heâ€™s almost positive he canâ€™t do this. That heâ€™s just going to come apart right here on the spot.

â€œNow Regulus,â€ Lucius commands.

Regulus tries to breathe.

â€œPlease, please, please.â€

â€œRegulus.â€

You canâ€™t save him.

â€œPlease, please, please.â€

You know you canâ€™t save him.

â€œIf I have to do this Regulus,â€ Lucius says dangerously. â€œYouâ€™ll never leave this place, do you understand?â€

His arm is still raised, wand still aimed.

â€œI love her. I promised Iâ€™d come back. Weâ€™re going to start a family. Have mercy.â€

â€œRegulusâ€”â€œ

â€œAvada Kedavra.â€

Everything seems to go quiet after that.

Like the whole world has stopped. Regulus doesnâ€™t drop his arm even when the man across from him slumps over. Regulus is shaking so badly heâ€™s surprised the wand doesnâ€™t fall from his hands. He canâ€™t move. Canâ€™t breathe. Canâ€™t think

Everything is so quiet.

So still.

â€œEasy now,â€ Regulus flinches when Lucius touches him but doesnâ€™t pull away, doesnâ€™t quite have that level of control over his body at the moment. Luciusâ€™s touch is surprisingly gentle as he lowers Regulusâ€™s arm for him, keeping one hand on his back, stabling him.

â€œThat was good Reg,â€ he says softly. â€œYou did good.â€

Regulus gives him one look before turning away and falling to his hands and knees, regurgitating what little is left in stomach.

He hears one of the bulldogs mutter something and the other laughs. He canâ€™t make out the words but he can imagine what they are.

â€œOh shut-up Crabbe,â€ Lucius snaps. â€œDonâ€™t act like you didnâ€™t piss your pants the first time you killed someone.â€

Killed someone.

Killed someone.

I killed someone.

Regulus quickly grabs hold of that thought and shoves it somewhere way down deep. Heâ€™ll deal with it later, when heâ€™s not on his hands and knees on the floor of Azkaban Prison.

â€œCâ€™mon Reg,â€ Lucius slides a hand under his arm and hauls him up. â€œWe gotta go.â€

â€œWhat did he do?â€ Regulus mumbles, as Lucius starts guiding him back towards the front doors.

Lucius gives him a sidelong look. â€œJust like he said. Mistaken identity.â€

â€œMistaken identity,â€ Regulus repeats.

â€œThey thought he was one of ours, been questioning him for weeks, following a false lead. Think weâ€™ve been tampering with potions ingredients or something equally ridiculous. They canâ€™t figure out what the Dark Lordâ€™s next move will be and itâ€™s making them reckless.â€

Regulus tries to focus. Itâ€™s difficult because his brain feels foggy. Shock, he thinks dimly.

â€œBut why kill him then?â€ he asks, desperate.

â€œThey were going to use Veritaserum on him in the morning. Find out the truth.â€

â€œBut if heâ€™s not one of us then he canâ€™t have any secrets to spill,â€ Regulus winces at the sound of another distant scream. He really needs to get out of here.

â€œNo, but then the Aurors would realize theyâ€™d been chasing a dead end, and that would be inconvenient for us. This way there will always be that little bit of doubt, theyâ€™ll always wonder â€˜was he a Death Eater or wasnâ€™t he.â€™â€

Regulus feels another wave of nausea crash over him. â€œA little bit of doubt,â€ he repeats. â€œThat manâ€™s life for a little bit of doubt?â€

They stop at the doors, Lucius finally releasing Regulusâ€™s arm as he turns to him fully, a wry expression on his face. â€œOh come now Regulus, donâ€™t look at me like that,â€ he reaches out and tucks a lock of hair behind Regulusâ€™s ear.

â€œAfter all, youâ€™re the one who killed him.â€

Chapter End Notes

AHHH

Sirius knows! HE KNOWS. I'm dying. I've been dying since I wrote that. Like, I gotta be real with you guys, originally Sirius was never going to find out because I just felt like there was no way him and James would ever get past it. But here we are. Now he knows. So I guess we'll see.

ANYWAY I hope the timeline stuff wasn't too confusing and that you liked it etc. etc. !

Thank you always for the nice comments and also all your theories and thoughts, I love all of it!

Chapter 35

Chapter Summary

Warning: this chapter is very soft. Please handle with care.

Chapter Notes

See the end of the chapter for notes

PART I: SIRIUS

He blinks awake, jaw cracking as he yawns. He cast a warming charm last night but it must have warn off because he can feel the chilly bite of the wind through the cracked, lifeless house. Itâ€™s fine though, his fur keeps him warm enough.

He doesnâ€™t have proper thoughts as a dog.

Or proper feelings.

Heâ€™s still him, still in control. But heâ€™s alsoâ€¦animal. Everything is filtered through this new body, these new senses, this new brain. Heâ€™s still Sirius. Heâ€™s just Sirius the dog not the boy. When things become too much, too hard to handle, itâ€™s easier being like this. Things hurtâ€”if not lessâ€”than different.

His first real thought, as he comes awake, is Moony.

Moony, Moony, Moony.

This place smells so strongly of him, heâ€™s in the floorboards, the mattress, filling Siriusâ€™s nose and wrapping around his chest. He whines, burying his head more fully in the blankets piled around him.

Moony, Moony, Moony.

Even as a dog Sirius misses him. But he canâ€™t go to him. Canâ€™t talk to him. Canâ€™t talk to anyone. Sirius huffs, scratching at the mattress. He just wants to be a dog. To hunt and sleep and not have to feel that ache in his chest every time he remembers that the most important people in his life have been lying to him.

Itâ€™s funny really, that itâ€™s Regulus who has once again proven to Sirius that he canâ€™t place his trust in other people. Maybe he planned it this way. It would be so like their mother, to try and teach him a lesson by seducing his best friends away from him.

When will you learn brother? he can hear Regulusâ€™s snide voice so clearly that his lips actually curl back, teeth baring themselves at the very thought of him.

Everyone lets you down, the voice goes on. Everyone is out for themselves. I mean, how could you be so stupid? After everything? This is why the Dark Lord will win. Dumbledoreâ€™s supporters are nothing but a bunch of disappointments and morons.

Another whine escapes Sirius without his permission.

No.

He canâ€™t go back.

Canâ€™t face any of them.

So heâ€™ll stay here. For now.

Hunt and sleep and wander around the forest. Then come back and lie in blankets that smell like Remus and pretend it doesnâ€™t feel like breaking apart.
