PART II JAMES

James is a wreck.

Has been since Christmas. Maybe even before then.

He feels himself being torn in a million directions. Or maybe more accurately, in two directions, but with the force of a million hands. Sirius or Regulus. Who does he go after? Who does he fight for? Both, his thoughts insist vehemently. I love them both. I need them both. But he isnâ€™t sure life works like that.

Last night is a blur:

â€œMaybe we should go to Dumbledore?â€ Lily had suggested while she watched James pace the Prefect office once he could no longer bring himself to stare at the map. At the spot the Quaffle was hovering over.

â€œI donâ€™t know,â€ James had said. Because he really hadnâ€™t. He knew Regulus wouldnâ€™t want that, that he didnâ€™t trust Dumbledore, and James wasnâ€™t sure he was wrong not to.

â€œHe might helpâ€”it canâ€™t beâ€”-they canâ€™t keep kids in Azkaban can they? Thereâ€™s no way thatâ€™s legal.â€

James had made a noncommittal noise. As far as he knew there were no hard and fast rules about who could and couldnâ€™t be put in Azkaban, as long as their crime was bad enough. But what could Regulus have done? Alice said the Pureblood families were almost untouchable, so why had they allowed this to happen? All he could picture was Regulus alone in a cell. Was a Dementor hovering above him sucking the life out of him.

â€œJames,â€ heâ€™d heard the door open almost at the same moment that heâ€™d heard his nameâ€”cracked and desperate. One look at Remus was all heâ€™d needed to know something was very very wrong.

Without thinking James had immediately stepped towards him. â€œWhat is it? Whatâ€™s happened?â€ His voice had come out soft, Remus pale, eyes red-rimmed. Remus did not cry easily.

â€œItâ€™sâ€”heâ€”â€œ but heâ€™d cut himself off, looking frantically at Lily.

â€œEvans can you give us a minute?â€ James had asked, not taking his eyes off of Remus.

â€œOhâ€”yeah, of course. Justâ€”erâ€”let me know if thereâ€™s anything I can do okay?â€

â€œI will, and thank you, again,â€ heâ€™d met her eyes briefly as she passed him on her way to the door.

â€œFuck James, fuck,â€ Remus said the minute she was gone. â€œI didnâ€™t mean to. I messed it all up. I donâ€™t know what to do.â€

â€œItâ€™s okay, whatever it is itâ€™s okay, just sit down alright?â€ James guided him to the couch while words continued to spill out of his mouth.

â€œI donâ€™t know where he is. I checked the map but I canâ€™t find him. I should have followed him but he was so angry with meâ€”â€œ his voice shook and cracked and fell apart, his words unravelling.

â€œRemus, breathe,â€ James said calmly, placing a steadying hand on his friendâ€™s shoulder. â€œWhat is it? Whatâ€™s happened?â€

Remus shook his head, tears in his eyes again, breaking Jamesâ€™s heart. â€œHe knows,â€ heâ€™d whispered, sending something cold down Jamesâ€™s spine. â€œSirius knows.â€

Â 

Now. Sitting in the Great Hall at Breakfast, Remus silent beside him, Peter glancing nervously between them, Sirius still missing, James has the overwhelming desire to hear his motherâ€™s voice. To be held by her. Told what to do. He tried to handle this himself, tried to fix things, and all heâ€™s done is make everything worse. Heâ€™d done a half-hearted search for Sirius last night but Remus was right, he wasnâ€™t on the map, James wasnâ€™t sure if heâ€™d gone into town or what. He also wasnâ€™t sure what he would do if he found him.

Apologize?

Beg for forgiveness?

Ask for his help?

Look, I know youâ€™re angry at me, but your brother is currently in Azkaban and I donâ€™t know what Iâ€™m supposed to do about it.

In the end it didnâ€™t matter. He couldnâ€™t find him.

Remus drops his fork onto the eggs heâ€™d been pushing around his plate for the last fifteen minutes. â€œIâ€™m gonna go look for him.â€

â€œDid you guys have a fight or something?â€ Peter asks from across the table.

Remus sighs. â€œYeah,â€ he runs a hand over his face, voice cracking. â€œYeah, we had a fight and I need to justâ€”â€œ James knocks his foot against Remusâ€™s under the table, letting him know that heâ€™s there.

â€œIâ€™ll come with you.â€

Remus gives him a watery smile. â€œIâ€™m not sure if thatâ€™ll make it better or worse.â€

â€œMe either,â€ James says honestly. â€œBut Iâ€™m not sure I want you dealing with this alone.â€

â€œIâ€™ll help too!â€ Peter pipes up. â€œObviously.â€

James watches Remus send him a wary look. â€œListen, Peteâ€”â€œ But James puts a hand on his shoulder, stopping him.

â€œItâ€™s okay, Iâ€™m done lying,â€ he tells him, as causally as he can manage while his heart hammers in his chest. â€œWhatâ€™s the point anymore?â€ though he still does a quick check with his eyes to make sure no one is sitting near enough to listen in.

â€œLying about what?â€ Peter demands, starting to sound slightly exasperated.

â€œAre you sure?â€ Remus asks.

James just nods, letting out a deep breath. â€œListen, Pete, I donâ€™t know how to reallyâ€¦.break this news gently butâ€”erâ€”Iâ€™m seeing Regulus.â€

Peter looks back at him, expression blank, causing something heavy to form in the pit of Jamesâ€™s stomach. He opens his mouth to try and explain when Peter suddenly smiles, shutting James up immediately.

â€œUm, yeah,â€ he says, the â€œduhâ€ clearly implied by his tone. â€œI know?â€

â€œYou know?â€ James and Remus say at almost the exact same time.

Peter looks between them like he canâ€™t figure out why theyâ€™re so confused. â€œYeah?â€

James struggles to get his thoughts in order, a laugh that borders on hysterical falling from his mouth. â€œHow do you know?â€

Peter shrugs, biting into his buttered toast and chewing thoughtfully. â€œWell,â€ he says, before swallowing, â€œfor starters, you look at him like you want to eat him every time Slytherin plays Quidditch.â€

If James had been drinking he would have done a spit take. As it is, he makes several spluttery-choking noises, while Remus actually has the audacity to laugh.

â€œPlus thereâ€™s been a lot of references to a mysterious â€œheâ€ whoâ€™s apparently in Slytherin since you went and broke into their bloody dorm after the party that one time,â€ he shrugs. â€œJust put two and two together I guess.â€

James is still struggling to come up with something to say, scrubbing his face with his hands. â€œAnd youâ€™reâ€¦okay with it?â€ he finally manages, because he canâ€™t quite believe that Peter is willing to just shrug this off.

The other Marauder wrinkles his nose. â€œWell, I mean, Iâ€™d rather not watch you snog him. But as long as thatâ€™s off the tableâ€¦I donâ€™t see how it matters to me who you get with. I mean, itâ€™s weird as all hell, butâ€¦â€ he shrugs.

â€œI guess,â€ Peter says, sounding unconvinced as he continues to chew on his breakfast.

â€œGuys, give me like five seconds!â€ Peter says urgently.

â€œYou know weâ€™re just going upstairs right? You can meet us there.â€

â€œOr you could just wait!â€ Peter says indignantly, through a mouth full of beans.

â€œJames,â€ the tone of Remusâ€™s voice grabs Jamesâ€™s attention immediately and when he looks over he finds him wide eyed and tense.

â€œRemus? What is it?â€ but Remus just shakes his head, swearing softly under his breath.

â€œIs he having a stroke?â€ Peter demands, somehow still with his mouth full.

â€œI donâ€™tâ€”â€œ James starts when a noise across the room catches his attention and he looks over without thinking. Just instinct. Looks over and feels his whole body jolt like heâ€™s just been thrown head first into a wall.

â€œOh,â€ James says weakly, his legs actually giving out under him as he promptly sits back down at the table, watching Regulus across the room, walking towards his friends. James has had this fantasy so many times over the last two weeks. Imagined this exact scenario. Heâ€™s not so sure he isnâ€™t imagining it now.

Regulus looks thin and pale, but heâ€™s there. Heâ€™s walking. He isnâ€™t in Azkaban, isnâ€™t having the soul ripped out of him. It takes everything in James not to call out his name.

â€œWhat is it? Whatâ€™s going on?â€ Peter asks looking around, but James canâ€™t speak, canâ€™t take his eyes off of Regulus, afraid that if he does heâ€™ll disappear again. If it werenâ€™t for the fact that Remus could clearly see him too James would have thought he was hallucinating.

Come on, James thinks as he watches Evan Rosier get up and give Regulus a hug. Come on. Look over here. Find me. Please.

Like heâ€™d heard him, Regulus turns his head, eyes searching the Gryffindor table for only a second before they lock with Jamesâ€™s. God that hurts. Makes something with claws start to scratch the inside of Jamesâ€™s chest.

And then itâ€™s gone. Regulus turning away, sitting down with his friends. James feels like heâ€™s just run a mile, breathing in deep as he does his best to catch his breath.

Remus squeezes his arm. â€œGo on, go to him.â€

James just shakes his head. â€œI canâ€™t. Not here.â€ But God does he want to.

â€œGo wherever it is you do, heâ€™ll follow, Iâ€™d bet anything,â€ Remus gives him a sad smile and James finds himself searching his friendâ€™s face.

â€œSirius?â€ he asks finally.

â€œMe and Pete will find him. You wonâ€™t be any use now anyway,â€ he nods his head in Regulusâ€™s direction. â€œGo on.â€

Feeling oddly numb James stands back up. â€œYeah, okay, thank you.â€

â€œOf course,â€ Remus says, and then; â€œJames? Be careful, alright?â€

James nods. â€œYeah,â€ he looks briefly over at the Slytherin table and then back to Remus, â€œYeah I will. You too.â€

Remus lets out a huff. â€œI can handle him I promise.â€ James knows that itâ€™s so much more complicated than that but thereâ€™s no point arguing.

â€œIâ€™ll be backâ€”Iâ€™ll come find you okay? Donâ€™t do anything stupid,â€ and then, with a half-hearted grin. â€œNot without me yeah?â€

â€œSure James,â€ Remus says softly. James isnâ€™t at all sure that this is the right decision, but he does know that heâ€™ll never be able to concentrate now. Not until he speaks to Regulus. Not until heâ€™s able to touch him. To make sure heâ€™s real. To make sure heâ€™s okay.

He nods at Peter before squeezing Remusâ€™s shoulder and heading out of the Great Hall on shaking legs.

He isnâ€™t sure if Regulus even sees him leave, but the truth is, if he stays in that room for another second heâ€™s probably gonna do something stupid. Like kiss Regulus. Like cry. So he escapes to the Come and Go Room, heart aching the moment he steps inside and feels its warmth. Itâ€™s been a little over a month since he was last here.

He pauses at the door, letting it all hit him, the memories and feelings that this room is saturated in. Then he takes a shaky breath in and sits on the end of the bed, resting his elbows on his knees and dropping his head into his hands.

â€œHeâ€™s okay,â€ he tries to tell himself, tries to get himself to believe. â€œHeâ€™s okay, heâ€™s okay, heâ€™s okay.â€ He takes in a deep breath and lets it out slowly. Heâ€™s been so fucking scared, spending every minute since heâ€™d last seen Regulus worrying. Knowing that Reg wasnâ€™t safe and that there was nothing he could do about itâ€”even before he went missing. He squeezes his eyes shut. â€œHeâ€™s okay, heâ€™s okay, heâ€™s okay.â€ It comes out like a prayer, though James doesnâ€™t know who wizards pray to. After all, they donâ€™t need faith. They have magic.

The door opens and Jamesâ€™s head shoots up, nearly tripping as he gets to his feet. Regulus is there, standing in front of the door, so fucking close James canâ€™t breathe. For a minute they just stay like that, staring at one another, the air filling up with something that buzzes and sparks and begs to be touched. But James doesnâ€™t know what to do, heâ€™s held in place by Regulusâ€™s eyes, by his stare, by all the things he feels for him.

Itâ€™s Reg who steps forward eventually, breaking the moment apart as he walks right up to James, throwing his arms around his torso and pressing his face into his chest. James doesnâ€™t hesitate, instantly hugging him back.

â€œI have you,â€ he whispers as he presses desperate kisses to the top of Regulusâ€™s head. â€œYouâ€™re safe, youâ€™re safe, I have you.â€

Regulus doesnâ€™t answer, just squeezes tighter, trembling in Jamesâ€™s arms and James has to fight back the burning in his eyes because he knows Reg needs him to be strong and he can do that. He can. For this boy he can push all the rest of it aside.

â€œI love you, youâ€™re safe, I promise,â€ Jamesâ€™s mouth is running away with itself, he isnâ€™t even entirely sure what heâ€™s saying only that he wants Regulus to know that heâ€™s there.

â€œAre you real?â€ Regulus asks after a few minutes, voice small and muffled by Jamesâ€™s shirt.

James almost laughs, because honestly he could ask Regulus the same question. â€œYeah,â€ he says instead. â€œYeah Iâ€™m real.â€

â€œPromise?â€

James plants another kiss on the top of his head. â€œPromise.â€

Eventually James shuffles them towards the bed, wrapping them up in the warm blankets and holding Regulus to his chest. His hands rub soothing circles into his back as he continues his running monologue of comfort. After a few minutes Regulus tilts his head back, looking up at him.

â€œHey,â€ James says softly. â€œHey, hi, how are you?â€ his hands cup Regulusâ€™s face, thumbs brushing against his cheeks.

Regulusâ€™s eyes flutter closed at the touch. â€œYou know,â€ he croaks, sounding a bit more like himself, â€œthere was a second there, where I thought Iâ€™d never see you again.â€

â€œClose to Quidditch.â€

Regulus cracks one eye open to glare at him and James has to bite the inside of his cheek to keep from smiling.

â€œAre you really going to nitpick my fantasy?â€

â€œNo, sorry. Tell me about our flat in London.â€

Regulus closes his eyes again, humming contently. â€œItâ€™s small and cozy. Lots of carpets and blankets and pillows. Lots of fireplacesâ€”though only one of them is connected to the Floo and we keep it off most of the time.â€

James isnâ€™t sure what to do with the information that Regulusâ€™s fantasy involves cutting himself off from the Wizarding world as much as possible.

â€œYou make a mess, obviously.â€

â€œBut you make up for it by cooking me hamburgers the Muggle way.â€

That feels like a punch to the gut. That Regulus remembers what he wrote in his letter. That he liked it. Wanted that too. Wanted everything James saw for them. He knows theyâ€™re young. He does. But he canâ€™t help it, imagining his future with Reg.

â€œIâ€™d learn to cook other things for you,â€ he says finally, thumb stroking Regulusâ€™s cheek. â€œIf you wanted.â€

â€œRight, but wouldnâ€™t he, you know, stay with your mum? At Grimmauld?â€

Thereâ€™s something heartbreaking about those words, though James canâ€™t decide if itâ€™s the love Regulus has for his elf, or if its the pain he clearly feels about being left behind.

â€œOkay,â€ James leans forward, kissing him softly. â€œI wonâ€™t cook too much.â€

Heâ€™s okay.

Heâ€™s okay.

Heâ€™s okay.

Thereâ€™s a shift in Regulus before he speaks again. James can feel it. Can feel him trying to put up his walls, to protect himself from Jamesâ€™s reaction. â€œDeveloped my own tracking spell,â€ like itâ€™s no big deal.

â€œWe used the Quaffle you made me to track your magical signature. The minute you used magic we were able to find you.â€

â€œOh,â€ the next second Regulus is scrambling out of the bed, practically falling onto his hands and knees as he vomits on the floor.

â€œFor what? You donâ€™t need toâ€”you donâ€™t need to apologize to me Reg.â€ Just tell me what I said, he almost asks, just tell me what happened to you. â€œI was thinking about it,â€ James shrugs, because he had been.

â€œOf course.â€

â€œSirius knows.â€

â€œSirius knows what?â€

â€œHe knows about us.â€

PART III REMUS

Remus stands in front of the whomping willow, watching Peter scurry through the grass towards the knot in the trunk. Heâ€™s embarrassed that he didnâ€™t think of it earlier. Or at all, for that matter. It was Peter who suggested it, after they had once again fruitlessly searched the map for Siriusâ€™s name.

Itâ€™s so obvious. Remus doesnâ€™t know how he missed it. Except maybe that he tries not to think about the Shack. Tries to forget it exists. Forget why this big hulking tree has been planted here in the first place. Itâ€™s never occurred to him that the Shack could act as actual shelter and not just a glorified cage.

The tree branches slow to a stop and a minute later Peter is back, transforming into himself again.

â€œSure you donâ€™t want me to go with you?â€ he asks, straightening up, breath heavy after the run.

â€œNo, thanks. If heâ€™s in there I thinkâ€¦I think itâ€™s probably best if itâ€™s just me.â€

Peter nods, not looking the least bit put out at the idea of missing the altercation.

â€œWell alright then,â€ he claps Remus good naturedly on the back. â€œGood luck.â€

Remus shoots him a weak smile. â€œThanks.â€

He hates every step he takes towards the Willow. Every step along the dark, damp passage underneath it, every step into the dusty, creaking house. Heâ€™s trembling by the time he reaches the top of the stairs.

â€œSirius?â€ he calls out, resisting the urge to pull out his wand. He strains his ears but he canâ€™t hear anythingâ€”well, besides the wind. Itâ€™s freezing in here, his teeth already chattering as he walks along the hallway towards the bedroom. In the light of day he can make out more of the faded wallpaper. Of the desperate scratches on the walls. He shivers. Most of them are old. From his first and second year, before he had the others. Though some are undoubtedly also from last year.

He tenses when he reaches the bedroom but itâ€™s empty, just like the rest of the house. Remus sighs, sagging against the doorframe. Itâ€™d been a good idea, better than any Remus had been able to come up with, but still wrong.

Heâ€™s stepping back into the hallway when he hears itâ€”a door, steps on the floor, heading for the stairs. Something isnâ€™t right though, the steps clatter, like heels on hardwood, and there are too many of them, coming too fast. It isnâ€™t until he sees the dark head cresting the top of the stairs that he realizes, of course, what the reason must be.

â€œOh,â€ Remus says stupidly, as a large black dog comes to an abrupt halt at the other end of the hallway. â€œHi.â€

Thereâ€™s another moment of silence before Padfoot growls, baring his teeth and flattening his ears.

Remus arches his brow. â€œAre you going to bite me Sirius?â€ he asks, with more bravado than he feels. â€œYou think Iâ€™m afraid of teeth? Of claws? Me?â€ he almost laughs, opening his arms wide. â€œGo on then, whatâ€™s a few more scars right?â€

The growling promptly turns into a whine thatâ€™s so pitiful Remus almost takes it back. But before he can speak again Padfoot is moving, he brushes past Remus and goes into the bedroom behind him without so much as a sniff in his direction. Remus takes a deep breath before following after him.

Padfoot is curled up in the corner, back to the door and therefore also to Remus. Remus watches him for a few moments before sighing.

â€œIâ€™m sorry.â€

Padfoot huffs.

â€œI know. Believe me I know. I justâ€”I mean at first I was in shock, and everything between us was so back and forth last year that I hardly wanted to add to thatâ€”â€œ

â€œI know,â€ he repeats desperately. â€œLook, I told him it was fucked up okay? I told him not to do it but you know James,â€ he stares at the dark mass in front of him, head still buried. â€œI didnâ€™t want to hurt you. But I didnâ€™t want to hurt him either.â€

Nothing. No more grumbling, no barking, not even the twitch of his tail or ears. The house is silent.

â€œSirius,â€ Remus whispers finally. â€œPlease.â€

â€œTheyâ€™re not just fooling around,â€ he says finally. â€œIâ€™m sure you donâ€™t want to hear that but Iâ€™m also sure that you know it already since James is your best mate and you and I are both well aware that heâ€™s never had a casual emotion in his life,â€ and since Remus continues to get the silent treatment he decides to keep going, feeling an uncomfortable mix of emotions pressing against the inside of his skin.

â€œI thought that Regulus was just using him to get at you, but he isnâ€™t. Fuck Sirius, they love each other. I mean properly love each other. So I donâ€™t know what I was supposed to do? â€œRegulus doesnâ€™t love him,â€ Sirius says, voice all twisted, though whether thatâ€™s from anger or the transformation Remus doesnâ€™t know.

â€œI know you donâ€™t wantâ€”â€œ

â€œIâ€™m sorry.â€

Chapter End Notes

Hello beautiful people!

I think this chapter was a little shorter but hey, Regulus is back! So, that's fun. Also I feel like Peter was a real MVP in this chapter which, honestly, is a surprise to us all and unlikely to happen again. But I guess even rats have good days.

Thank you for all your kudos and comments and I've seen some like tiktoks and fan videos too which honestly is just so cool to me so like wow love you guys :) :)

Chapter 36

Is anyone okay? No. Will they be eventually? Also no.

Tw: deals with trauma surrounding death and murder

PART I JAMES

Regulus is just staring at him, eyes wide, something complicated twisting up his face that James canâ€™t quite interpret.

â€œReg?â€ he asks cautiously.

But Regulus doesnâ€™t respond, at least not right away, his body rigid at Jamesâ€™s side. Eventually he manages to force his expression into something vaguely blank, which James knows is a bad sign.

â€œSirius knows about us,â€ he repeats robotically. â€œDoes he know because you told him?â€ there is something brittle about his voice.

James wants to say no, that he would never betray Regulusâ€™s trust like that, but heâ€™s not about to throw Remus under the bus.

â€œYou were missing,â€ is what he says instead. Which Regulus seems to take as an admission of guilt.

â€œFuck James,â€ he hisses, before he grips his knees, head dropping down between them. â€œFuck. Fuck. Fuck.â€

â€œHey, itâ€™s okay,â€ James says, even though he has absolutely no idea if thatâ€™s true.

â€œI canâ€™t deal with this right now, I donâ€™t evenâ€”Fuckâ€”I canâ€™t.â€

â€œRegâ€”â€œ

â€œHeâ€™ll never forgive me for this,â€ and then he laughs, head still between his knees, breaths coming in and out in wheezing gasps. â€œNo, thatâ€™s stupid. He was never going to forgive me anyway. But now heâ€™ll hate me. Properly hate meâ€”â€œ

â€œRegulus,â€ James says again, trying and failing to stop his spiralling.

â€œI donâ€™t want to fight with him. I donâ€™t want to hurt him. Iâ€™m so tired of hurting people.â€

Who have you hurt? â€œWhat if he never speaks to you again?â€ Regulus sounds out of breath. â€œYouâ€™ll resent me. Youâ€™ll hate me tooâ€”â€œ

â€œThis isnâ€™t your fault Reg, I knew what the consequences were,â€ though he canâ€™t help the panic that rises up in him at the thought of Sirius cutting him out of his life. â€œI wonâ€™t hate you.â€

â€œYou will. You fucking will,â€ another choked laugh bubbles out of him. â€œBut I guess that doesnâ€™t matter either,â€ heâ€™s talking to himself, James realizes. â€œI already made sure you would.â€

James feels those words like theyâ€™re hands twisting his gut. â€œRegulus,â€ he says more sternly, squeezing his neck again, not tight enough to hurt, just enough to anchor him, to keep him grounded in his body instead of his unraveling nightmares. â€œBreathe. Now. Breathe with me. In and out.â€

â€œIâ€”â€œ

â€œNo, no more talking. Just breathe, okay? Open your mouth and inhale.â€

After a few seconds James hears the sound of breath being slowly taken in.

â€œGood, thatâ€™s good. Again, do it with me.â€ And so they breathe together. In, two, three, out, two, three. In, two, three, out two three. Again. And again. And again. â€œYou need to trust me.â€

â€œThen what is?â€

Reg doesnâ€™t speak, and after several minutes James gives up waiting, letting out a heavy sigh. â€œReg,â€ he says softly, â€œkeeping things from me? Things you think I canâ€™t handle? Thatâ€™s not trust.â€

Regulus presses back against him. â€œI donâ€™t want you to know everything I know,â€ he says quietly. â€œI donâ€™t even want to know everything I know. Some things you canâ€™t take back. James squeezes his eyes shut and resists the urge to break something. To tear the world apart for everything itâ€™s done to Reg. â€œIâ€™m so sorry,â€ he finally manages.

â€œNo donâ€™tâ€”I donâ€™t deserve it.â€

â€œReg,â€ his voice aches but Regulus quickly pulls back, sitting up and rubbing his face.

â€œWe should go,â€ his voice has turned cold. A defence mechanism. â€œItâ€™s too early to be disappearing and Iâ€™ve already missed enough lessons as it is.â€ He gets to his feet without looking at James.

James wants to tell him to stop. That they can stay here all day. All week. Forever. Tucked away in their little corner of the universe where James can keep him safe. But he knows a brush off when he sees one. Knows what Regulus looks like when heâ€™s locked himself away. The boy in front of him doesnâ€™t want to be coddled or comforted or touched. â€œOkay,â€ he says eventually, getting awkwardly to his feet as Regulus goes about righting his robes, returning his appearance to its normal immaculately quaffed state. Youâ€™d never guess heâ€™d been vomiting his fear up only a few minutes ago.

â€œIâ€™ll deal with Sirius okay?â€ James says, earning him a tight nod.

â€œIf you think you can.â€ His tone is dismissive but James knows that Regulus is terrified of what his brother will do next.

â€œMary saidâ€”Mary Macdonaldâ€”-she said something to me, over break.â€

â€œErâ€”yeah. I was justâ€”just wondering,â€ thereâ€™s no good way to ask this but James struggles to find one anyway. â€œWhat happened,â€ he lands on eventually, â€œthe night she was attacked?â€

â€œDo I?â€

It hits James square in the chest. The feeling of wrongness. For one blissful second he doesnâ€™t understand itâ€”doesnâ€™t understand why his skin suddenly feels like crawling off his bones as he stares into Regulusâ€™s empty eyes. But then he realizes;

Regulus is lying.

Heâ€™s lying to me.

Which meansâ€”

â€œIs that all?â€ Regulus asks, breaking into Jamesâ€™s thoughts. â€œIâ€™d rather not get detention on my first day back.â€

Regulus nods, opening the door and pausing halfway through. When he looks back for the second time thereâ€™s something a little more human in his stare. More like the boy whoâ€™d just been sitting with James on the floor.

â€œTonight?â€ is all Regulus asks.

â€œFuck,â€ he presses the heels of his hands into his eyes. â€œOh fuck Reg. What did you do?â€

PART II REGULUS

Heâ€™s barely in class for thirty minutes when a silvery translucent phoenix flies through the doors and up to Professor Flitwickâ€™s desk. Regulus grits his teeth and looks back down at his parchment. Itâ€™s probably nothing. Heâ€™s sure Dumbledore sends messages to his teachers all the time. Granted, heâ€™s never seen it happen before but that doesnâ€™t meanâ€”

â€œMr. Black?â€

Every muscles in his body tenses as he looks up to find Professor Flitwickâ€™s eyes on him.

â€œProfessor Dumbledore would like to see you. He said to bring your books. You wonâ€™t be back before the end of class.â€

Fuck.

Regulus nods at Flitwick before he starts inelegantly shoving his books back into his bag. He knows that itâ€™s the least of his problems right now, but he really wishes that Dumbledore could have waited until lunch or something. He hates that heâ€™s already missed the first few weeks of the winter term. Heâ€™s behind. And Regulus is never behind. He likes school, heâ€™s not embarrassed about that, even if Evan mocks him mercilessly for it. Heâ€™s good at school, and, not to be too much of a Ravenclaw, but he really misses learning things.

â€œShit Reg,â€ Evan whispers beside him. â€œYouâ€™ve only been here a few hours, what the fuck did you do to get summoned to the Headmasterâ€™s office?â€

Regulus only shakes his head as he slides his bag over his shoulder. â€œNo idea,â€ he mutters. â€œSee you at lunch?â€

â€œYeah, yeah, of course. Hey, tell Dumbledore to eat a dick for me will you?â€ he shoots Regulus a grin that actually manages to calm his nerves a little bit.

â€œYouâ€™re a moron Evan,â€ he says fondly, heading out of the class and into the largely deserted corridor.

Regulus assumes the password to Dumbledoreâ€™s office is the same as it was before Christmas and heâ€™s proven right when the ugly stone gargoyle guarding it shifts to reveal the stairs. With every step he takes he can feel his pulse speeding up, his palms and underarms growing sweaty. Itâ€™s stupid, to be afraid of this after having just spent two weeks in Azkaban, but at least there heâ€™d known what to expect. Well, sort of. Here though? Here he doesnâ€™t know what Dumbledore is capable of. What he can do to Regulus. He just knows that Dumbledoreâ€™s the only one whose power is equal to Voldemortâ€™sâ€”magically and politically. And he also knows that Dumbledore doesnâ€™t like him.

â€œCome in,â€ the Headmastersâ€™s voice calls out after Regulus knocks tentatively on the large doors at the top of the stairs.

The cluttered nature of Dumbledoreâ€™s office automatically puts Regulus on edge every time he steps into it. Not only because he likes things ordered, but because it makes it difficult to get his bearings. He doesnâ€™t know if there is another door, he thinks there must be, connecting to the Headmastersâ€™s private rooms, but he canâ€™t see it. Doesnâ€™t know if itâ€™s the only one or if there are more. Heâ€™s not even certain that theyâ€™re alone. Someone could easily be hiding amongst the trinkets and oddities that Dumbledore has piled around himself like heâ€™s a dragon collecting treasure.

â€œSit,â€ the old man says, gesturing to the single chair in front of him, he smiles at Regulus but the expression doesnâ€™t reach his eyes. In Regulusâ€™s experience it never does. Dumbledore is already sitting behind his desk, half-moon spectacles at the tip of his nose, hands laced in front of him.

Regulus does not relax when he sits down, back straight, barely touching the wood. â€œYou wanted to see me?â€ he asks, when Dumbledore allows the silence to drag on.

Dumbledore tilts his head forward, still smiling. â€œI did.â€ Another painful silence stretches between them and it takes every ounce of self control Regulus has not to fidget, not to let his gaze drop.

Regulus isnâ€™t at his best. Thatâ€™s the truth. Two weeks in Azkaban, a week at Grimmauld before that, his nerves are too close to the skin. His body and mind and heart too sensitive. He was barely able to keep it together with James this morning. Well, if you consider vomiting keeping it together. He hopes none of that shows on his face but he has a sneaking suspicion that Dumbledore already knows. That thatâ€™s why he wanted to speak with him so soon.

â€œYou took an extended vacation Iâ€™m told,â€ Dumbledore says, and Regulus nearly sighs with the relief of having the silence broken.

â€œFamily emergency,â€ he says calmly.

Dumbledore arches his brow. â€œOh?â€

â€œYup.â€

Dumbledore tilts his head to the side, assessing Regulus. â€œYour teachers tell me youâ€™re quite bright,â€ he says, the sudden shift in the conversation startling Regulus.

â€œErâ€”do they?â€ he hates the uncertainty that heâ€™s allowed to slip into his voice.

â€œThey do. And Iâ€™ve been struggling to understand why someone so intelligent would willingly waste his talents on the bigoted crusades of a mad man.â€

Regulus blinks, opening and closing his mouth, not sure how to respond. No one ever speaks to him about thisâ€”about Voldemortâ€”so bluntly and Regulus isnâ€™t sure what he should deny and what he should own up to. Is he meant to feign ignorance in this situation? Does Dumbledore actually know anything or is he just making guesses?

â€œIâ€™m sorry Professor,â€ Regulus says when he finally manages to find his voice again. â€œBut Iâ€™m not quite sure what you mean?â€

â€œAh, of course, Iâ€™m sorry, Iâ€™ve been told I can be rather obtuse sometimes,â€ he laughs, the noise causing the hair to stand up on the back of Regulusâ€™s neck. â€œLet me be more clear.â€

He slides something across his desk and it takes Regulus a minute to focus on it, to cut through the buzzing anxiety fogging up his brain and properly read the words in front of him. Itâ€™s todayâ€™s edition of the Daily Profit, he realizes. The front page of the Daily Prophet to be precise. When he finally reads the headline he feels his whole body recoil before he can get control of himself. He tries to clamp down on the fear that swells inside him, that he knows is playing across his face right now, but he doesnâ€™t quite manage it.

â€œPrisoner Murdered in His Cell,â€ Dumbledore reads the headline out loud. â€œMinistry in Uproar.â€

All Regulus can do is stare back at him with wide eyes. Dumbledore apparently takes that as permission to continue.

â€œJonathan Van Wheeler was murdered late last night in his cell in Azkaban. The twenty-two year old was being held on suspicions of Death Eater activity. Aurors refuse to comment on whether or not his death confirms or refutes his connection to the terrorist group.â€

A little bit of doubt, Regulus thinks numbly. Itâ€™s what Voldemort had wanted and itâ€™s exactly what he got.

And oh.

Â 

He doesnâ€™t know where heâ€™s going. Itâ€™s not quite lunch yet but he canâ€™t stomach the thought of walking back into class. He canâ€™t stomach the idea of being anywhere if heâ€™s honest. PART III JAMES

â€œOkay then.â€

â€œOkay.â€

Â

â€œHe already take off back to the shack?â€

â€œYouâ€™re my hero.â€

â€œJames?â€ Mary asks, looking up at him when he stops in front of her.

Hey! Hi! Hello!

I feel like this is a lot of picking up where we left off before Christmas, so hopefully it wasn't too dry. Also surprise I'm making y'all wait for that Sirius James altercation that is 100% coming.

Thanks for all the comments and kudos, love hearing your theories about what's going to happen (though it's very hard for me not to just jump in and be like "I know" "I have the answers")

Hope you're all having a great day/night/morning!

Chapter 37

Chapter Summary

Tale as old as time (surprise, this fic is now a musical)

Chapter Notes

tw: death / murder (not graphically described, happens off screen, no main characters)

tw: discussions of rape / sexual assault

tw: like the briefest possible mention of Christianity

(I think that's it but if I'm forgetting anything let me know - this goes for always, if there is something you think should be tw that I miss pls let me know!)

See the end of the chapter for more notes

HOGWARTS YEAR 1013

PART I: SALAZAR

There is a room in the castle that reveals itself only when it is needed most. It cannot be seen on any map or located by any spell. Once inside its occupants are kept safe, the room cares for them, providing them with everything they requireâ€”to be comfortable, to be satisfied, to be happy. The idea had been Salazarâ€™s, the others indulging him. Indulging his paranoia. Having a safe place to hide is very important to Salazar. It is, in fact, the reason that he is alive.

When he was six his mother woke him once in the middle of the night. There had been lots of yelling and people running about. Their whole family lived in one small cottage in the countryside. His brothers and cousins and uncles all worked the fields, while the women washed and sowed and cooked. The house was bursting with people and laughter and life. Salazar loved it. Loved all of them. But that night the shouting had not been drunken or joyous. It had been fearful.

â€œCome my darling, my sweet thing, come, come,â€ his mother had cooed as she carried him out of the house and across the back lawn towards the small shed they used to store tools and dry meat. She had shoved around crates and other debris before laying a blanket on the ground in the corner and gesturing for him to lie down. Salazar had been too tired to ask questions.

â€œSleep now darling,â€ sheâ€™d kissed the top of his head. â€œEverything will be alright. But you must stay here, yes? No moving, no making any noise at all, not until I come get you okay? Sal?â€

â€œMâ€™kay momma,â€ heâ€™d slurred, already half asleep.

â€œGood boy.â€

He was vaguely aware of her moving things back to their places in front of him. Hiding him from view.

That was the last time he saw his mother.

The last time he saw any of his family.

The Muggle town a dayâ€™s ride away had heard rumours about them. About what they were. As good Christians they could not allow such an abomination to continue. A family of witches and warlocks. Of devil worshippers.

Salazar would never know what happened exactly. Why his family hadnâ€™t used magic against them. Or if they had, why it had failed. Heâ€™d been asleep in the shed. And when he awoke his family was dead, their home smouldering in the sunrise. The flames not quite burnt out.

Having somewhere to hide is import to Salazar.

It is especially important in a place that is made for children. Hogwarts is aliveâ€”not just a building, but a living being that thinks and feels and acts. It is the protector of every child within its walls. A surrogate mother. Who will keep her children safe when the monsters come looking for them in the middle of the night. That is why he added the room to the schoolâ€™s plans, why he figured out the complicated Spell work required to make it possible. He spent months on it, so that it would be there incase of an emergency. When the students would need their mother most.

And yet, the first time the room was summoned, it was not by a frightened student in need of shelter. It was by two men, standing in a shadowy hallway, voices low and desperate, hands more so. It had given them a place to hide. To be together. To be safeâ€”not from monsters necessarily, but from everyone else. Everyone who would never understand.

This is not the need Salazar had anticipated when he built the room. Not a need that had even occurred to him. And yet for years now, he had found himself here, standing in this room, created just for the two of them. He had stopped seeing this as a space of desperation, of last resort, and started thinking of it as home. A word he had not used since he was six years old.

Â 

Heâ€™s looking at a painting of the night sky when he hears the door open behind him. Salazar has always loved the night. The stars. They hold the future in their orbits and Salazar is jealous. He wants nothing more than to reach out and steal their secrets.

The man who enters the room doesnâ€™t speak, his steps faltering only for a moment before he strides forward, the sound of his scabbard clanking against his hip. Without hesitation, or waiting for permissionâ€”heâ€™s never been very good at waiting for anythingâ€”he slips one arm around Salazarâ€™s waist and the other across his chest, pulling them together until there exists no space between them, until his warmth bleeds through their clothes and starts to make Salazar flush.

â€œGodric,â€ he says softly, as the other man starts to nuzzle at his neck, placing gentle kisses along his jaw. â€œGodric,â€ he says again, trying and failing to sound more authoritative. â€œWe need to talk.â€

â€œNot yet,â€ Godric says into his skin, causing tremors to shoot through him. â€œIâ€™ve done nothing but yell at you across a table all day. I just want this for a moment longer. I just want to have you. Remember what itâ€™s like when youâ€™re mine.â€

Salazar tilts his head back, resting it on Godricâ€™s shoulder and giving the other man more access. â€œIâ€™m always yours.â€ Which is embarrassingly and pathetically true.

Eventually Salazar turns around, because he has to, because he canâ€™t take it anymore, and then theyâ€™re kissing properly. They love and fight and kiss all the same way. Godric pushes him back against the wall, Salazar runs a hand through his hair and pulls viciously. The fear and anger and betrayal they both feel sits just below the surface. Fighting with the rest of them. Itâ€™s never been this bad before. This painful.

They break apart, foreheads pressed together, Godricâ€™s handsâ€”big and rough as they areâ€”hold Salazarâ€™s face like itâ€™s something precious. Salazarâ€™s fingers knotted in the back of his shirt. For a long time neither of them speak, frozen like that, heavy breathing.

Here,

Salazar thinks.

I want to always be here.

â€œSal,â€ Godricâ€™s voice is gruff, his thumbs brushing his cheeks, â€œyou have to let it go.â€

Salazar blinks, trying to come back to himself, to clear his head of lips and tongues and gentle hands. He feels his body go rigid.

â€œJust so weâ€™re clear,â€ he says coldly, â€œby â€œitâ€ youâ€™re referring to the murder of my entire family?â€

Godric sighs, like heâ€™s the one being attacked.

â€œGood,â€ Salazar clumsily pulls away, walking to the fireplace and grabbing hold of the mantle for support, he needs to have something in his hands or thereâ€™s a good chance heâ€™ll punch Godric. â€œJust checking.â€

â€œThese children are not responsible for what has happened to you.â€

â€œNo, theyâ€™ll just be responsible for it happening to someone else.â€

Thereâ€™s the sound of aborted steps, as though Godric was going to come to him and then thought better of it. Smart man.

â€œThey have every right to be here,â€ Godric says eventually.

â€œThey outnumber us,â€ Salazar hisses, hands gripping the mantle so tightly his knuckles threaten to split through his skin. â€œThey outnumber us everywhere and now you want to let them in here too? â€œSal,â€ he sounds sad more than anything else. â€œEveryone is not like thatâ€”you cannot go through life thinking all people are cruel.â€

â€œAll people ARE cruel,â€ except you, he doesnâ€™t say. Because he still has some self-respect.

Godric makes a frustrated noise before he finally moves all the way across the room. He wraps Salazar in his arms again, burying his face in his neck. Sal wants to resist, wants to push back, but heâ€™s always been weak where Godric is concerned. Weak and hungry.

â€œYou arenâ€™t cruel,â€ Godric says eventually.

Salazar lets out a dry laugh to cover up the way those words touch some softer part of him. The part that desperately wishes to be the hero of the story. â€œRowena would disagree with you.â€ The riff between them is recent and it hurts, though Sal would never admit that to anyone.

â€œRowena doesnâ€™t know what sheâ€™s talking about. Besides, Helga likes you.â€

â€œHelga likes everyone.â€

He can feel Godric smiling against the skin of his throat. â€œTrue.â€

After a moment Salazar sighs, melting further into Godricâ€™s warmth. â€œWeâ€™re supposed to be safe here,â€ he says quietly.

â€œWe are.â€

â€œWe cannot trust them.â€

â€œYou have to stop thinking of this as â€œusâ€ and â€œthemâ€, we are one. They have magic just like you and I. Muggle-Born or not, they are Wizards and Witches and they must be trained.â€

â€œAfter everything the Muggles have done to us, to our peopleâ€”pushing us to the fringes of society, forcing us into hidingâ€”they do not deserve magic. They do not deserve access to our world.â€

Thereâ€™s a pause thatâ€™s longer than it should be before Godric tightens his arms around him. â€œMe, Helga and Rowena are all agreed.â€

And doesnâ€™t that feel like a blade in the back. For the second time that night Salazar pulls away, Godric reluctant to let him go. This time though, this time Salazar doesnâ€™t flee to the other side of the room, doesnâ€™t turn his back, but faces his lover head on.

â€œYouâ€™ve decided,â€ he repeats, hands in shaking fists at his sides. â€œAnd my word means nothing?â€

â€œOf course not,â€ Godric says wearily. â€œBut youâ€™ve been overruled.â€

He wants to laugh.

He wants to cry.

He wonâ€™t, he never does, his father taught him better.

â€œHave the three of you been speaking without me?â€ he asks. Godric has never been much skilled at hiding his emotions, and the guilt is now plain across his face. â€œI see,â€ Salazar does not wait for a response. â€œYou know, I did not expect loyalty from Rowena or Helga but you? â€œI do understand. I do,â€ Godric stretches out his arms but makes no move to close the gap between them. â€œBut just because I understand your feelings does not mean I think they are right. Sal, please, Iâ€™m begging you to see reason here. These are children.â€

â€œI know what they are,â€ Salazar snaps.

â€œDo you?â€ and when a dangerous silence follows those words Godric decides to push forward, because he can never see the line. Never knows when to stop. â€œYou are punishing them for your familyâ€™s death.â€

â€œI am keeping our community safe!â€

â€œYou are being vindictive and short sighted,â€ and now heâ€™s getting angry. â€œYouâ€™re smarter than this.â€

â€œOh fuck you.â€

â€œLoveâ€”â€œ

â€œNO, stop, stop,â€ he jabs an accusatory finger in Godricâ€™s direction. â€œYou do not get to speak to me like thatâ€”to address me in such a way when you are in the middle of betraying everything that we areâ€”everything that we have ever been to one another.â€

Most people see Godric as a frightening figure, he is tall and broad and bearded, always walking around with a broadsword strapped to his back and several smaller blades hanging from the belt at his hip. But to Salazar he will always be delicate. And right now he takes satisfaction in watching him crack.

â€œThatâ€™s not true, you know thatâ€™s not true,â€ he takes a step forward and Salazar instantly pulls out his wand, hands shaking. â€œSalâ€¦â€

â€œI will leave the school if you allow this to happen. I cannot, in good conscience, stand by and watch the three of you put in jeopardy everything I hold dear. I will not stay here, do you understand?â€

And Godric looks so unbearably sad that he very nearly takes it back. â€œI understand.â€ Salazarâ€™s chest is rising and falling in violent heaves, everything in him wrung tight. â€œBut,â€ Godric finally goes on. â€œI cannot, in good conscience, discriminate based on blood. Itâ€™s not who I am. Not the world I wish to live in.â€

Now it is Salazar who is cracking.

â€œYou would choose them over me?â€ he finally asks, voice tight as he stares at the person he has trusted more than anyone else in his life. â€œYou would choose the Muggles over me?â€

Godricâ€™s eyes are so sad.

Salazar wants to gouge them out.

â€œI love you,â€ Godric says desperately. And Salazar nearly kills him. â€œYou knowâ€”â€œ

â€œGet out,â€ he growls, voice low and dangerous.

Godric looks at him beseechingly. â€œSalâ€”â€œ

â€œGET OUT!â€ he shifts his wand ever so slightly, sending a curse just over Godricâ€™s shoulder, shattering the mirror behind him. Shock and anger flicker across Godricâ€™s face. â€œGet out before I take you apart.â€

He sees Godricâ€™s hand twitch, knows that he desperately wants to reach for his own wand. Fine. Let him. Godric may have brawn on his side but his spell work has always been sloppy compared to Salazarâ€™s. There is no way he could beat him in a duel.

But it doesnâ€™t come to that. Instead, after a few seconds of deliberation, Godricâ€™s arm drops lifelessly back to his side.

â€œOkay,â€ he says, still with Salazarâ€™s wand pointed at himâ€”right at the centre of his chest. â€œIâ€™ll go. If thatâ€™s what you want.â€

No.

Never.

Please.

â€œYes,â€ he hisses, half-sure the word comes out in Parseltongue

Godric just nods, tension clear in his body as he walks past Salazar, giving him a wide berth as he heads swiftly for the door, cloak sweeping behind him.

Salazar finally lowers his wand but doesnâ€™t allow himself to turn around and watch Godric leave. Is almost certain it would break him.

â€œThis isnâ€™t what I wanted,â€ he hears behind him. Salazar squeezes his eyes shut. â€œIn fact, all Iâ€™ve ever really wanted is you. And with that the door closes.

HOGWARTS 1977

PART II REGULUS

Regulus stands in the Come and Go Room, staring at a painting of the night sky. Heâ€™s never really paid much attention to it before, but up close he can appreciate the beauty of it. The velvety texture of the sky, the subtle movement of the clouds and blinking of the stars. It wouldnâ€™t be hard to forget that you were looking at paint and canvas and not out a window. Admiring it, picking apart the artistry, is helpful, because James is lateâ€”at least latter than usualâ€”and the beautiful painting is helping to keep Regulusâ€™s thoughts occupied.

Wellâ€¦sort of.

When his thoughts do drift he tries to focus on the good parts of this morning. On Jamesâ€™s arms around him, his soft kisses across his face, in his hair, him whispering that Regulus was safe. That he was okay. He focuses on the smaller detailsâ€”the specific feel of his hands, the warmth, the slight pressure, the tickle of his thumb brushing Regulusâ€™s cheek.

He tries not to think about the fact that Sirius knows about them.

Or about what Mary may or may not have told James.

Regulus shakes his head, trying to clear his thoughts.

Just think about his hands.

Just think about the night sky.

The door opens behind him but Regulus doesnâ€™t turn around, he just closes his eyes and exhales. James came. He came. He came. Thereâ€™s a moment of hesitation, James quiet, which is unusual for him, but eventually Regulus can hear his footsteps approaching, stopping just behind him.

â€œYou can touch me.â€

â€œRegulus.â€

And he knows just from the sound his voice that something is wrong.

â€œPlease,â€ Reg says. â€œI just need a minute before weâ€”please can you just touch me?â€ Itâ€™s pathetic. He knows it is. And unfair. But he asks for it anyway. And of course, James gives. His arms strong and warm as they wrap around Regulus, pulling him back into his chest.

â€œIâ€™ve never noticed this one before,â€ he gestures to the painting in front of them.

â€œNo,â€ Reg says slowly, eyes running it over one more time. â€œMe neither. And then todayâ€”it was the first thing my eyes went to when I came in.â€

James hums, the vibrations shooting through Regulus.

â€œItâ€™s beautiful.â€

You're beautiful, Regulus doesnâ€™t say. Heâ€™s not sure why exactly. Except maybe that he has a feeling that today James might not say it back.

Regulus takes advantage of the new silence between them. Cataloging, in the greatest detail, everything about this momentâ€”this feelingâ€”because he doesnâ€™t know whatâ€™s coming but he knows it isnâ€™t good, knows his days of this are dwindling and he wants to remember everything about it.

â€œI can see you,â€ James says suddenly.

Regulus blinks, tilting his head to look up. â€œSee me?â€

James gestures to the painting with his chin. â€œThe stars. I can see youâ€”in the sky.â€

â€œOh,â€ it comes out more like a breath than a word and Regulus doesnâ€™t know why it aches. Maybe because this is where they started. Looking at stars in the sky. Eventually James sighs, breath tickling Regulusâ€™s ear.

â€œReg.â€

â€œI know.â€

â€œOkay.â€

He breathes in, bringing his arms up to pull James more tightly around him. He gives himself five more seconds.

One.

James is wearing a crimson jumper. Not his Gryffindor one but close enough. He almost always dresses in house colours. Regulus doesnâ€™t know if itâ€™s on purpose but he suspects it isnâ€™t.

Two.

He smells clean. He must have showered since this morning. He uses generic soap and some sort of pine-y aftershave.

Three.

James is bigger than Regulus, so when they stand like this itâ€™s like he blocks out the whole world. All there is is James.

Four.

Sometimes his glasses hurt Regulusâ€™s nose when they kiss. But for some reason he likes it. It reminds him that heâ€™s kissing James Potter every time they press into his skin.

Five.

He never knew the difference between a house and a home before this.

â€œPlease stop saying my name like that,â€ like it causes you pain.

â€œâ€˜You of all peopleâ€™ as though me and Mary Macdonald have anything in common.â€

â€œClearly something happened. And more would have if you hadnâ€™t stepped in. How can you just get over that? How can you protect them after that? Surely you can sympathize with her?â€

â€œWhy?â€ Regulus asks coldly. â€œI donâ€™t know if youâ€™ve noticed, but I donâ€™t sympathize with most people.â€

â€œI promise you it is.â€

â€œEvan, Barty, theyâ€™re my only allies. If I lose them I will have no one to watch my back. I donâ€™t agree with everything they do and God knows they can be fucking morons sometimes but Iâ€”I will not survive without them on my side. Do you understand?â€

â€œI told them they were idiots.â€

â€œWe go to bed and we sleep and we wake up and we move on because itâ€™s done and over and we canâ€™t change it.â€

You can.

â€œI know,â€ Regulus sighs, shoulders sagging as he turns away from James, unable to stand looking at him anymore. He grips the mantle of the fireplace, trying to give himself a moment to think.

â€œWhatâ€”â€œ he starts and then stops, working to get his voice back under control. â€œWhat do you need me to do James?â€ he asks finally, speaking to the wall. â€œTell me and Iâ€™ll do it.â€

G & S

The letters tangle around one another, inseparable. Regulus finds himself reaching out, fingers tracing the pathways through the stone. G & S

â€œDid you come here too?â€ he asks stupidly. â€œDid it keep you safe?â€

Thereâ€™s no answer, of course. No one around to hear. Eventually Regulus lets his hand drop back down to his side. He hopes theyâ€™re okay, whoever they areâ€”wereâ€”hopes theyâ€™re still together like this, wrapped around one another. It makes him feel better to think that.

â€œSorry I broke your mirror,â€ he says eventually, stepping back from the wall. â€œI promise Iâ€™ll fix it.â€

He slides his wand out of his sleeve and after a few attempts at various domestic spells he finally finds one that works, all the pieces of the mirror flying back together, the cracks between them disappearing completely.

â€œThere,â€ he says softly, satisfied that he was able to fix something for once, the initials covered. â€œSafe again.â€

Chapter End Notes

AHH

Okay

Okay

Idk, maybe the beginning doesn't work? I've honestly gone back and forth on it so much but I like it, so I've just decided it works.

I've always thought the founders were cool and I just couldn't resist playing with the tension always specifically mentioned between Godric and Salazar so hopefully you guys also found those parallels between Godric and Salazar and James and Regulus interesting but if not I'm sorry.

ALSO Sirius is coming back, I promise, it was supposed to be this chapter but it just didn't feel right, so sorry for being a tease.

OKAY thank you, I am gonna go quietly stress about this chapter now :) :)

PART I JAMES

The next few days are lonely.

In fact, James is fairly certain itâ€™s the most lonely heâ€™s ever felt in his entire life.

Sirius and Remus donâ€™t come back to the dorm but they do start coming to classes again. Sitting alone, away from James and Peter. Remus shoots James apologetic glances whenever they take the desks on the other side of the room. Sirius doesnâ€™t look at him at all. Doesnâ€™t come to the Great Hall or speak to anyone but Remus, at least not as far as James can tell.

Itâ€™s all far too reminiscent of last year. The four of them broken up, not speaking, not even looking at one another. James hates it. He thinks about just going down to the shack and forcing Sirius to talk to him. Thinks about it a lot actually. About what he would say, and how they would yell and scream but by the end everything would be okay. He never actually goes of course. Remus asked him to give Sirius time so he does. He just wishes Sirius didnâ€™t need so much of it.

James floats between Quidditch practice and class. He talks to Peterâ€”talks to Remus when heâ€™s aloneâ€”but other than that he mostly keeps his head down. Every night he lies awake in bed and feels the pull to go to Regulus. A few timesâ€”pathetic timesâ€”he pulls out the map to see if Regulus is there, in their room. James doesnâ€™t know how to fix things. Not with Regulus, not with Sirius. And so the floating continues. James canâ€™t help but feel like heâ€™s fading a little bit. An empty version of himself, just going through the motions.

â€œIâ€™m thinking about starting a chess club.â€

James refrains from explaining all the ways in which a chess team and a Quidditch team are radically different things.

Peter shrugs. â€œWell, Iâ€™m not exactly. But I feel like I could be yâ€™know? Like Iâ€™m never going to be a Quidditch star no matter how hard I tryâ€”â€œ

â€œYou donâ€™t know that,â€ James says automatically, earning him a skeptical look from Peter.

â€œUh, yeah, I think I do. BUT,â€ he says before James can interrupt again. â€œI could be a chess star if I just put a little more effort into it. It might not be Quidditch but,â€ another shrug. â€œA trophy is a trophy right?â€

He looks at James hopefully and James canâ€™t bring himself to say anything even remotely negative. â€œSure, definitely. I thinks thatâ€™sâ€”erâ€”a great idea.â€

â€œReally?â€ Peter asks, looking far too happy about this.

â€œErâ€”â€˜course.â€

â€œMaybe Iâ€™ll put up posters yeah? See whoâ€™s interested. Hold try-outs.â€

â€œHey, would you help?â€ Pater asks, eyes all big and hopeful. Fucking damnit Peter. â€œSince youâ€™ve done it so many times beforeâ€”tryouts I meanâ€”you could give me some pointers?â€

â€œErâ€”â€œ

Luckily, James is saved from having to continue this conversation by the arrival of the post. Hoot choosing that moment to land gracefully on the table beside him, only narrowly avoiding stepping in a bowl of porridge. He very insistently starts nudging at Jamesâ€™s shoulder with his beak.

â€œHey buddy,â€ James gives his dignified head a little pat before untying the letter around his leg. Hoot shuffles forward staring very pointedly at the plate of cold cuts in the middle of the table. James laughs.

â€œNot exactly subtle are you?â€ he swears Hoot glares at him. â€œAlright, alright, no jokes before treats. Got it.â€ James tosses him a piece of ham and with the contented flutter of his wings Hoot catches it and flies off.

â€œWhoâ€™s the letter from?â€ Peter asks, as James slides his hand under the wax seal.

â€œMum,â€ he says without looking up. He wrote to her the morning after he talked to Lily in the courtyard. Itâ€™s about the only useful thing heâ€™s managed to do recently.

Â 

Dear chicken,

His mother writes.

Glad to hear youâ€™re doing well and that Quidditch is back on track - I promise me and your father will make it up for your final match (which, if Iâ€™m not mistaken, is shaping up to be against Slytherin again is it not?) weâ€™ve both just been a bit slammed with work recently.

Anyway - Lily Evans, huh? Goodness, thatâ€™s a name I havenâ€™t heard in a while. I must tell you, Jamie darling, I am rather thrilled to learn that the two of you have become friends. You were always so obsessed with the girl, it seemed a shame you two could never get along.

About your request - of course it is absolutely ridiculous that Muggle-born families donâ€™t have access to the Floo. Iâ€™ve talked to some of our friends at the Ministry and Dumbledore as well, I expect sheâ€™ll hear from him before the week is out. If not, let me know and Iâ€™ll march up to the school and sort it myself.

I love you very, very much.

Sincerely, her majesty,

Your mum.

Â 

James smiles down at the letter, â€œBrilliant,â€ he murmurs, before folding it up and sliding it into his pocket. He really does love his mum.

He shoves a piece of toast in his mouth before throwing his bag over his shoulder and getting to his feet. â€œIâ€™ll see you in class alright Pete? I gotta go talk to Evans.â€

Peter looks vaguely surprised but doesnâ€™t question him. â€œYeah alright. See yâ€™ah.â€

Itâ€™s only the two of them at breakfast today, Remus having already come and gone, bringing Sirius his food. â€œHey guys,â€ James joins the sixth year girls a little ways down the table from where him and Pete had been sitting. They all look up briefly, Mary giving him a vague nod and Marlene a wave before they go back to whatever it is they were talking about.

â€œAre you abandoning Peter then?â€ Lily asks, looking slightly amused as she scoots over to make room for him.

He smiles, shaking his head. â€œNah, never. Just wondered if maybe I could talk to you before class?â€ he nods in the direction of the doors, not missing the significant looks that Marlene and Mary send him across the table.

Lily looks surprised for about a minute before she recovers. â€œUhâ€”yeah, yeah sure. Of course.â€ She grabs her stuff and slides out from under the table. â€œSee you lot later yeah?â€ she tosses over her shoulder.

â€œYou two have fun,â€ Mary says in a sing-song voice. â€œDonâ€™t do anything I wouldnâ€™t do!â€

Lily gives her a flat look at the same time that Marlene shakes her head, hissing under her breath; â€œMerlin Mary, really?â€

â€œWhat?â€ Mary says innocently as they walk away.

Theyâ€™re quiet leaving the Great Hall, James shoving his hands awkwardly in his pockets, not quite sure what to say or how to start.

â€œHere,â€ once theyâ€™re in the corridor he quickly guides them into the nearest empty classroom, certain he doesnâ€™t want to do this in the foyer.

â€œIs it something serious?â€ Lily asks when he closes the door behind them. â€œIs it about the map?â€

James feels his chest tighten but quickly shakes it off. â€œNo, no, nothing like that. Eventually he sighs, pulling out his mumâ€™s letter and handing it to her.

â€œI wrote to my mum,â€ he says as he watches her unfold it.

She looks up at him briefly and then back down at the page, immediately letting out a bubble of laughter. â€œChicken?â€

James rolls his eyes. â€œYeah, yeah, yeah,â€ he says, though he can feel his cheeks heating up. â€œJust read the third paragraph.â€

She raises her brow, eyes skimming the letter. He sees the moment she understands. The moment the words sink it. â€œOh,â€ she says softly. â€œReally?â€

â€œI would never hurt you on purpose Sirius.â€

No!

PART III MARY

Â 

Mary sits in a window near the back of the school. There are no classrooms here, just storage cupboards and a few offices further down. She watches the corner up ahead, fiddling with the cigarette between her fingers. Its a loophole, being able to smoke at Hogwarts. Since Wizards donâ€™t have cigarettes there are no rules against them in the school. She should probably be more careful if she doesnâ€™t want that to change but then, she rather likes the idea of forcing the creation of a new school rule. Sheâ€™d wear it like a badge of honour. Make James and Sirius jealous.

She inhales deeply, letting the smoke sit in her lungs until it starts to sting and then tilting her head back and exhaling. Shockingly, Regulus Black has turned out to be a snake of his word. Giving her his friendsâ€™ schedules and alerting her whenever they leave the common room. As a result, sheâ€™s spent the past few days following them around, figuring out where they go and how they get there and who theyâ€™re with. All in all itâ€™s been a very educational, if not dull, few days.

For instance, sheâ€™s learned that on Wednesdays Barty Crouch Junior takes a detour on his way back from his last period class so he can hook up with Delany Whispersâ€”a fourth year Ravenclaw. Honestly, youâ€™d think a Ravenclaw would have more sense, but Mary supposes theyâ€™re not exactly a house known for their good taste.

She stubs out her cigarette when she hears footsteps approaching but otherwise stays where she is, wand sliding into her hand. Barty Crouch is a boy of average height and looks. A bit thin and peaky for Maryâ€™s taste but she supposes thatâ€™s to be expected after years of in-breading. He doesnâ€™t notice her when he rounds the corner or when he struts past her on his way to get his rocks off. Clearly someoneâ€™s feeling desperate.

â€œHey Crouch?â€

Hey Macdonald?

Barty freezes down the hall, turning to find her walking towards him. There is nothing hurried about Maryâ€™s steps. They echo confidently in the empty corridor. Crouch looking instantly suspicious.

â€œWhat the hell do you want?â€

Get lost creep.

â€œAw, come on, donâ€™t be like that,â€ she tilts her head to the side. A predator assessing her prey. â€œI came to apologize.â€

Aw, come on, donâ€™t be like that. Listen, I came to apologize.

Thereâ€™s a new tension to Bartyâ€™s stance as she stops in front of him, his eyes bouncing nervously around like heâ€™s afraid something is going to jump out at him. â€œWhat?â€ he demands harshly, screwing up his face. â€œWhat areâ€”what the fuck are you playing at?â€ he doesnâ€™t quite manage to keep the fear out of his voice.

She only smiles. Red lips pulling up to reveal two pearly-white rows of teeth. â€œCome on Barty, you remember donâ€™t you? It happened just like this,â€ she gestures at the space around them. â€œI was on my way back to my dorm and then there you were. Calling my name. Barty instantly takes a step back. â€œListen, I donâ€™t know what you thinkâ€”â€œ

But she isnâ€™t interested in his denial. Or his threats. Or disarming the wand he is pathetically attempting to pull from his bag.

â€œImperio.â€

Instantly his whole body relaxes, face going slack, eyes unfocused, Maryâ€™s mind suddenly controlling them both. â€œIâ€™m going to let you keep that memory,â€ she says, stepping nearer, eyes running over her hostage. â€œSo that when you wake up youâ€™ll know it was me who did this to you,â€ she drags the tip of her wand down the side of his face.

â€œAnd youâ€™ll know why.â€

Â 

PART IV BARTY

Â 

Itâ€™s. Fucking. Cold.

He groans, reaching for his blanket.

Cold. Andâ€¦prickly?

His hand is groping around for his comforter but something doesnâ€™t feel right. His bed isâ€¦off. Everything is off. And Christ why the fuck is it so cold? He forces his eyes open, blinking against the light, waiting for the room to come into focus.

Except there is no room.

Barty sits bolt upright, head swimming for a minute as he tries to wake himself up. Because clearly heâ€™s still asleep. Clearly this is a nightmare. And yet, regardless of how many times he pinches or slaps himself, nothing changes. He continues to be sitting in the dirt, dark trunks sprouting from the ground around him and stretching far over his head, cutting up the sunlight so that itâ€™s hard for him to tell what time of day it is.

Something in the distance howls.

â€œFuck, fuck, fuck,â€ Barty scrambles to his feet, scrapping his hand open on something sharp in the process. â€œFUCK,â€ he puts extra emphasis on that last one as he goes to wipe the blood off on his trousers.

Except he isnâ€™t wearing trousers.

Heâ€™s stood in the middle of, what he has to assume is the Forbiddenâ€”Goddamnâ€”Forest, in nothing but his pants.

His heart is starting to pound against his ribs and he begs himself to remember what the hell happened, hands searching fruitlessly for his wand even though he already knows he doesnâ€™t have it. A twig snaps behind him and he jumps, spinning around and stumbling backwards, nearly landing back on his ass in the dirt.

â€œMerlin,â€ he hisses, staring into the dark shadows between the trees. Thereâ€™s another noise, definitely footsteps. Something is coming.

â€œH-hello?â€

He wracks his brain for every â€˜Care for Magical Creaturesâ€™ class heâ€™s ever taken. What even lives in the Forbidden Forest? He makes another desperate search for his wand, but he doesnâ€™t see it on the ground and it sure as hell isnâ€™t in his boxers. A cold wind blows through the trees then, they rattle above him, his teeth starting to chatter.

He tries to orient himself, looking around, figuring out which way to go. But all he sees are trees. Trees and shadows and thousands of places for scary things to hide.

Thatâ€™s when hears something growl.

Barty doesnâ€™t bother trying to figure out what made the noise or how far away it is. He takes off sprinting in the opposite direction, praying to Merlin and Salazar and every other great Wizard he can think of that heâ€™s heading towards the school and not deeper into the forest.

Trees and shrubbery shred his skin as he blows threw them, heart beating faster than it ever has before. Something flutters its wing over his head. He thinks he feels something scaly brush against his leg.

â€œFuck,â€ he whimpers, trying to make himself go faster. â€œOh fuck, oh fuck, oh fuck.â€ He keeps waiting to wake up. This has to be a dream. It has to be. I mean, why the hell would he be in the Forbidden Forest half-naked, it doesnâ€™t make anyâ€”

Heâ€™s hit with the blurry images of a memory.

Of Mary Macdonald in a hallway.

Of her voice in his ear.

Iâ€™m going to let you keep that memory. So that when you wake up youâ€™ll know it was me who did this to you. And youâ€™ll know why.

He almost cries.

â€œOh fuck, oh fuck, oh fuck.â€

Â 


Eventually he realizes that nothing is actually chasing him so he lets himself slow down, wandering aimlessly until he finds a tree he can climb. From up above heâ€™s able to locate the castle a good forty minute walk to the west of him.

Fucking brilliant.

By the time he manages to get back to school heâ€™s cut up and freezing cold and covered in dirt. People stare as he walks through the front foyer in his goddamn boxers. He gets a few gasps, but most people laugh. The assholes. Heâ€™s going to skin all of them alive the minute he gets his bloody wand back.

Given how absolutely absurd his morning has been he shouldnâ€™t be surprised by the mess awaiting him in his dorm room and yetâ€¦

â€œHoly shit, I thought I looked bad,â€ Evan laughs when Barty walks in. â€œIâ€”youâ€”you were there too?â€ he asks numbly.

â€œIf by â€œthereâ€ you mean theâ€”fuck me Regâ€ Evan hisses as Regulus heals a particularly nasty cut on his ribs. Apparently whatever spell heâ€™s using stings.

â€œSorry,â€ Regulus mutters, though he doesnâ€™t sound remotely sorry.

â€œIf by â€œthereâ€ I mean what Evan?â€ Barty demands impatiently, Evan can never stay on topic, even in moments like this.

â€œThe fucking forest of terrors,â€ Evan grimaces as Regulus moves on to another cut. â€œYeah I was there. So were Snape, Mulciber, and Avery.â€

â€œWhat??â€

Regulus steps back, sliding his wand into the holster on his arm. â€œThere, that should be most of the bad stuff.â€

â€œWeâ€™re you all together?â€ Barty demands, ignoring Regulus.

â€œNah,â€ Evan groans as he reaches across his bed for his t-shirt, sliding it carefully over his freshly cleaned torso. â€œJust got back quicker than you,â€ he gives Barty a wink, like this is all some fucking joke.

â€œIt was Macdonald.â€

â€œYeah,â€ Evan groans again when he stands. â€œWeâ€™re aware. Not exactly subtle that one, is she?â€ he sounds almost impressed, which makes Barty want to throttle him.

â€œSo whatâ€™re we going to do about the bitch?â€

â€œNothing,â€ Regulus says coldly, bringing Bartyâ€™s attention back to him. Heâ€™s shorter than both him and Evan and yet somehow he can do this thing with his eyes where he makes you feel two feet tall.

â€œSit down and let me take care of your face,â€ he goes on before Barty can argue. â€œYou canâ€™t go to class like that.â€

Barty has no idea whatâ€™s wrong with his face, though heâ€™s fairly certain he got bitten at some pointâ€”either during the night or his mad rush through the forest. The flesh near his eyes is itchy and swollen and, of course, heâ€™s cut up too. Superficial cuts, but still. Oh, and thereâ€™s the mud. Who knew forests were so fucking filthy?

Grumbling Barty sits down on the bed in front of Reg, letting him inspect his face. â€œEvan, Snape, Mulciber, Avery, me, but not you?â€

â€œNot me,â€ Regulus confirms in a bored tone.

â€œWhy the hell is that?â€

â€œHe wasnâ€™t there,â€ Evan is leaning against the bedpost next to them.

â€œWhat do you mean he wasnâ€™t there?â€ Barty demands. â€œHeâ€™s the one who wiped her bloody memories.â€

When neither of them respond he shakes his head.

â€œHold still,â€ Regulus murmurs.

â€œWe canâ€™t just let her get away with this?â€ he blusters on. â€œShe left us naked in the fucking woods. She took my wand!â€ which, now that he thinks about itâ€¦

As though he can read Bartyâ€™s mind Regulus says; â€œOn your bed. Along with your clothes. She even folded them.â€

For some reason that makes Barty angrier. â€œThat Mudblood is gonna fucking regret this.â€

Reg only rolls his eyes. â€œThis is getting repetitive now. Try to come up with some new material Barty.â€ Barty opens his mouth to snap back but Regulus doesnâ€™t give him the chance. â€œIâ€™m gonna cast a cleaning charm first, get some of this mud off you, see what weâ€™re really working with, okay?â€

Barty glares petulantly back at him. â€œFine.â€

â€œSo gracious,â€ Regulus says flatly before waving his wand and causing a cold wave to wash over Barty. Itâ€™s not as good as old fashioned soap and water but it still feels nice, having the dirt lifted from his skin. Makes him feel more like himself.

â€œWhatâ€™s that on your face?â€ Evan tilts his head, looking down at Barty in confusion. That wouldnâ€™t be so worryingâ€”since Evan is often confusedâ€”except that Regulus is looking at him with the same expression.

â€œWhat?â€ he demands, eyes bouncing between the pair of them. â€œWhat the fuck is on my face?â€

â€œIt looks likeâ€”â€œ and then Evan starts to laugh. â€œOh my god, priceless.â€

â€œWHAT!â€ Thoroughly at his witâ€™s end he pushes past his friends and into the bathroom, hands grabbing either side of the sink as he stares into the mirror. He looks a messâ€”his face cut up, hair tangled, but none of that is what Evan is talking about.

â€œWhat the fuck,â€ he mutters, turning on the tap and aggressively scrubbing at the bright red lipstick mark on his cheek. â€œThat psychopath. I swear to Merlin I am gonna end her.â€ When water doesnâ€™t do anything on its own Barty reaches for the soap, lathering his face up before rinsing. But when he dries his face off afterwards the mark is still there, pristine as before. Not even smudged.

Barty squints at it in the mirror before starting the whole process over again. Scrubbing and rinsing, scrubbing and rinsing, scrubbing and rinsing. By the fourth or fifth time the skin of his cheek is red and angry but the lips are still there, taunting him. For some reason the sight of them causes a panic to flutter in Bartyâ€™s chest. What if she did something to him? What if theyâ€™re permanent? What if he never gets them off?

â€œWhat the fuck,â€ he repeats, ready to take his nails to it before Regulus appears behind him, grabbing hold of his wrist.

â€œWait,â€ he says, lifting his wand and casting a quick diagnostic charm that Barty barely recognizes. Reg frowns for a minute before dropping his wand. â€œItâ€™s magic.â€

â€œNo shit,â€ Barty snaps. â€œBut how the hell do I get it off!â€

Regulus only shakes his head. â€œI donâ€™t knowâ€”but your nails arenâ€™t going to do it so donâ€™t go fucking up your face anymore than you already have. Youâ€™ll just have toâ€¦wait for it to fade.â€

Before Barty can fully grasp the absolutely absurdity of that, Evan appears behind him in the bathroom mirror, taking one look at Bartyâ€™s red marked face and bursting out laughing again.

â€œNot helping Evan,â€ Regulus says, sounding weary, but Evan isnâ€™t cowed.

â€œDude,â€ he says, when he finally regains some manner of control over himself. â€œSheâ€™s fucking branded you.â€

Because heâ€™s standing in front of the mirror Barty has the privilege of watching his own eyes widen in horror. Evan might be an idiot but he is also, infuriatingly, right. That is exactly what sheâ€™s done.

He turns to Reg. â€œGet it off.â€

Regulus looks back at him with the same bored expression he almost always wears. â€œI told you, I canâ€™t. Youâ€™ll just have to wait for it to fade.â€ With that he heads back into the main room, getting his books for class.

â€œI canâ€™t wait for it to fade,â€ Barty snarls, following after Regulus with a delighted Evan on his heels.

â€œWell then, by all means,â€ Regulus slides the strap of his book bag across his chest. â€œCarve it off your face,â€ his grey eyes run Barty up and down. â€œYou never know, a scar might give you some character.â€

â€œFuck you Regulus.â€

But Reg doesnâ€™t respond, walking out the door without a backwards glance.

â€œPrick,â€ Barty hisses, running a hand through his hair and wincing as the salt of his sweat stings some of the cuts on his hands.

â€œYou reckon she got frisky with you before she dumped you in the forest?â€ Evan asks, leaning in to inspect the mark on Bartyâ€™s cheek again.

Barty growls shoving him off, which, predictably, only makes Evan laugh.

â€œDonâ€™t be disgusting.â€

â€œI donâ€™t know,â€ Evan shrugs, grabbing his own bag. â€œMacdonaldâ€™s pretty hot.â€

â€œSheâ€™s a filthy Mudblood and a fucking psychotic bitch on top of that, what the hell is wrong with you?â€ Barty can hear the slightly hysterical edge creeping into his voice but heâ€™s too far gone to care at this point.

Besides, Evan only blinks back at him. â€œStill hot.â€ And then, at Bartyâ€™s growl of frustration, he claps him on the shoulder. â€œCâ€™mon dude, we gotta go. Itâ€™s not that bad. Just play it off as a good night.â€

Barty isnâ€™t even going to touch that.

â€œWhat am I supposed to do about these,â€ he gestures to the mess of cuts on his torso. â€œThe forest turned me into a bloody pincushion.â€

Evan grimaces. â€œOooh, sorry mate, healing spells really arenâ€™t my thing. Thatâ€™s all Reg,â€ after a moment of silence in which Barty seriously considers murdering Evan, the other boy gives his shoulder another squeeze. â€œWell, see you in class?â€

â€œYouâ€™re a shit friend Evan.â€

The other boy only laughs. â€œTakes one to know one. Plus, if Iâ€™m late again Sprout will give me detention which is pretty high on my list of things I donâ€™t want.â€

â€œAbsolute shit.â€

Evan only waves at him over his shoulder, whistling as he walks out the door. You would never know that only a few hours ago heâ€™d been cursed and then dumped in a deadly forest half-naked.

Barty tries and fails to fix his own wounds, eventually giving up on healing spells and on going to class. He finds himself, still nearly naked, standing back in front of the bathroom mirror, unable to take his eyes off of the garish lipstick on his cheek.

She put her mouth on him.

The very thought sends a wave of nausea radiating through his whole body. The worst part is, she wanted this. Planned this. Wanted him to be embarrassed. Made a fool of. The faces of the students heâ€™d passed on his way back to the dorm this morning fill his mind. The snickering and staring. And there will surely be more once people see his cheek.

Barty is not a fucking joke.

He is not an embarrassment.

And he most certainly isnâ€™t some Mudblood slutâ€™s play thing.

His fingers curl around the sink, eyes wild with rage.

Heâ€™ll show her.

Show all of them.

His father.

Show them the kind of beast he can be.

Chapter End Notes

Hey-o !!!

Mary. Does. Not. Play.

I also love that when Regulus is written from James's perspective it's all "sweet angel baby, love of my life, a cinnamon roll" but when he's written from anyone else's perspective it's all "what a stone cold bitch"

ANYWAY love you all, thank you for sticking with me, we're getting closer to the end-ish (I mean ISH there's sill a bit to go but we're definitely more than halfway there) your comments and kudos are much appreciated!

Chapter 39

I hate this too.
