See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I LILY

Lily doesnâ€™t let herself get her hopes up when sheâ€™s told that McGongall wants to see her in her office. Doesnâ€™t let herself think, even for a second, about what it might mean. About why sheâ€™s being summoned. Even after McGonagall tells her, after she leaves Lily alone, kneeling in front of the fireplace, she doesnâ€™t quite let herself believe it. That sheâ€™s actually going to get to see her mum. Now. Today. Here. Doesnâ€™t believe it until the moment her face appears in the flames.

â€œMum!â€ Lily nearly reaches into the fire. â€œOh my God, Mum, hi, hello, can you hear me?â€ she laughs a little, instantly feeling some of the tension sheâ€™s been carrying around for the pass few weeks lessen just at the sight of her mumâ€™s face.

Sheâ€™s okay,

Lily tells herself.

Look at her, sheâ€™s okay.

â€œHi, Lily? Darling? Goodness,â€ her mum laughs too. â€œIâ€™ll never get used to this.â€

â€œNo,â€ Lily agrees, â€œme neither.â€ She really wishes she could hug her. Her mum gives the best hugs. â€œWhere are you?â€ Lily asks instead.

â€œUmâ€¦neighbours house, a few blocks down,â€ she gives Lily a cheeky smile, lowering her voice. â€œTurns out theyâ€™re magic too.â€

Lily smiles back. â€œImagine that.â€

â€œMinistry came by, asked them if theyâ€™d let me use their fireplaceâ€”I donâ€™t know what the Wizards call itâ€”â€œ

â€œThe Floo mum, itâ€™s the Floo. Well, the Floo Network.â€

â€œYeah, actually, youâ€™re right. I never thought about it.â€

â€œWell, anyway, Iâ€™ve kicked the poor people out of their living room so I suppose we should keep this short. Whatâ€™s going on darling? Why did you need to speak with me so badly?â€

Suddenly Lily feels incredibly silly. How exactly is she meant to explain that sheâ€™s done all this just because of a feeling in her gut that something wasnâ€™tâ€¦right?

â€œI justâ€”â€œ she starts then stops, sighing as she crosses her legs and sits more comfortably on the stone floor. â€œI was worried I guess.â€

Which is when she sees it.

â€œWorried?â€ she asks, her voice ticking up. â€œAbout what?â€

Lilyâ€™s stomach starts to squirm, the same unease she felt reading her mumâ€™s letters coming back.

â€œMum?â€ she asks. â€œWhat is it? Whatâ€™s going on?â€ She has no idea what could be wrong. She just knows something is. Something her mother doesnâ€™t want her to know. That she thinks she needs protecting from.

â€œDid something happen to Petunia?â€

â€œNo, no, of course not!â€ her mother gives a bit of a breathless laugh, eyes not quite meeting Lilyâ€™s. â€œSheâ€™s fine, weâ€™re both fine.â€

But Lily only shakes her head. She is an expert in her motherâ€™s â€œfines.â€ Sheâ€™s heard this one before. Heard it a hundred times when she stood next to her mum as people asked her how she was after he father's death. Listened to her tell everyone who came by to drop off casseroles and flowers in the months that followed that she was â€œfine.â€

â€œPlease,â€ she says, not willing to play this game. â€œDonâ€™t do this, just tell me whatâ€™s wrong yeah? I canâ€™t bear being the last one to find out again.â€

She can see her motherâ€™s struggle even through the fire. See her trying and failing to keep the polite smile on her face.

â€œOh Lily,â€ she says finally, letting out a deep breath. â€œI donâ€™t want to worry you, it isnâ€™tâ€”it really isnâ€™tâ€”â€œ her voice cuts out and she looks away for a moment, hand going absentmindedly to the chain around her neck that her wedding ring hangs on. â€œItâ€™s not worth stressing over.â€

â€œOkay,â€ Lily says slowly, wishing her stomach would stop feeling like it was trying to squeeze itself out of existence. â€œWell, if you tell me I promise not to stress about it.â€

Her mother gives her a wry smile, though it doesnâ€™t quite reach her eyes. â€œIâ€™m not sure either of us believes that.â€

â€œI already know somethingâ€™s up mum,â€ she pushes. â€œI can feel it. I can feel you hiding something from me and itâ€™s driving me mad. Iâ€™m not a little kid, you canâ€™t keep me in the dark. Itâ€™s notâ€¦helpful.â€

She can see her mother accept the truth of what sheâ€™s saying.

So she waits.

Waits for her to open her mouth again.

Waits for the other shoe to drop.

Whatever it is, she can handle it. She knows she can. If she just knows what theyâ€™re up against sheâ€™ll be able to find a way to deal with it. To fight it. Itâ€™s the not knowing thatâ€™s the problemâ€”like having her hands tied behind her back. Once sheâ€™s free sheâ€™ll be able to find a solution for whatever it is.

â€œI went to the doctor after you left for school,â€ Lily just nods, not letting her thoughts run away down the dark hole they so desperately want to. Her mother kisses her teeth. â€œI haveâ€”they found a tumour.â€

Lily blinks. â€œA tumour?â€

â€œYes.â€

â€œWhere?â€

Lily nods again, like she has any idea what that means. Sheâ€™s not even sure why she bothered asking â€œwhereâ€ when she doesnâ€™t know anything about tumours. Her mother gives her a weak smile. â€œYes, some are just lumps,â€ and then, â€œbut not this one.â€

â€œOh.â€

Oh.

Oh.

Oh.

Oh.

â€œLily?â€

And then it starts up again. Going a thousand miles an hour.

â€œAlright, thatâ€™s alright. People fight cancer all the time. There are treatments. Are you being treated? How long ago did you find this out? Have you told Petunia? â€œLily, Lily darling stop. Breathe. You need to breathe.â€

â€œI am breathing.â€

â€œLily.â€

â€œItâ€™s going to be okay,â€ her mother says soothingly, eyes brimming with concern, which isnâ€™t right at all. Sheâ€™s the one with the cancer. Sheâ€™s the one who they need to be concerned about.

â€œI know it will be,â€ Lily says when she can speak again. â€œBecause youâ€™re going to get treated and then youâ€™re going to get better. Right?â€

â€œYes,â€ her mother says eventually. â€œIâ€™m being treated, itâ€™ll help.â€

She doesnâ€™t finish that sentence.

â€œLilyâ€”â€œ

â€œItâ€™s not going to happen.â€

Â 

For some mad reason her mum tries to make small talk after that. Tries to tell Lily about Petuniaâ€™s garden and her new lawnmower that practically does all the work itself and some casserole recipe she really likes. By the time they say goodbye Lily is just about ready to explode with all the feelings trapped inside her. All the fear and confusion and helplessness. There are still months before she goes home for the summer and suddenly that feels unbearable.

Sheâ€™s still sitting on the floor when McGonagall knocks on the door nearly twenty minutes later.

Sheâ€™s meant to go to class but she doesnâ€™t. The thought never even crosses her mind. Instead she heads straight for the infirmary. Wizards donâ€™t get sick like Muggles, Lily knows that much. Knows they have spells and potions that Muggles canâ€™t even dream of. She still remembers the day that Marlene told her and Mary that sheâ€™s never had the flu.

She knows that she should probably take a moment to compose herself, that her heads a mess. Her chest. She has no idea what sheâ€™s actually feeling. She wishes she could ask her motherâ€™s doctors questions. Wishes she could take her to her appointments. Wishes she could be there for once.

This is just another thing Petunia will hold against me, she canâ€™t help but think.

Everything in her is so muddled she hasnâ€™t even had time to be angry that her mother was hiding this from her. Was she ever going to tell Lily? I mean, what the hell was she waiting for? She said herself that itâ€™s serious and she wasâ€”what? Just going to keep lying to Lily until she couldnâ€™t anymore? Until she was in the hospital or dead?

â€œMiss Evans?â€

â€œErâ€”yes, or, no. But Iâ€”can I speak with you?â€ she asks, feeling jittery and shaky and very much like she might be sick.

â€œOf course,â€ Pomfrey gestures her towards her office.

Then again.

And again.

She finds her way outside, to the lawn at the back of the school. She presses her back to the cold stone wall, fingernails chipping as they try to dig into it, to grab hold of something solid. Itâ€™s fucking freezing but it feels good, cooling the sweat on her skin.

Wake up,

She thinks.

Wake up, wake up, wake up.

Because this has to be some sort of nightmare. It has to be.

PART II MARY

It isnâ€™t fear that Mary feels as she watches Barty Crouch make a B-line for her on her way to class. If anything, itâ€™s closer to excitement. Heâ€™s been hiding from herâ€”from everyone in factâ€”which was really anticlimactic if sheâ€™s being honest. That charm on his cheek was some of her finest work and sheâ€™s been desperate to see the final product.

Crouch has clearly not been able to come up with the dissolving salve needed to take it off because heâ€™s currently covered half his face in a beige plaster that calls attention to the luridly pale pigment of his skin. Mary does her best not to laugh, but goodness it is a struggle.

â€œYou bitch,â€ he snits when he gets close enough.

â€œFuck,â€ he hisses grabbing his shoulder.

Itâ€™s not.

Obviously he didnâ€™t think this through.

Fucking amateur.

â€œYouâ€™re going to answer for this I hope you know that,â€ he threatens her impotently.

â€œGet off,â€ Crouchâ€™s words are muffled by his clear struggle to breathe. James does not get off, shockingly enough, in fact, what he does is drive his knee into the other boyâ€™s stomach.

Mary rolls her eyes, more than aware that everyone in the surrounding area has now stopped to stare and no doubt, if this continues, a crowd will gather.

â€œEnough James,â€ she says in a bored tone, though she has to admit that she does enjoy watching Crouch squirm.

â€œJames,â€ she snaps again, when he still hasnâ€™t budged, Crouchâ€™s face starting to turn a shade of red nearly dark enough to match the lipstick heâ€™s so desperate to hide. â€œWho are you fighting for exactlyâ€”me? Or yourself?â€

That finally seems to get through to him, his eyes meeting herâ€™s for the first time before he blinksâ€”like heâ€™s waking upâ€”quickly letting go of Crouch. The Slytherin collapses to the ground, on his hands and knees, coughing and hacking.

â€œOi!â€ Mary shouts at the onlookers surrounding them. â€œGet lost before I use a permanent sticking charm to attach your tongues to your elbows.â€ That seems to do the trick, people quickly averting their eyes and scurrying from the corridor as quickly as their feet can carry them. She turns her attention back to the boys in front of her, walking forward and giving Crouch a nudge with her foot.

Crouch glares up at her, tears in his eyes sheâ€™s sure he wishes werenâ€™t there, bruises already blooming across his neck. Christ, she canâ€™t help but think, James really wasnâ€™t fucking around. She is under no illusions. He isnâ€™t done with her.

â€œAre you okay?â€ he croaks.

â€œAnd you left her?â€ Mary demands indignantly.

â€œShe wanted you.â€

â€œMary?â€ James calls out before sheâ€™s turned the corner.

She looks back at him impatiently, surprised to find him looking so small. James Potter has always been larger than life, even to the people who know him best.

â€œWe shouldâ€”Iâ€”can we talk? Later?â€

Normally she would snap at him for slowing her down to ask such a stupid question, but she can feel the weight of the words. The weight of everything about him.

â€œYeah James,â€ she says. â€œWe can talk.â€

And with that she rounds the bend.

Â 

It isnâ€™t hard to find Lily once she gets outsideâ€”her vibrant red hair standing out against the grey winter around her. She has her knees drawn up, arms wrapped around them, face buried. Mary sits down next to her without hesitating, wet snow seeping through her skirt. Lily must have heard her coming because she doesnâ€™t jump, doesnâ€™t even look up, and for a long moment they just sit in silence.

â€œOkay babe,â€ Mary says eventually, knocking their shoulders together. â€œTime to tell me whatâ€™s wrong.â€

Itâ€™s another few seconds before Lily lifts her head, tilting it back against the wall behind her. She sighs, closing her eyesâ€”squeezing them shut.

â€œMy mum has cancer.â€

Mary lets that sink in. â€œThat,â€ she says finally, â€œreally fucking sucks.â€

Lily lets out a weak laugh, opening her eyes and turning to look at Mary. Exhausted. Terrified.

â€œI canâ€™t lose her too,â€ Lily whispers, like sheâ€™s afraid to say it too loud.

â€œYouâ€™re not going to,â€ Mary doesnâ€™t hesitate. Doesnâ€™t doubt. â€œI wonâ€™t let it happen.â€

Lily smiles weakly. â€œI knew youâ€™d say that.â€

â€œI mean it.â€

â€œI know you do.â€

Mary isnâ€™t sure what to say to that so instead she waits for Lily. Knows instinctively that thereâ€™s more she has to sayâ€”something else sitting on her chest. Sure enough, a few seconds later Lily sighs again, looking back out at the grounds.

â€œI went to Pomfrey.â€

â€œOh?â€ Mary asks, genuinely curious. Sheâ€™s never thought about it before, what it would mean to combine magic and Muggle medicine.

Lilyâ€™s mouth pulls tight. â€œShe said she couldnâ€™t do anything.â€

Mary sits with that, taking in Lilyâ€™s hard expression. â€œCouldnâ€™t?â€ she asks. â€œOr wouldnâ€™t?â€

Lily lets out a breath, blowing the hair from her forehead. Thereâ€™s a long pause before she speaks, eyes staring harshly at the sprawling lawn in front of them. â€œYou know, I only know about my mum because of James?â€

â€œOh yeah?â€ Mary says, going with the sudden shift in conversation, letting Lily get out whatever it is she needs to.

â€œHe wrote his mum, pulled strings, got them to set up a Floo connection.â€

â€œThat was nice of him,â€ Mary says slowly, trying to figure out where this is going.

Lily nods her head. â€œIt was. And he asked me, you know, to keep him updated on how my mum was even before I knew for sure that anything was wrong. â€œNo one deserve your truth,â€ Mary cuts in. â€œOr your pain. No matter what theyâ€™ve done for you.â€

Lily shoots her a dry smile. â€œMaybe, but it doesnâ€™t matter, because the thought of having to explain to him that my mum is sick, and that that means something different for Muggles than it does for Wizardsâ€”something more seriousâ€”the thought of explaining to him that the magical worldâ€”this place that Iâ€™m supposedly a part ofâ€”is refusing to help, the same way they always refuse to helpâ€”it was too exhausting.â€

Lily lets out a cold laugh. â€œShe said that, legally, Muggles are different. Mary canâ€™t help but wonder how Poppy Pomfrey was able to look Lily in the eye and tell her that she would rather let her mother die than help a Muggle. Fuck the law, Mary canâ€™t help but think, if you can save someone you save them. End of story.

â€œIf they wonâ€™t help us,â€ Mary says finally. â€œThen we help ourselves.â€

Mary shrugs. â€œAbsolutely,â€ she reaches over and squeezes Lilyâ€™s hand. â€œLets cure cancer.â€

PART III JAMES

Itâ€™s been a few days since he talked to Sirius on the Quidditch Pitch. Sirius and Remus have returned to the dorm, have started sitting with them again in the Great Hall. In Class. He keeps looking for answers that arenâ€™t there.

So he keeps disappearing.

Keeps running away.

Keeps pretending he doesnâ€™t know what he knows.

Some truths are too heavy to hold.

When Regulus finally does come into view James feels his whole heart lurch, like itâ€™s trying to rip itself out of his chest. I wanted a life with you.

I wanted a life with you.

â€œWhich means that either you convinced him to change his mind or he convinced you.â€

â€œLike what?â€ Regulus asks coldly.

â€œHe told you.â€

â€œI didnâ€™t lie!â€

â€œBullshit Reg, thatâ€™s bullshit. So tell meâ€”when did it happen?â€ This is easier at least, than the sadness.

â€œWhat do you want me to say James?â€

â€œMaybe it is.â€

He sounds so young.

I wanted a life with you.

Â 


He manages to get through the corridors okay. When he cuts his way across the Gryffindor common room he thinks he hears someone call his name but heâ€™s not really sure. The sound of his own pulse booming too loudly in his ears. Regardless, he doesnâ€™t look up. Doesnâ€™t stop.

He doesnâ€™t answer.

Canâ€™t.

â€œJames?â€

Itâ€™s Sirius. Of course.

â€œIâ€™m going to open the door okay?â€ Sirius says eventually. James doesnâ€™t reply but doesnâ€™t try to stop him either, listening to the sound of the door being slowly pushed open. â€œDonâ€™t be,â€ Sirius says, sounding steady. A few seconds pass and then; â€œfor what itâ€™s worth, Iâ€™m sorry too.â€

James pushes further into Siriusâ€™s side wondering when itâ€™ll stop. The crying. The pain. He isnâ€™t at all certain that it will. This heartbreak feels endless. This heartbreak eats him whole.

PART IV REMUS

Heâ€™s supposed to be doing coursework but he canâ€™t concentrate, eyes continuously going to the stairs that lead up to their dormitory. Remus has seen James upset beforeâ€”more than he would like recentlyâ€”but when he walked into the common room tonight the pain on his face was something else.

Sirius barely waited for him to get up the stairs before he was on his feet, chasing after him. Part of Remus wants to follow but mostly he knows that this isnâ€™t about himâ€”not the way that itâ€™s about Sirius and James. He needs to give them space. Let them work through it together.

So he stays behind.

Itâ€™s something heâ€™s used to.

â€œWhat do you reckon that was about?â€ Peter asks after a few minutes, nodding his head in the direction of the dorms.

Remus hesitates, dropping his eyes back down to the parchment in front of him. He keeps his voice low when he answers. â€œIf I had to guess, Iâ€™d say that James and Regulus haveâ€¦fallen out.â€

Remus feels a small ache in his chest. â€œYeah, yeah I think he was.â€

â€œSo why end things then?â€

Remus arches his brow. â€œWhat makes you so certain it wasnâ€™t the other way around?â€

â€œBecause,â€ Peter snorts, â€œif Regulus had broken up with James heâ€™d have stormed in here with some big plan to win him back. Notâ€”you knowâ€”not looking like that,â€ he nods again at the stairs. Remus reckons heâ€™s probably right.

â€œI think it just became too much,â€ he says, feeling a little uncomfortable discussing this at all. He doesnâ€™t want to gossip about their friend. Doesnâ€™t want to make assumptions about a relationship he absolutely did not understand.

â€œWhat became too much?â€ Peter asks, chewing on the end of his quill.

Remus wrinkles his noseâ€”heâ€™s always thought that was a gross habit, but heâ€™s not Peterâ€™s mum so heâ€™s not about to say anything about it.

â€œYou know, the differences between them, the war.â€

â€œI donâ€™t see why the war should matter to them.â€

He shrugs. â€œWhy would it?â€

â€œUmâ€¦wellâ€¦it kind ofâ€¦shows a lot about person. How they feel about things like that,â€ he squints at the boy across from him. â€œI mean, how could it not matter?â€

Another shrug, though thankfully this one dislodges the quill from Peterâ€™s mouth. â€œJust politics â€˜innit?â€

Remus stares back at him. â€œJust politics?â€ he repeats slowly. â€œWhatâ€”what do you mean?â€ Something uneasy has started to settle in Remusâ€™s chest.

â€œWell like, my mum votes Tory and my dad votes Labour but theyâ€™re still married.â€

Remus is thrown for a minute. â€œYour parents vote in the Muggle elections?â€

â€œSure. They think itâ€™s fun or something. Like a game. They make bets.â€

â€œI mean, they sort of are,â€ Peter says, like thatâ€™s a totally reasonable thing to think. â€œThey have their supporters, the Ministry has theirs, theyâ€™re both, yâ€™know, campaigning.â€

â€œRight, sure, except the Death Eaters â€˜campaignâ€™ by murdering people,â€ he expects to see horror in Peterâ€™s eyes when he realizes what heâ€™s just said, the comparisons heâ€™s just made, the way heâ€™s just dismissed the disgusting things the Death Eaters want. â€œSuppose,â€ is all Peter says, before he looks back down at his coursework, teeth once again going to town on his quill. â€œHey, whatâ€™d you get for number seven?â€

PART I REGULUS

After Patroclus fails to convince Achilles to fight for the Greeks.

After Achilles lets Patroclus face the Trojans without him.

The great warrior tilts his head back and asks the gods to â€œgrant that he may return unharmed.â€

Bring him back to me, he begs them.

Bring him back to me.

Bring him back.

Gods are a Muggle invention and from what Regulus can tell they are rather unreliable when it comes to keeping people safe. But then, heâ€™s not sure that magic has ever really protected anyone he loves either.

He stares at the door for a long time after James leaves.

Bring him back to me.

Bring him back to me.

Bring him back.

But Wizards donâ€™t know how to pray. And Regulus doubts the gods would listen even if they did.

Â 

He does manage to make it back to the Slytherin dorms eventually, though he isnâ€™t really sure how. His thoughts are radio static. Nothing in focus. Nothing clear. At least not until the moment he enters the common room. For some reason the noiseâ€”or the peopleâ€”something jolts him. Causing things to start becoming real all of the sudden.

Heâ€™s hyperventilating by the time he reaches the bottom of the stairs, grabbing hold of the banister for support. This canâ€™t happen here. It canâ€™t. He cannot have a fucking breakdown in the Slytherin common room. He begs his legs to move but they wonâ€™t, tries to slow down his breaths and blink away the blurring in his eyes. Heâ€™s been through so much worse than this. He doesnâ€™t know why itâ€™s taking him apart.

â€œHowdy partner,â€ says a familiarly cheery voice as Cerci comes down the stairs. Regulus can see her but only barely, partly hidden by the black thatâ€™s started to erase the edges of his vision. If he doesnâ€™t get his breathing under control heâ€™s going to faint.

â€œRegulus?â€ he hears her say, concerned.

Heâ€™s hoping no one else has noticed him. Heâ€™s not doing anythingâ€”literally not doing anythingâ€”not crying or shouting or moving. Heâ€™s hoping everyone else is too busy to see him frozen at the bottom of the stairs. To notice the wheezing noises his breath makes as he sucks it in too fast.

â€œHey,â€ Cerci is right in front of him now, voice low, â€œare you okay?â€

She reaches out to touch him and he immediately jerks back. Cerciâ€™s eyes going wide and he wants to explain to her that he just canâ€™t bear to be touched right now. That heâ€™s too raw. But when he opens his mouth, to his horror, all that comes out is a sob. He instantly slams it shut again.

â€œOkay,â€ Cerci says, somehow making it sound like this is all perfectly normal. â€œOkay, itâ€™s okay. You trying to get to your room?â€

Regulus closes his eyes briefly, so angry with himself, with his body, with his mind, for falling to pieces like this. Heâ€™s meant to be stronger. Meant to be able to put this pain in a box and act as though nothing can touch him. Leave it to James Potter to be too fucking big. To hurt too much for any of Regulusâ€™s hiding places to hold.

After a moment, teeth gritted, Regulus nods.

â€œOkay, we can do that, why donâ€™t you just look down, just focus on my feet okay? Just focus on them and nothing else. Just do what they do.â€

Regulusâ€™s eyes fly open to find a determined Cerci across from him. After a moment he nods again, dropping his head down to stare at the floor. To focus on her shoes. Her shoes and nothing else, his whole world shrinking.

She takes one step. He takes one step. Miraculously. Thankfully.

Somehow they manage to make it all the way to the door of his room like that. With Regulus just focusing on her shoes, not letting his thoughts stray. Not letting himself pay attention to rest of the world.

â€œHey Reg?â€ Cerci says softlyâ€”so softly Regulus wouldnâ€™t have thought it possible for the human voice to sound like that. â€œWeâ€™re here?â€ she says after they spend several moments standing still, Regulus not lifting his gaze.

When he does finally look at the door he feels the panic return, listening to the sounds of Evan and Barty bickering. Heâ€™ll need to get past them. Need to lock himself in the bathroom where he can lose it in peace. He knows it wonâ€™t be that simple of course, that Evan will want to talk to him, because he always wants to talk, and Barty will get growly if he hogs the bathroom for too long. He doesnâ€™t want to be around either of them but he doesnâ€™t know where else to go.

â€œGive me a minute,â€ Cerci says suddenly, causing Regulus to jump as he looks over at her. But sheâ€™s already moving, pushing through the door into the dorm room and leaving Regulus thoroughly confused.

Thereâ€™s silence for a second and then shouting. Regulus canâ€™t really make out the words, his brain still fuzzy, the sound of static still loud in his ears. After what feels like ages but is probably only ten minutes at most, the door swings open viciously and Barty marches out fuming, not even looking at Regulus as he stalks down the hallway. Following after is a much more content looking Evan, who shoots Regulus a wide grin when he sees him.

â€œGo get her champ,â€ he says, clapping Regulus on the shoulder as he passes, causing every atom in Regulusâ€™s body to scream. Luckily Evan doesnâ€™t stop, doesnâ€™t hear the way Regulus starts gasping like heâ€™s just been held under water.

PART III JAMES

James is dead on his feet. Has been for days. Maybe weeks, depending on how you think about it. He wasnâ€™t in great shape before. Heâ€™s certainly in worse shape now. He pushes food around his plate, eating some of it, leaving most of it, pretending he canâ€™t see the worried glances his friends keep sending him. Recently Remus has taken to slipping chocolates into his trouser pockets. Chocolate always makes Remus feel better after a full moon, or before one, really anytime, if James is being honest. Sirius has offered to let James borrow his leather jacket on the next Hogsmeade weekend. James knows that that jacket always makes Sirius feel grown-up and cool. And Peter, well, Peter put his rarest chocolate frog card on Jamesâ€™s pillow the other morning.

Theyâ€™re idiots. All of them.

Beautiful, lovely, incredible idiots.

He wishes he could thank them.

Wishes he could pretend he was alright just so they would stop looking so worried. But he justâ€¦canâ€™t quiteâ€¦manage it. Right now every day feels like bleeding out. He swears heâ€™s leaving pieces of himself on the walls and floors. Pooling in his bed. He keeps waiting for the wound to heal but every morning it tears itself open again, when he thinks about Regulusâ€™s laugh or his eyes or the way he feels tucked into Jamesâ€™s sideâ€”warm and asleep and safe.

He pushes his plate away, the boys talking about somethingâ€”Quidditch maybe, heâ€™s not sure. He reaches for the water jug, hating that his hands are shaky, hating that he feels sick and weak even though he is well aware that he is neither of those things. He takes a long drink, focusing on the feel of the water going down his throat, the coldness. Sometimes this helps, to shrink the world to a single sensation or actions. Makes it all easier to bear.

Thatâ€™s when he makes the mistake of looking up. Across the hall his eyes snag on cold grey. Regulus, standing right inside the door, staring at him. James feels his breath catch the moment their eyes meet. He expects Regulus to look away but he doesnâ€™t. And suddenly the world is out of focus except for this boy. James feels himself half rising out of his seat. He isnâ€™t even thinking heâ€™s justâ€”pulled.

I love you.

I love you.

I lover you.

I miss you.

I miss you.

I miss you.

I donâ€™t know how to do this without you anymore. I donâ€™t know what Iâ€™m supposed to look forward to without you.

â€œMind if we join?â€

Jameâ€™s head instantly snaps back to the table as he drops into his seat, no one seeming to have noticed that heâ€™d risen at all.

â€œOf course,â€ Remus says as Mary, Marlene and Lily sit down with them, Lily across from James.

â€œMorning,â€ she gives him a weak smile.

â€œErâ€”â€œ he shifts slightly, looking over her shoulder. But heâ€™s met with an empty space. Regulus is gone. â€œSorry,â€ he mutters, swallowing down his disappointment, trying not to let it show as he shoots Lily a pathetic imitation of his own smile. â€œMorning.â€

Chapter End Notes

I'm sorry it's so late!

But I think it's actually a surprisingly sweet chapter no? Honestly, writing Marlene was so fun, like a nice breath of fresh air from all the angst!

Anyway, hope you liked it, love you all!

Chapter 41

Chapter Summary

"We've been waiting for you"

PART I JAMES

Time passes.

James focuses on Quidditch.

On his exams.

Sometimes he sees Regulusâ€”across the Great Hall, walking through the corridorâ€”he tells himself theyâ€™re coincidences, that he isnâ€™t looking for him. That he isnâ€™t purposely hanging around Regulusâ€™s classes or the hallways he knows he likes to take. Not that it matters. Regulus never sees him and James never says anything. They pass one another like strangers.

He talks to Regulus all the time in his head. He tells him about stupid things that donâ€™t matter, or things he thinks Regulus would find funny. He tells him that he misses him. That he loves him. He tries to stop but he canâ€™t, until eventually it feels like every thought he has is part of a one way conversation. Sometimes he imagines scenarioâ€™s where they run into one another or get forced into detention togetherâ€”somewhere that they have no choice but to talk. And for some reason that changes things, and suddenly Regulus decides to leave Slytherin and sleep in Jamesâ€™s bed every night and come home with him at the end of the year.

Sometimes he hates Regulus a little bit. But only a little. Only on his worst days. When he lies awake at night and wishes he could rip the heart out of his fucking chest.

â€œOi, captain hurry up!â€ Sirius shouts from downstairs. â€œYouâ€™re gonna be late for your own bloody game!â€

â€œI know, I know!â€ James is frantically tearing through his things, looking for his Quidditch gloves. Dragon hyde, brown, water resistant, and with a grip thatâ€™s to die for. â€œWhere the fuck did I put them,â€ he curses, yanking open the drawers in his bedside table.

He starts throwing things on the floorâ€”the map ends up on his bed, some old quills clinking as he tosses them aside, a few letters from his mumâ€¦

â€œWhere in the fuck,â€ he grumbles, now really starting to get annoyed. He yanks open the second drawer with such force that something heavy from the back slides forward, nearly falling out.

James freezes.

Itâ€™s a wooden box, shoved to the back during one of his many temper tantrumâ€™s over the past few months.

For a moment he just stares at it, unable to move, or breathe, or think. His life has become a series of minefields. Faces he canâ€™t see and words he canâ€™t hear and things he doesnâ€™t want to touch.

Slowly, he picks the box up, sinking onto the bed beside him as he holds it in his lap. The world suddenly shrinking. Becoming quiet. Reduced to no more than a tiny red ball. Carefully James takes it out, feeling the magic humming between his fingers. And there, when he turns it just rightâ€”

J & R

The sight of their initials entwined together sends a feeling so painful through his chest that James actually whimpers, fingers clutching more tightly around the ball.

Fuck.

This is not what he needs.

Not right now.

Not before the final Quidditch match of the year.

Not before he has to face him on the field.

â€œCâ€”â€œ his voice comes out strangled and choked and he has to stop, clearing his throat. â€œComing!â€ he manages on the second try. He throws the box back in its drawer, slamming it shut. Sometimes itâ€™s like he gets so sad he gets angry. Like he just wants to break everything. Heâ€™s never felt like that beforeâ€”never been the type to punch walls.

Itâ€™s scary if heâ€™s being honest.

Heâ€™s not sure where its come from.

Or how to handle it.

He knows Sirius has noticed. Remus. Peter. Knows it scares them too.

James closes his eyes, exhaling, trying to calm himself down. He canâ€™t lose it right now, there are people counting on him. His parents have come for fuckâ€™s sake. He tries counting, that helps sometimes.

He hears the sound of feet on the stairs and quickly stands up, shoving his hands in his pockets to hide the fact that theyâ€™re shaking. â€œYeah, sorry, canâ€™t find my fucking gloves.â€

â€œFuck it. I donâ€™t need gloves to crush Slytherin.â€

Jamesâ€™s favourite kind.

That last sentence hurts in a way that itâ€™s not supposed to. Because what she means is that his father doesnâ€™t care if he wins. PART III MARY

Mary Macdonald prides herself on many things, but first and foremost is her ability to slip out of a boyâ€™s dorm room with exceptional stealth, and, if she may say so herself, poise. Itâ€™s early, the sun only just warming up the sky, streaking pink and orange across the corridor as she makes her way back to Gryffindor Tower from the Hufflepuff dorms. She stops by the kitchens on her way, grabbing a quick bite to eat since she fully intends to sleep through breakfast.

An older girl taught her a spell for freshening up her make-up back when she was in second year. She knows one for hair too but thereâ€™s something about â€œjust-shagged-hairâ€ that Mary actually rather likes. She peeks at her reflection in one of the windows she passes and smirks. She hopes she runs into someone before she gets back to her room because she is looking unbelievably hot at the moment and it would be a shame if no one else got to see it.

Of course, she regrets that thought as soon as she hears the nasally voice calling out behind her.

â€œOi slut!â€

Mary rolls her eyes. â€œAre you stalking me now Barty? This really is getting pathetic.â€

She doesnâ€™t turn around but she does slide her wand into her palm. She knows whatâ€™s coming next. She can feel it. He wonâ€™t want to waste time, not after what happened before. Not now that theyâ€™re alone.

â€œPetrificâ€”â€œ

â€œExpelliarmus,â€ she snaps before he can finish. His face clouds over and he steps closer, jabbing his finger at her. â€œDonâ€™t you dare speak of him.â€

Mary bats her eyelashes. â€œWhy ever not? I hear he has loads to say about me.â€

â€œYou fucking wish.â€

â€œOh but he does,â€ she goes on in a sickly sweet voice. â€œMudbloods are ruining this, and Mudbloods are tarnishing that, and oh the Mudbloods are going to steal all our magic.â€

â€œShut your fucking mouth.â€

Mary actually laughs. â€œIâ€™m sorry, what exactly is it that I said that is so offensive to you?â€

He growls, eyes burning with rage. â€œItâ€™s your disrespect.â€

â€œMy disrespect?â€ she asks. â€œAnd who exactly am I meant to respect,â€ her eyes run him up and down. â€œYou?â€

She should see it coming. She doesnâ€™t. But she should.

In the blink of an eye Barty moves, one hand grabbing her by the throat and the other taking hold of her arm, slamming her wrist into the stone wall behind her until the wands fall from her hand. She struggles against him until his grip on her throat tightens. Mary has never been properly choked before, never gasped for breath and found none there. The burning fear it sends through her whole body is overwhelming. But Barty doesnâ€™t let up, pinning her to the wall and squeezing, squeezing, squeezing.

Heâ€™s too big for her to throw off, especially like this. Heâ€™s not even that strong but heâ€™s still stronger and she canâ€™t use her fucking wand, canâ€™t level the uneven biological playing field.

â€œListen cunt,â€ he snarls, close enough that she can feel his spittle on her cheek. â€œI know you feel real safe, but one day you and your friends will have to leave this place, and when we meet outside these walls things are gonna be different.â€ He tightens his fingers and Mary is pretty sure sheâ€™s screaming. â€œWhen we meet in the real world I am going to royally fuck everything you care about, and I am going to make you watch while I do it, make you witness the carnage before I cut you open and spill you out at the Dark Lordâ€™s feet.â€

She canâ€™t breathe.

Canâ€™t breathe.

Canâ€™t breathe.

Jesus it hurts, her lungs are fucking burning. She didnâ€™t know suffocating would feel like this, like someone set her chest on fire.

Her vision is bouncing around, in and out of focus, but she still sees it, the moment he leans forward and god she wishes she had the strength to do something. Anything. Wishes she could turn away. But all she can do is watch as he presses his mouth to the exact spot she left the lipstick mark on his cheek.

When he pulls back there is a sick glint in his eyes. â€œYou will never be rid of me,â€ he says in a low voice. And then, just as her vision becomes more black spots than anything else, his hand disappears.

Mary crumples to the ground, gasping and choking, lungs trying to suck in air too fast for their own good. The world spins, her body shaking like there are earthquakes under her skin.

Distantly, she hears Barty laugh as he walks away.

PART IV REGULUS

Regulus doesnâ€™t see James after the Quidditch match. Heâ€™s no longer in the hallways outside of his classrooms, or mysteriously walking down to the Great Hall at the same time as him in the mornings. It hurts more then it should, losing those small moments of connection. Knowing that James is slowly letting him go more and more.

In his weaker moments Regulus imagines walking up to the Gryffindor common room and demanding to see him. Or crossing the Great Hall and kissing him senseless right there in front of everyone. Theyâ€™re ridiculous thoughts of course, but he holds onto them anyway.

For the first time in his life thereâ€™s some sense of relief when he crosses the threshold of Grimmauld Place. Unlike Hogwarts these walls are not a reminder of everything he has lost. Of the life he pretended he could have. They are his reality. His past present and future. That used to hurt more, used to make him feel trapped, used to make him want to scream. But heâ€™s had his taste now, of the light that exists outside these walls, maybe he can finally let it go.

â€œCome in,â€ his mother says flatly when he knocks on the door of her study. â€œAh,â€ her eyes flick up and then back down to the parchment in front of her,â€œyouâ€™re back.

â€œYes,â€ he says, shoulders pulled down and hands clasped behind him. â€œI wanted to speak with you.â€

Walburgaâ€™s eyes flick up again, pausing slightly longer this time as though trying to read his thoughts. He knows she isnâ€™t actually trying to read them of course, he would feel it if she was. She turns back to her papers, scribbling for a few more minutes before she eventually places her quill down and gives him her undivided attention.

â€œYes, go on. What is it Regulus?â€

For a moment, just a moment, the words stick in his throat.

I love you Regulus.

I love you Regulus.

I love you.

He coughs. â€œI donâ€™t wish to return to Hogwarts next year.â€ Walburga raises her brow so Regulus quickly continues. â€œI believe Iâ€™ve learned all I can there, and Iâ€™m ready to commit myself fully to the Dark Lord. To take my place at your sides.â€ Why bother pretending anymore? This is the path he has chosen. The one he was born for. The one he deserves. No reason to torture himself anymore with the person he wishes he was.

After a few seconds of silence Walburga rises from her chair and it is only years of training that keeps Regulus from flinching as she draws near, thin, pale fingers reaching for his face, cradling it in her palms.

He is terrified.

But he does not pull away.

And then, she does something he never expected, something heâ€™s not sure heâ€™s ever seenâ€”she smiles.

â€œOh my son,â€ she says, voice nearly soft. â€œWeâ€™ve been waiting for you.â€

Chapter End Notes

Hello lovelies!

If fics had season finales this would be the season finale of this fic, everything kind of changes after this point so prepare yourselves!

â€œI saw you in his head,â€ she says, nails piercing Jamesâ€™s skin. â€œHe tried to hide you from me but I saw. Heâ€™d been looking at some ridiculous photo his brother left behind, he pretended his interest was Sirius but in his head all he saw was you.â€

â€œAliceâ€”â€œ

â€œYes. PART II LILY

PART III REGULUS

He stumbles a bit as he Apparates onto the stoop of his parentsâ€™ house. The inside is empty, though the windows are all thrown open, letting in the sweet summer air and causing the long white curtains to flutter in the breeze like wings. Itâ€™s been almost a year since his parents first moved to Scotland permanently and yet somehow the place still feels deserted.

The action is in London, at Grimmauld, with its never ending stream of people always coming in and out. Regulus never would have thought that his mother would willingly step away from all thatâ€”willingly remove herself from the centre of power and politics. But then, heâ€™d forgotten that thereâ€™s always been one thing sheâ€™s loved more than the family name or the Pureblood cause.

Her husband.

Orion is too weak and too sick for the mess that is Grimmauld Place. So he moved out here. And three weeks later, unable to be so far away from him, Walburga followed. Sometimes Regulus will catch them together, more now than ever before, maybe because his father is nearer to dying, and his motherâ€™s face will be almost soft, her hand in his, her voice a whisper, and it will render Regulus speechless. Frozen in awe. He doesnâ€™t know who that woman is who tends so diligently to his dying father. He just knows heâ€™s never met her. Knows sheâ€™s never deemed him worthy of her care.

Of course, today, his father is alone.

â€œPapa?â€ he calls out softly as he enters his fatherâ€™s bedroom. Brighter and fresher than the one heâ€™d had in London, with a view of his garden, which Regulus knows he likes.

Orion is thinâ€”the thinnest heâ€™s ever beenâ€”his pallor so far past pale he now looks vaguely blue, veins lighting up his arms and face. He has no hair left and his hands shake so badly that he canâ€™t hold anythingâ€”canâ€™t write letters or bring food to his mouth.

His fatherâ€™s eyes blink open, face lighting up when he turns to find Regulus at his side. â€œMon rayon de soleil,â€ his voice rough like sandpaper. He reaches out a shaking hand to cup Regulusâ€™s face. â€œI didnâ€™t know you were coming today.â€

Regulus smiles back. â€œI know, sorry, bit unexpected.â€

His father kisses his teeth. â€œNe dit pas dÃ©solÃ©, every day I get to see you is a good day, you know this.â€

He does. It eats him up sometimes, when he isnâ€™t able to get away from the city for a few days. Terrified every second that heâ€™s going to get the message that his father has died and he hasnâ€™t been able to say goodbye. To hold his hand. To tell him that he loves him.

â€œHave you seen your maman? She was meant to be back by now,â€ his father lets his hand drop, too weak to hold it up for long. Itâ€™s years of practice that allows Regulus to keep his expression blank.

â€œThatâ€™s why Iâ€™m here, she got held up so sheâ€™s going to be back later. Orionâ€™s eyes grow wide with concern. â€œShe is alright, your maman?â€

â€œYes, of course,â€ Regulus smiles, taking his fatherâ€™s hand and squeezing. â€œYou know her, she canâ€™t leave anything half done, has to see everything through to the end, make sure itâ€™s all done right.â€

His father smiles back. â€œThat is certainly true.â€

Regulus nods, desperate to change the subject. â€œSo,â€ he says, giving his fatherâ€™s hand another squeeze. â€œAre you okay?â€

His father scoffs at the question. â€œOf course. I am dying, but I am okay.â€ From anyone else that answer would have been sarcastic, but not his father, who faces death with so much brevity that Regulus sometimes wonders if he wants it.

Sometimes wonders the same thing about himself.

It is a strange dichotomy he has found. To fear dying so profoundly and yet at the same time wish he was dead on a near daily basis. Regulus shakes his head, clearing it of its morbid thoughts.

â€œRight, well, besides dyingâ€”are you hungry? Thirsty? Cold? Can I get you a book or play some music? A blanket?â€

His father lets out a breath that might have, years earlier, been a laugh. â€œNon, mon chou, j'ai seulement besoin de toi. Talk to me for a while?â€

His father manages a proper laugh now. â€œOh young love, it never ceases to entertain. Tell me more.â€

And so he does.

Â 

Regulus stays far longer than he means to. Than he should have. Eating dinner with his father and then waiting until he falls asleep before leaving. Hopefully Walburga will be back in Scotland before he wakes up and heâ€™ll be none the wiser to the minor crisis that occurred today.

A man nearly runs into Regulus on his way through the front door of Grimmauld Placeâ€”he doesnâ€™t recognize him but that isnâ€™t uncommon. â€œExcuse me,â€ the man muttersâ€”or maybe not a manâ€”now that he speaks he sounds young, closer to Regulusâ€™s age, though itâ€™s hard to know for sure since he has a scarf wrapped around his face and the hood of his cloak pulled up. He doesnâ€™t even stop long enough to close the door behind him. Regulus rolls his eyes.

â€œRude,â€ he mutters under his breath as he closes and locks it for good measure.

The top floor is blissfully quiet. For the first time in his life he is glad that his parents stashed him so far away.

He closes the door behind him, shucking his jacket onto the bed and pulling out his wand.

â€œExpecto Patronum,â€ he mutters, barely even thinking about it. Itâ€™s just habit by now. Thereâ€™s a burst of light and then out of his wand gallops a stag.

â€œHello boy,â€ he says as the phantom beast rubs his head affectionately against Regâ€™s shoulderâ€”both there and not there at the same time. The animal stamps his hooves happily before he starts puttering around the room, never able to stay still. Regulus gives him a fond smile.

Heâ€™s not sure how it started exactly, just that one day he tried, just to see if he could still do it. He dragged up the memories he kept so carefully tucked away, placed them at the forefront of his mind for the first time in ages and watched the beautiful thing they created fill up his room. The feeling that the spell causes in his chestâ€”the warmth, and comfort andâ€¦completenessâ€”heâ€™s become a little addicted to it. Addicted to the manifestation of his happiest memories.

With his Patronus now happily milling about his room Regulus starts pulling newspapers from his bag. Heâ€™s collected three todayâ€”one is even Muggle. He flips through the pages, snipping out the relevant articles with his wand.

Itâ€™s a distraction more than anything else, a puzzle to focus on as apposed to whatâ€™s really going on around him. What heâ€™s really doing. He looks at it like courseworkâ€”a school project. Heâ€™s always been good at those.

The newspapers help him piece together what the rest of the Wizarding world knows, what the Muggles know, and also, occasionally, the locations of certain Death Eaters that he hadnâ€™t been made aware of. He isnâ€™t sure what heâ€™ll do with this information. Likely nothing. But he keeps looking for it anyway. â€œIâ€™m shocked.â€

â€œStop wasting my time Narcissa.â€

â€œOh like youâ€™re so busy,â€ she sneers.

â€œIâ€™m sorry, do you want my help or not?â€

Regulus continues to stare at her. â€œOkay?â€

â€œI would assume theyâ€™ve prescribed you fertility potions then?â€

â€œSo whyâ€¦â€

â€œI was hopingâ€¦you could make themâ€¦stronger.â€

â€œMaybe you donâ€™t,â€ Regulus says before he can stop himself.

â€œI will be the one taking care of this child, Iâ€™ll raise him, heâ€™ll be so loved Regulus, I promise. It wonâ€™t be like it wasâ€¦â€ she lets that sentence die.

â€œI donâ€™t want any part in this,â€ he says finally. â€œYou wanna risk your health with an overly potent potion make it yourself.â€

â€œDonâ€™t you think Iâ€™ve tried?â€ she says, sounding close to tears. Regulus hasnâ€™t seen her cry since they were kids. â€œIâ€™m not good enough, I donâ€™t know anyone who is other than you. â€œSh, sh,â€ he says to the animal, not taking his eyes off his cousin as he places a hand on the back of the stagâ€™s neck. â€œItâ€™s okay, weâ€™re okay.â€

â€œMerlin, I fucking hate that thing,â€ Narcissa snaps as she rubs quickly at her eyes, getting rid of any evidence of moisture there. As though Regulus hasnâ€™t already seen. As though she hasnâ€™t already laid herself bare for him.

For a long while neither of them say anything.

When Narcissa eventually lifts her eyes heâ€™s shocked by the naked pain they hold. â€œPlease Reg,â€ she begs in a weak voice. â€œI donâ€™t know what will happen to me if I fail at this.â€

And oh, isnâ€™t that a fear Regulus knows too well.

His stag crowds closer to him, maybe sensing his distress, the warmth and comfort that always wafts off of him calming Regulus.

â€œHave they threatened you?â€ he asks.

She lets out a dry laugh. â€œLucius needs an heir, and I am worthless to everyone if I cannot produce oneâ€”including to my parents. This is not a good time to be without allies. Not when people so easily go missing.â€ She tilts her head back, closing her eyes and letting her shoulders roll forward. Regulus has never seen her look so defeated. â€œBesides, I want to be a mother. I want to be one so badly.â€

It is moments like this, when Regulus knows heâ€™s weak.

Weak and pathetic and probably lonely.

Because despite it all, heâ€™s always liked Narcissa best. Always thought of her as a sister. A replacement, after Sirius left. Thereâ€™s a part of her, maybe smaller than Regulus, but still there, that doesnâ€™t fit the way he doesnâ€™t fit. That is miserable the way he is miserable. Not that thatâ€™s ever meant anything. Sheâ€™s never been there when he needed her. And he knows that if their places were reversed she would have already thrown him out of the room.

Itâ€™s hard for him to tell, what is normal and what isnâ€™t. What is right and what is wrong. He has no barometer for any of it, that was broken in him a long time ago. He thinks this is probably wrong. But then, Narcissa needs help. Her life may depend on it. And Regulus knows that he can help her. More than that. Worse than that. He wants to.

Maybe sheâ€™ll love you then.

Like a real family.

He knows that isnâ€™t what will happen. Yet the childish hope persists.

â€œOkay,â€ he says finally, even though it feels like swallowing broken glass. Like a betrayal of every part of himself. â€œIâ€™ll do it.â€

Sheâ€™s moving before he even blinks, he thinks sheâ€™s going to hug him but she stops just shy of touching himâ€”maybe because of the angry stag at his side.

â€œThank you Regulus, thank you, thank you, thank you.â€

He looks away. He doesnâ€™t feel good about this.

â€œWhen can you have it ready?â€ she asks, voice strained.

â€œItâ€™ll take a week to brew. But I was serious about it being dangerous, there are so many potential side effects to taking a potion with an increased concentration.â€

â€œItâ€™s worth it,â€ Narcissa says without pause. Regulus canâ€™t help but think of the conversation theyâ€™d had years earlier, about the half-blood she could have fallen in love with, but who she gave up, to do what was expected of her. Was that worth it? He wants to ask.

â€œCome find me in a week then,â€ he says eventually, when he canâ€™t think of anything else. Out of the corner of his eye he sees Narcissa nod, straightening out her robes before heading towards the door.

â€œDo you know why?â€ her voice causes him to jumpâ€”he hadnâ€™t been expecting her to speak again. Turning his head he finds sheâ€™s stopped at the door, eyes on his Patronus. He waits for her to explain herself but she doesnâ€™t.

â€œDo I know why, what?â€

â€œWhy a stag.â€

Regulus blinks before turning to the animal at his side. â€œI donâ€™t know, is there supposed to be a reason?â€

Narcissa rolls her eyes like thatâ€™s the dumbest question sheâ€™s ever heard and Regulus would be annoyed if he werenâ€™t kind of relieved to see her return to her normal snotty self.

â€œOf course it means somethingâ€”itâ€™s meant to represent some part of you. But a stag? Big, brutish animal that goes crashing into things head first? Itâ€™s not clever or deviousâ€”â€œ

â€œIs that how you see me?â€ Regulus asks, mildly amused despite himself. â€œClever and devious?â€

Narcissa arches her brow. â€œIs that not how you see yourself?â€

Maybe, Regulus doesnâ€™t really know. He does his best, most days, not to see himself at all. To disassociate. Pretend that he isnâ€™t real. That none of it is real.

â€œHeâ€™s strong though,â€ Regulus doesnâ€™t know why he feels the need to defend his Patronus but he does. â€œAnd brave.â€

â€œWhat are you a bloody Gryffindor?â€

Regulus pulls a face that makes Narcissa laugh. â€œBoy after my own heart,â€ she says, laughter dying down and leaving them in silence once more.

â€œThank you,â€ she says eventually, and far too earnestly for Regulusâ€™s comfort. â€œReally.â€

He nods. â€œOkay.â€

â€œIâ€™ll see you next week?â€

â€œNext week.â€

This time he watches her leave, the door closing poignantly behind her. He turns to his stag, finding its big, kind eyes already on him. His hand hovers on the top of his headâ€”not resting but still touching.

â€œI donâ€™t know why I have you,â€ he whispers, even though no one is around to hear. â€œBut Iâ€™m glad I do.â€

It might be a trick of the light. But he swears he sees the stag smile.

Chapter End Notes

**Translations in order** : "Mon rayon de soleil" = My ray of sunshine
"Ne dit pas dÃ©solÃ©" = Don't say sorry
"Non, mon chou, j'ai seulement besoin de toi" = No, my darling, I only need you

Oh, wow, hi, hey, hello there!

So I have no patience for writing things that I don't immediately find interesting and thus we have time travel. The future = more drama and more fun.

This chapter is a lot of setting up where they're at two years in the future so I promise there will be more action in the ones coming up. And yes, Regulus and James will meet again!

Thank you all as always, hope this wasn't too much of a shock (or disappointment) !

Chapter 43

Chapter Summary

I've missed you.

Chapter Notes

TW: Referenced child abuse

PART I SIRIUS

Remus isnâ€™t home when Sirius gets back from the Ministry. Selfishly, Sirius is angry about that. Not really at Remus, mostly just at the universe. Itâ€™s late afternoon and Sirius has an itch under his skin that wonâ€™t go away. He paces around their flatâ€”actually starts doing chores if you can believe itâ€”anything to keep his hands busy. His mind. He doesnâ€™t finish any of them thoughâ€”canâ€™t stick with one task for too long before the thoughts start crowding in.

When Sirius was a kid, before Hogwarts, before he had a wand, his mother used to lock him in his room sometimes. When he misbehaved. When she had guests over. When she was tired of him. Now, really, all things considered, that wasnâ€™t so bad. His room was, like every room in Grimmauld Place, fairly large and decadent, in a creepy gothic kinda way. The problem was, sometimes she would leave him there for hours. He would try calling out for her. For his father. For Regulusâ€”though he would have been too young to be of any help anyways. But no one would ever answer.

Not knowing when he would be let out again. Thinking heâ€™d been left, abandoned, forgotten. Thatâ€™s what made the walls start to close in. What made his ribs strangle his lungs. Made his eyes sting. Itâ€™s not that Sirius canâ€™t be alone. Of course he can. Itâ€™s just that on his bad days the silence and the emptiness start to eat at him. And some childish voice screams inside his head;

Theyâ€™re never coming back.

Theyâ€™re never coming back.

Theyâ€™re never coming back for me.

He wants to go out but he knows that if he does heâ€™ll end up doing something stupid. End up drunk or arrested or both. Itâ€™s not that he minds really but then Remus will be angry with him and Sirius doesnâ€™t want that right now. Doesnâ€™t want to get his attention that way. He just wants him to be here. So he stands at the door, with his jacket and boots on, for a good ten minutes before growling and turning back into the flat.

The dishes are half-washed, the floor half-hoovered, the laundry half-dried. All his partial cleaning has left the place in a right state and none of it has bloody helped. Sirius feels like crawling up the goddamn wallsâ€”an army of ants living under his skin, driving him mad. Well, madder. He throws on some music, blasts it as loud as it will go. His fingers drum on every surface they can reach, feet tapping and legs bouncing.

Itâ€™s ten oâ€™clock at night before he starts getting really worried. Before he stops being able to rationalize this. Because Remus is an eighty-year-old man in a twenty-year-oldâ€™s body and he never stays out this late. Hell, he barely stays awake this late, always falling asleep on Siriusâ€™s shoulder or in his lap.

Sirius has been putting off calling James and Lily because he didnâ€™t want to seem needy, or desperate or fucking controlling. As though he needs his boyfriend to be around all the time incase he has an emotional crisis. He was afraid that they would see in his eyes how much heâ€™s struggling today, how much Walburga got to him even though he didnâ€™t even fucking see her. He doesnâ€™t give a fuck anymore though. They can see whatever they like. His moony is missing. And heâ€™s scared.

â€œPads?â€ James answers. He looks tired.

â€œHey, uhâ€”is Rem there? With Lily or you or something?â€

James blinks, waking up a little. â€œNo, I havenâ€™t seen him since this morning.â€

Something icy drips down Siriusâ€™s spine. â€œCan you ask Lily if sheâ€™s heard from him?â€

James nods, turning his head over his shoulder; â€œLily, can you câ€™mere?â€ James shouts before turning back to Sirius. â€œHe didnâ€™t come back?â€

â€œBack?â€ heâ€™s currently doing his best to keep his breathing at a regular pace.

â€œHe was meeting with Dumbledore.â€

â€œRight,â€ Sirius knew that, because Remus always tells him where heâ€™s going and what heâ€™s doing and Sirius never remembers and never returns the favour because heâ€™s a selfish asshole.

James looks like heâ€™s about to say something else but at that moment Lilyâ€™s voice cuts in; â€œWhatâ€™s upâ€”oh, hey,â€ and then sheâ€™s kneeling down, the smile slipping from her face when she takes in Siriusâ€™s expression.

â€œHave you heard from Remus today?â€ James asks her, not wasting time. To her credit Lily looks only mildly surprised by the question.

â€œNo, not all day, why?â€

â€œFuck,â€ Sirius curses before he can stop himself.

Her eyes are back on him, flooded with concern. â€œWhatâ€™s going on?â€

â€œNo ones seen him since he Flooed this morning,â€ James explains. â€œHey Pads, did you call Peter?â€

Sirius swallows around the rock in his throat. â€œNo.â€

â€œOkay, you do that and weâ€™ll call Marlene and Dorcas, see if theyâ€™ve heard anything. Then weâ€™ll come over, alright?â€

He nods numbly, hating the new feeling of foreboding building in his stomach. People go missing almost every day now, what ifâ€”

â€œSirius,â€ Jamesâ€™s voice brings him back, his gaze intense even through the fire. â€œWeâ€™re going to find him. Heâ€™s going to be okay.â€

â€œYeah,â€ Sirius says, because heâ€™s not about to argue.

â€œWeâ€™ll see you soon.â€

Sirius takes a deep breath, shaking on the exhale. He needs to get it together, they donâ€™t even know that anything is wrong yet. Heâ€™s freaking out for no reason. Itâ€™s because of his mother, she put him on edgeâ€”set him offâ€”everything is too much right now.

He breathes in and out a few more times before calling Peter.

Nobody answers.

He tries again.

Nobody answers.

â€œWhat the fuck Peter!â€ he shouts at the empty fireplace. â€œWhere the fuck are you?â€

â€œMarlene and Dorcas were there but they havenâ€™t seen Remus since last night,â€ James says flatly.

â€œFuck it, Iâ€™m going to Hogwarts,â€ he grabs his jacket, half-expecting one of them to protest. To tell him itâ€™s too late, to wait until morning. He doesnâ€™t find it comforting when neither of them do. It means they donâ€™t think heâ€™s overreacting.

I love you.

â€œYou canâ€™t just come marching in here!â€ the old caretaker says indignantly.

Sirius has been back to Hogwarts a few times since graduating but it never feels less jarring. And Sirius will be so angry with him. Heâ€™ll be fucking furious. â€œThe wards?â€ James speaks first, framing the words as a question though Sirius doesnâ€™t quite understand what heâ€™s asking until Dumbledore answers.

â€œObviously,â€ he says, like itâ€™s nothing. A given. That James would never let Sirius be alone. Always.

â€œThank you,â€ Sirius finds himself blurting out, startling James if his expression is anything to go by. Thereâ€™s a moment of silence before James reaches over and squeezes his shoulder.

â€œOf course,â€ and then; â€œNow, help me with this bookshelf yeah?â€ James shoots him a small grin as he nods his head at the furniture in question.

PART II REGULUS

â€œHey buddy!â€

Regulus looks up at the sound of Evanâ€™s voice only to find he isnâ€™t talking to him, but to his Patronus. Regulus snorts as he watches his friend awkwardly try to pet the phantom stag. Evan is the only one who doesnâ€™t seem to mind Regulusâ€™s new obsession.

â€œDo you think he would fetch my wand if I threw it?â€ Evan asks.

Theyâ€™re in what was once the cellar of Grimmauld Place and is now a fully operational potions lab. Somehow, Regulus has found himself acting as the Dark Lordâ€™s pharmacist. Blood replenishers? Truth serums? Poisons? Polyjuice? Regulus brews all of it. It started as an accident really, he justâ€¦knew how toâ€¦and now itâ€™s somehow turned into a near full-time occupation.

â€œHeâ€™s a stag not a dog,â€ Regulus says, peering into one of the three cauldrons currently boiling in front of him.

Itâ€™s not a particularly important position, not high ranking, not sought after. Bellatrix has taken to calling him â€œthe cookâ€. But the truth is, Regulus likes it. He likes using his brain. Likes being left alone. Likes not seeing the faces of the people he helps kill.

â€œHe needs a name,â€ Evan goes on, unperturbed.

Regulus rolls his eyes, moving on to the next potion, he stirs it a few times before deciding it needs more mint. â€œCerciâ€™s already named him,â€ he grumbles, because quite frankly, he thinks naming his Patronus is going just a step too far. Evan, on the other hand, seems absolutely tickled by the idea.

â€œNo way? Greengrass? Go on then, whatâ€™d she name him?â€

Regulus sighs, resigned. â€œBoo.â€

â€œAhhh!â€

Regulus snorts. â€œNo, she named him Boo.â€

Evanâ€™s brow furrows. â€œBoo?â€

â€œBoo.â€

â€œLike B-O-O?â€

â€œThe very same.â€

PART III JAMES

The Order is meeting at Cardoc Dearbornâ€™s house today. Dumbledore likes to keep the locations of the meetings new, only ever giving them out the day of, for security purposes. James has never been to Dearbornâ€™s house. Heâ€™s one of the older members of the Order and his home is in the suburbs outside of London and covered in portraits of his ancestors. The Dearbornâ€™s are a rather old and well known family and so theyâ€™re all very lofty and chatty and donâ€™t seem to at all appreciate the large crowd now attempting to fit itself into the sitting room.

James is leaning against the windowâ€”the only part of the house that doesnâ€™t appear to have a face stuck to itâ€”Lily is perched on the arm of the sofa next to him, Sirius standing with his arms crossed over his chest on his other side. Itâ€™s been a week now, with no word from Remus, no idea where heâ€™s gone or whatâ€™s happened except that Dumbledore, presumably, had something he needed him to do. James has spent most nights at Remus and Siriusâ€™s flat. He knows his best mate. Knows how he gets when heâ€™s alone. Especially with Walburga being allowed to walk free.

But Regulus only shakes his head. â€œThereâ€™s a spy,â€ he says quickly, eyes darting around like heâ€™s worried just saying those words out loud will bring them out of the shadows. â€œSomeone on your side has been turned and if they hear it was me itâ€™ll get back to the Dark Lord. â€œSomeone on our side has turned?â€ he demands, not believing it, not wanting to believe it. â€œWho?â€

â€œRegâ€”â€œ

â€œReally I donâ€™t, Iâ€™d tell you if I did,â€ he laughs at himself. â€œIâ€™d tell you anything, you know that.â€

Two years.

â€œThe Dark Mark is still on my arm James,â€ he says.

â€œYou saved my life.â€

He smiles sadly at him. â€œIt doesnâ€™t mean anything.â€

â€œYeah,â€ Regulus yells back, staring at James the whole time. â€œAll clear down here. Lets go.â€

And then heâ€™s gone. Back on his feet and running up the stairs before James can think to react.

James feels all kinds of not good. All kinds of lost and confused and hurt. His wand is still warm from where Regulus was holding it. Because Regulus was here. Right here, right in front of him. His eyes trail over to the body on the floor a few feet away. Regulus saved his life.

He hears footsteps upstairs, pulling himself further into the shadows as he watches figures pass overhead through the hole in the ceiling, the sound of the front doorâ€”or whateverâ€™s left of itâ€”banging open. He holds still and focuses on his breathing, not moving even when the noise stops and the shop goes still. He counts to a hundred three times, fighting the urge to run up the stairs. He needs to be sure theyâ€™re gone.

Eventually he gets to his feet, wand in his hand and raised as he steps over the dead body and the rubble. When he gets to the top floor he feels a new fear start to grow inside himâ€”that any minute heâ€™ll round the corner and find Marlene lying there, dead.

â€œLumos,â€ he hisses, because the place is basically pitch black and the last thing he wants is to go falling through the floor back into the basement.

â€œMarlene?â€ he hisses, walking through the ruins. â€œMarâ€”â€œ

â€œOh thank Merlin!â€ James starts as Marlene bursts out of the shadows, throwing her arms around him and sending him a little off balance. â€œI thought you were dead,â€ she mumbles into his shoulder. â€œThey said you were dead and Iâ€”god, Iâ€™m so glad youâ€™re okay.â€

He wraps his arms around her, holding her tight.

â€œSame here,â€ he says, surveying the damage over the top of her head. He sighs. â€œMoodyâ€™s going to kill us.â€

James squeezes her again and then winces as a sharp pain shoots up the right side of his body. â€œHey Mar?â€

â€œYeah?â€

â€œI think Iâ€™m gonna have to go to St. Mungos.â€

She nods, pulling back, looking at him for the first time. â€œJesus, yeah, your face looks like it was hit with a beaterâ€™s club.â€

He laughs. â€œThanks Mar.â€

She starts tugging him towards the street. â€œCâ€™mon, will Apparate outside, contact the others from the hospital.â€

James nods, happy to be led, without any immediate danger heâ€™s really starting to feel the effects of being tossed around like a rag doll. Heâ€™s unsteady on his feet and vaguely woozy, fairly certain heâ€™s only barely hanging onto his consciousness.

â€œWait Mar,â€ he slurs when they get out outside. â€œBeforeâ€”I donâ€™t want to forgetâ€”thereâ€™s a spy.â€

â€œThereâ€™s a spy, someone on our side has been turned. We need to tell Dumâ€”â€œ and suddenly, in his half-conscious state, something clicks. â€œHe knows,â€ James hisses nonsensically, black dots starting to take up a good portion of his vision.

Thatâ€™s the last thought James has before the world goes dark.

Chapter End Notes

Hello beautiful people!

I have lost track of days so I don't know how late this chapter is but I feel like it is pretty late so I apologize!

Also, unrelated, but you know that part in "my tears ricochet" where T. Swift is all "And I can go anywhere I want, anywhere I want just not home" ? That's what I hear in my head every time I read the bit where James and Regulus run together and hug. Cause they're each others homes (sobs for eternity) and also I am a giant sap.

ANYWAY! Thank you for being here and being your wonderful selves, hope you have a great day!

Chapter 44

Chapter Summary

This one's going to hurt.

Chapter Notes

TW: Referenced Sexual Assault / Threatened Sexual Assault (There's a moment in this chapter where it feels like things are going to escalate, I want to reassure you that they don't but also warn you that it feels that way because I know that even that is a little intense and triggering so be careful, it's in Part III)

TW: Death (This one hurts, it's at the end, so again, y'know, take care of yourselves)

ALSO I just want to throw this out there before you yell at the screen / me (hi!) this fic is canon compliant but it's also an interpretation of canon so sometimes I mess around with things, specifically in the coming chapters I play around with the order in which things happen a little bit

**FRENCH TRANSLATIONS IN THE END NOTES**

See the end of the chapter for more notes

PART I SIRIUS

He's on his way out. James is on duty with Marlene and his flat is empty and terrible and he doesnâ€™t even care if he does something stupid because, quite frankly, Remus can go fuck himself. He listens to the sound of the lock clicking, watches as the door handle turns. He tells himself he has no idea whoâ€™s on the other side, that he should get his wand out, get ready for a fight. Because it could be anyone. But he doesnâ€™t.

Remus stops halfway across the threshold looking, Sirius thinks, unreasonably shocked to see him considering he lives here. If anyone should be looking shocked itâ€™s Sirius.

After what happened at the shop, after seeing Regulus again, James had worried that things with Lily would beâ€¦different. But they arenâ€™t. He still feels the same rush of warmth when he sees her. Seeing Regulus hasnâ€™t dulled what he feels for Lily. What it has done, is make clear to him that being with Lily hasnâ€™t dulled what he feels for Regulus. And that is a truth he doesnâ€™t know what to do with. Surely youâ€™re meant to love one person and then another, not two people at the same time? What he feels for Lily is so strong, so warm and comforting, that heâ€™d just assumed it meant he no longer felt anything for Regulus. At least not in that way. â€œMum,â€ his legs give out, heâ€™s on his knees now, hands still holding her up. â€œPlease, please, oh, please donâ€™t. Please donâ€™t. Iâ€™m sorry, Iâ€™m sorry,â€ he doesnâ€™t even know what heâ€™s saying anymore words just coming out of him. â€œMumâ€”I canâ€™tâ€”I needâ€”please.â€

â€œSirius.â€

â€œWe have to get her to Mungos,â€ he says, not taking his eyes off of his mother, still holding onto her fiercely. â€œMaybe they canâ€”they can fixâ€”they can help. There has to be something they can do.â€

â€œPeople are coming,â€ Sirius says calmly. â€œPeople are coming, okay James?â€

â€œNo, no, no she canâ€™t, she canâ€™t. I need her. I need her. Oh my god, oh my god, oh my god,â€and suddenly heâ€™s sobbing, his whole body shaking as Sirius wraps him in his arms.

Wake up.

Nothing kills Euphemia Potter. Sheâ€™s a force. Sheâ€™s unstoppable. She loves us too much to die.

Wake up.

Wake up.

Chapter End Notes

**FRENCH TRANSLATION**

"As I was walking by the clear fountain, I found the water so lovely I had to bathe. I've loved you for so long, I will never forget you"

"Under the oak's leaves, I lay and dried. On the highest bough, a nightingale sang. I've loved you for so long, I will never forget you. Sing, nightingale, sing, you who has a joyous heart. Your heart is made for laughing... mine can only cry. I've loved you for so long, I will never forget you." (song: Ã€ la claire fontaine)

Hello beautiful people!!!

LISTEN. The Dragon Pox thing will be addressed okay. It will. I promise there won't be another time jump or anything, what happened to Euphemia and Fleamont is gonna be explored in the next chapter. Like I said at the beginning I'm sort of reinterpreting canon in a way that I think tells a better story (in my opinion, I'm not saying it actually IS better). Also I know that technically they die after Lily and James's wedding but I am ignoring that fact, hopefully that doesn't bother too many people, but I apologize if that's a big issue for anyone.

THANK YOU all for being so sweet and supportive with the comments and Kudos and messages and everything it's truly so so so incredible I cannot even describe it to you. Hopefully this chapter wasn't a let down and also hopefully you're doing okay wherever you're at, sending you all the warm fuzzies!

PART I EUPHEMIA

March 1960

Oh no.

No.

Euphemia has been here before. Been here too many times.

â€œNo, darling, no please,â€ she whispers, hand placed protectively over her stomach as another pain rocks through her body.

Sheâ€™s losing her baby.

Sheâ€™s losing her baby again.

Even in her head that thought sounds like a sob.

Grimacing she stands up, feeling something wet on her thighsâ€”blood. Itâ€™s always blood.

â€œMimi!â€ she calls out as loud as she can manage, wobbling over to the fireplace and gripping the mantle. Thereâ€™s a crack and the house elf appears at her side, looking up with great concern.

â€œCan you go to Mr. Potterâ€™s office please,â€ she says with difficulty. â€œTell himâ€”tell himâ€”â€œ her eyes close briefly. â€œThat Iâ€™m going to St Mungoâ€™s. Heâ€™ll know whatâ€™s happened,â€ theyâ€™ve been through it enough.

The house elf nods. â€œMistress is certain she doesnâ€™t want Mimi to come with her?â€

She offers the elf a tight smile. â€œIâ€™ll be alright, but thank you.â€

The elf nods before thereâ€™s another crack and she disappears. After a few laboured breaths Euphemia throws some floo powder into the fire and steps through. Sheâ€™s in too much pain to Apparate.

Euphemia Potter has always dreamed of being a mother. She wants a dozen children, wants a house filled with chaos, with the sounds of little feet pitter-pattering across the floors and little voices giggling and little hands getting themselves into trouble. Sheâ€™s made lists of the things she wants to show her children and the places she wants to take them and the important things she wants them to know. Sheâ€™s so ready for this. Has been for years. Decades.

It never occurred to her that it would be this hard.

That her body was a place where nothing could grow.

The miscarriages seem endless. Each heartbreak leaving her and Fleamont a little less hopeful. Theyâ€™ve tried everythingâ€”every potion and charm and talismanâ€”nothing seems capable of giving them a child. But this time.This time really had been different. She had never carried a baby this long before.

When she gets to St Mungo's sheâ€™s ushered into a private room. Mediwizards run their diagnostics and promise her the Healer will be with her shortly before leaving her alone. Euphemia sits upright in bed, arms cradling her whale of a stomach as she tries not to cry. Instead she closes her eyes, taking in deep breaths and making a list of all the things in her life that make her happy. She tries to remember that this moment will not last forever and this pain will fade eventually even if that seems impossible right now.

â€œI love you so much,â€ she whispers. â€œEven if this is all the time we get to have together I want you to know that I donâ€™t love you any less,â€ her voice quivers ever so slightly but she comforts herself with the knowledge that no one is around to hear it.

A few minutes later the door flies open and Euphemia looks up to see her frazzled husband blustering into the room. Wild brown hair flying aboutâ€”itâ€™s longer than it ever has been before, well past his ears and on its way to his shoulders. It makes him look young.

â€œSorry,â€ he gushes, coming to her side and kissing the top of her head as he wraps his arm around her. â€œI came as soon as I could.â€

â€œItâ€™s alright, not as though thereâ€™s much to do now,â€ she gives him a watery smile and watches pity fill his eyes.

â€œOh my love,â€ he says, hands coming to gently cup her face. â€œThis is not the end. Weâ€™ll try again.â€

Those words are a knife in her heart. â€œNo Iâ€”I think this is it for me Monty.â€

Confusion flits across his face. â€œWhat?â€

She bites her lower lip, hoping to stop its trembling. â€œI canâ€™t do this again. Itâ€™s too hard.â€

Fleamont looks genuinely shocked, mouth opening and closing several times as words fail him. She feels so guilty. He would have been such a wonderful father.

â€œEffieâ€”â€œ

But at that moment the Healer enters the room and Fleamont cuts himself off. Effie straightens her posture, fixing her face. She can have a good cry about this once sheâ€™s home, alone, locked in a bathroom, the shower running so Monty canâ€™t hear. Thatâ€™s how sheâ€™s managed it all the other times.

The Healer looks up from her clipboard and smiles. â€œHello Mrs. and Mr. Potter, Iâ€™m Healer Hathaway, Iâ€™ll be attending you today. Everything seems to be progressing rather nicely so far. This is your first child correct?â€ her eyes are a warm brown and they bounce between Euphemia and Fleamont, waiting for an answer.

â€œIâ€”Iâ€™m sorry,â€ Euphemia screws her face up, trying to understand. â€œWhat did you just say?â€

Healer Hathawayâ€™s bright expression flickers for a moment. â€œI asked if this was your first child,â€ she looks back down at the pages in front of her. â€œThereâ€™s no note here about any previous births but itâ€™s possible the Mediwizards missed something.â€

Fleamontâ€™s hand has found herâ€™s and he gives it a strong squeeze. â€œAre you saying,â€ Euphemia tries but her voice cuts out so she has to cough and start again. â€œAre you saying Iâ€™m having a baby?â€

Now the Healer looks quite visibly confused. â€œYes? Youâ€™re in labour. Didnâ€™t youâ€¦know that?â€

â€œA living baby?â€

â€œIâ€™m sorry, I feel like weâ€™ve missed something here. Did no one care to mention to you what would be happening at the end of your pregnancy?â€ the Healer asks.

â€œWeâ€™re having a baby,â€ he whispers back, leaning forward to kiss the top of her head again, and then her temple, her cheek, her nose. â€œWeâ€™re having a baby,â€ he presses his forehead to herâ€™s and for a moment they just stay like that, Euphemia feeling as though she has a dozen stars trapped in her chest, sparkling and glowing and burning bright.

Eventually she pulls away, wiping quickly at her cheeks before turning back to the Healer. â€œSorry,â€ she laughs a little again. â€œWhat were you saying?â€

â€œUhâ€¦â€ the Healer looks between them, like sheâ€™s debating asking for an explanation before eventually seeming to decide itâ€™s none of her business. â€œWell, now that we seem to be on the same page, Iâ€™d like to perform a physical examination, see how dilated you are and then weâ€™ll go from there, alright?â€

â€œLike I said,â€ Monty is looking down at them with unbridled fondness. â€œA brat.â€

â€œOur brat though.â€

â€œOur monster.â€

â€œLike his mother then.â€

She turns her head, kissing his hand as he starts pulling away. â€œI love you too.â€ The baby on her chest gurgles as if in agreement and it nearly has Effie in tears again, though she expects sheâ€™s allowed a few obscene displays of emotion under the present circumstances.

â€œThis feels right doesnâ€™t it?â€ Monty says after a small pause. Somehow she manages to pull her eyes away from her baby to look up at him.

PART II JAMES

1979

His mother is dead.

She was dead before they got there.

Poison.
