â€œI meantâ€”â€œ Regulus cuts himself off, scrubbing at his eyes. â€œWhat are you doing here?â€ his voice shakes.

â€œShamelessly ogling you.â€

â€œNoâ€”stop itâ€”stop,â€ heâ€™s shaking. â€œYou canâ€™t be here.â€œ

â€œReg,â€ Jamesâ€™s voice goes soft and it makes every part of Regulusâ€”every thought and feeling and memory that makes him upâ€”crumble to dust.

â€œNo,â€ he shakes his head. â€œTell me this isnâ€™tâ€”this isnâ€™t real. You canâ€™t be here.â€

â€œReg,â€ he sounds closer but Regulus canâ€™t open his eyes.

â€œI did the right thing,â€ his voice wobbles.

â€œI know.â€

â€œYou were supposed to be okay. I did the right thing, dangerous and stupid, but I did it so that you would be okay. You were supposed to be okay.â€

Regulus doesnâ€™t know how he can be struggling to breathe when he doesnâ€™t even have a pulse.

â€œReg,â€ in that same soft voice. â€œLook at me?â€

â€œNo.â€

â€œPlease?â€

â€œGo away. Please go away. Please donâ€™t be here. Donâ€™t be here. James you shouldnâ€™t be here. You were having a baby.â€

â€œHad himâ€”well, Lily had him if weâ€™re being technical about it.â€

â€œThis isnâ€™t funny.â€

â€œReg,â€ he sighs. â€œPlease look at me?â€

He doesnâ€™t want to. He really doesnâ€™t. So he has no idea why he does, but then, heâ€™s never been able to control himself with James. The garden comes back into focus, Jamesâ€™s eyes colliding with his.

And his heart,

the one that doesnâ€™t beat anymore,

doesnâ€™t even exist really,

hiccup,

hiccup,

hiccups.

James offers him a gentle smile. â€œThere you are.â€

Regulus is still shaking his head. â€œJust this once,â€ his voice breaks, â€œI wanted to be the one to catch you.â€

If James is confused he doesnâ€™t show it, instead he opens his armsâ€”an invitation. Regulus launches himself forward, surprised to find James so solid. So sturdy. So real. His fingers tangle in Jamesâ€™s shirt. Heâ€™s desperate not to let him go. Heartbroken he has him at all.Â 

â€œIâ€™m so proud of you,â€ James whispers, kissing the top of Regulusâ€™s head. â€œYou were so brave.â€

â€œIt didnâ€™t matter.â€

â€œIt mattered. Reg, of course it mattered.â€

A pained noise comes from Regulusâ€™s throat as he pulls James closer, like he wants to slip inside his skin. Maybe he can. He hasnâ€™t quite figured out the rules of this yet.

â€œIf it had mattered you wouldnâ€™t be here.â€

Thereâ€™s a pause, Jamesâ€™s hands running up and down his back. â€œIt mattered,â€ he says. â€œIt mattered to me.â€

Regulus is sobbing. He doesnâ€™t care. He doesnâ€™t care anymore. He isnâ€™t even real. He isnâ€™t even him. He can cry.

â€œRegulus,â€ James says softly.

â€œI donâ€™t want you to be dead,â€ his words thick, spoken into Jamesâ€™s chest. He isnâ€™t sure why it still hurts so much. â€œFuck I donâ€™t want you to be dead.â€

â€œYeah well, Iâ€™m not particularly thrilled about you being here either,â€ and then; â€œYou promised Reg.â€

That feels like a sucker punch, and Regulus actually has to pull back. Recovering from the hit. Finding Jamesâ€™s eyes.

James Potter. Looking at him.

Looking.

Looking.

Looking.

It never stops feeling monumental.

â€œI meant it,â€ Regulus finally manages. â€œI meant to come back. I swear I did.â€

Those words drift between them for a moment, setting down roots, growing vines that sneak up their legs, that slip between their ribs. Jamesâ€™s hand slides up Regulusâ€™s neck, cupping his face.

â€œI love you.â€

I love you.

I love you.

Regulusâ€™s whole body reacts, quivering under the impact. Eyes fluttering closed.

â€œJe tâ€™aime.â€

Since I was eleven.

Jamesâ€™s lips press against his.

And he isnâ€™t even real.

Isnâ€™t even here.

Isnâ€™t even him.

But oh how he feels. Warmth filling him up, breaking him open, pulling him apart. Itâ€™s too much. Too much. And not nearly enough. Everything thatâ€™s been keeping him in falls away. Regulus is boundless, intertwining with James, the pair of them nothing but ash. Nothing but dust. Nothing but love.

Love.

Love.

The garden disappears.

Â 

Â 

â€œHello?â€

Lily steps into her childhood home, all the windows thrown wide open, curtains fluttering in the warm breeze. Itâ€™s too bright to be able to see anything outside but white light. She pushes cautiously further into the house, vaguely aware of the distant sound of music.

â€œHello?â€

Two little girls run down the stairs and nearly bowl her over, laughing and giggling, their hair whipping behind them like capes. Lily tries to keep up with them but loses them down the corridor. The music growing louder.

Haven't felt like this, my dear

Since can't remember when

It's been a long, long time

Light slips through the cracks in the floors and the walls, leaking in like water. It makes everything sparkle and glow, Lily cutting through the beams as she makes her way into the kitchen and startles to a stop.

Her mum has her head tilted back, laughing as her dad twirls them around the room. The sun makes them look almost golden. She watches, letting the music swell, filling her up. They look young, her parents. Or maybe they just look happy.

Every few seconds, out of the corner of her eye, she swears she sees the two girls again. Giggling. Chasing one another. But as soon as she turns her head theyâ€™re gone.

â€œHello bug.â€

Lilyâ€™s attention snaps back to her parents, theyâ€™ve stopped dancing, their gazes finally finding her.

She tries to speak, but when she opens her mouth nothing manages to come out. All her words failing her. There might be tears on her cheeks, she canâ€™t tell.Â 

â€œOh, darling.â€Â 

The next second theyâ€™re on either side of her, holding, hugging, kissing her temple, the top of her head.

â€œIâ€™ve missed you so much,â€ her voice a wreck.

â€œWeâ€™ve missed you too.â€

â€œItâ€™s alright. Itâ€™s alright.â€

They fall into one another.

Swallowed by the light.

Â 

Â 

Regulus grips the broom tightly in his handsâ€”doesnâ€™t know where it came from, where he came from, doesnâ€™t know where he is, but it hardly matters. He speeds through the air a little recklessly.

Heâ€™s always loved going fast.

The wind whips the hair out of his face as he drops towards the ground, falling, falling, falling. And then, at the last second, pulling up.

A laugh tumbles out of his mouth before he can help it, his whole body singing. Which is why it takes a moment for him to realize that someone else is laughing too. And clapping. He looks down and finds his father beaming up at him. Orionâ€™s dark hair tied in a ponytail at the back of his head, his eyes twinkling as they follow Regulusâ€™s descent to the ground.

â€œPapa,â€ he stumbles off his broom and towards a man he hasnâ€™t seen in yearsâ€”strong and tall, his cheeks full, towering above Regulus.

â€œThat was spectacular, mon chou. You are an artiste huh? An artist in the sky.â€

Regulus only shakes his head. â€œYouâ€™re here.â€

â€œOui, pour toi. Je veux te voir voler. Rien ne m'apporte plus de joie que de te voir dans le ciel, mon chÃ©ri.â€

His father reaches out for him, large hands gently holding either side of Regulusâ€™s face, his eyes wet. â€œIâ€™m sorry I didnâ€™t visit,â€ Regulus says in a small voice. â€œI didnâ€™t know how.â€

Orion only smiles, leaning down and kissing his forehead. â€œPlus de regrets, dâ€™accord? Pas ici.â€

Regulus nods, swallowing. â€œNot here,â€ he whispers in agreement, closing his eyes.

Â 

Â 

Lily laughs as James tickles her sides, the pair rolling around in the fourposter bed, curtains drawn, the only light coming from their lit wands that theyâ€™ve already lost somewhere in the sheets.

â€œStop it! Stop!â€ Lily giggles, shoving and pushing at him. James must have thrown his glasses off at some point because he isnâ€™t wearing them now, hair a mess as he grins down at her.

â€œOr what?â€ he asks, voice husky. â€œWhatâ€™re you gonna do Evans?â€

Jamesâ€™s eyes dip down to her mouth a second before he takes it. And Lily opens for him, lets him in, swallows the groan that punches out of him when she arches her back.

â€œI thought you were casting it?â€

â€œHow did I not know you snogged Gilderoy?â€ Marlene asks through a mouthful of crips. Sheâ€™s lying on her back on the floor of the girlâ€™s dormitory, Dorcas leaning against the bed beside her, Lily on top of it. Everything is a little fuzzy. A little soft. Like theyâ€™re watching an old movie.

More than once James finds Regulusâ€™s eyes trailing over to them. Finds his own eyes trailing over to them. James lifts Regulusâ€™s hand to his mouth, kissing each of his fingertips, his knuckles, enjoying watching Regulus fight back a smile.

â€œYes,â€ he says finally. â€œWe did, after all.â€

â€œIn another hundred years then,â€ Regulus says. â€œThere will be another pair of idiots.â€

â€œSpeak for yourself, Iâ€™m well clever.â€

James grabs hold of Regulusâ€™s wrist yanking him on top of him. Chest to chest, nose to nose. Regulus holds himself up on his elbows, James staring at him. â€œYou suffer me just fine,â€ the older boy says finally. Quietly.

And Regulus canâ€™t help it, he kisses him. The corner of his mouth, the hinge of his jaw, the side of his neck. James holding still and letting him.

Regulus isnâ€™t surprised it took so long for this room to be found again.

The dining table in the Potterâ€™s cottage is covered in food and surrounded by people, music playing in the background. Lily Evans, Dorcas Meadowes and Marlene McKinnion all crowd around one corner, laughing and shouting. James sits beside Lily, his father across from him, Gideon and Fabian Prewett at the other end arguing over the bread rolls. Regulus stands at the back door, on the threshold, watching. Unable to make himself move. To shake the feeling that he doesnâ€™t belong here. James looks so at ease, so happy, sitting with the people he lovesâ€”Regulus doesnâ€™t want to ruin it. The truth is, the pair of them were always better in the dark. Meant for secret rooms and cupboards and hideaways. They could never stand-up to the scrutiny of the light of day.

â€œAre you waiting for an invitation?â€

â€œBecause you can have one,â€ she gestures towards the table when he doesnâ€™t speak. â€œHeâ€™s been waiting for you.â€

Regulusâ€™s eyes go automatically to James who has just snatched something off of Lily Evanâ€™s plate, earning him a smack to the arm. Regulus stares, likely for too long, before looking back at Euphemia.

â€œDo you know?â€ he whispers, throat tight.

She tilts her head, eyes going soft. â€œIâ€™m afraid there are many answers to that question.â€

Regulus nods, because sheâ€™s right, and because it gives him a little more time before he has to speak again. â€œWhat I did,â€ which probably isnâ€™t more helpful. He forces himself to look at her, somehow hold her gaze. â€œWhat I did to you?â€

â€œAh,â€ she says knowingly. For a second neither of them speak and then: â€œYouâ€™re quite talented, you know. It takes great skill to brew a potion that can get past Fleamont Potter.â€

Regulus hisses like heâ€™s just been burned, taking a step back. â€œI shouldnâ€™t be here.â€

Euphemia looks at him, eyes far too much like her sonâ€™s for Regulusâ€™s comfort. â€œDo you want to be here?â€ she asks finally.

Another gut punch. â€œYes,â€ itâ€™s his dirty secretâ€”wantingâ€”heâ€™s supposed to know better than that.

â€œWell then,â€ she offers her hand to Regulus whoâ€™s so startled by the gesture that he actually takes it. â€œCâ€™mon,â€ she gives him a light tug but Regulus doesnâ€™t move.

â€œHow can youâ€”â€œ thatâ€™s all he manages to work into his mouth. Euphemia giving his hand a squeeze. Maybe sheâ€™s a mindreader because she seems to know exactly what he means.Â 

â€œIâ€™m not in the habit of blaming children for the actions of adults.â€

Euphemia smiles sadly at him. "I know, youâ€™d barely started,â€ she looks over at the table. â€œNone of you got much of a chance at all.â€ For a moment the sadness on her face truly breaks his heart, but then she shakes it off, expression lighter when she turns back to him.

â€œYou have a choice, to come in or to stay out. To face it or to runaway. You said you wanted to be here?â€

â€œI do,â€ Regulus says before he can stop himself.

Smiling slightly she leans forward, still holding his hand. â€œThen be brave Regulus Black. And come inside.â€

Which is how Regulus finds himself being lead through the Potterâ€™s dining room, finds himself sitting on Jamesâ€™s other side, at a table full of people he knows heâ€™s wronged. He wants to run away. To hide. To pluck those memories out of him one by one. But he doesnâ€™t, and when James smiles at him itâ€™s almost worth it.

â€œHi.â€

â€œHi.â€

â€œIâ€™m so happy youâ€™re finally here.â€

Regulus swallows. â€œYeah,â€ he manages. â€œYeah me too.â€

Â 

Â 

Memories, and feelings, and thoughts, bumping into one another, struggling to find the light. To stay there. They crumble and rebuild, blurring the lines between one another. The past, the present, the hundreds of futures never touched, never given life, all thrumming through them. Alive. At once. And separately. And all of the time.

The sun and the stars and the storm.

Orbiting around one another.

Above. Below. Watching.

â€œItâ€™s sad,â€ a voice in the void, â€œthat we will never grow old together.â€

In and out of one another, leaving traces behind.

â€œBut canâ€™t you see it? Donâ€™t you know?â€

Warmth that bleeds into every corner of the universe.

â€œThat oh from us, so much will grow.â€Â  Â 

Chapter End Notes

** Yes, for you. I want to see you fly. Nothing brings me more joy than to see you in the sky, my darling
** No more regrets, okay? Not here.

Thank you <3
